Name: Burning Ember
Description: A small burning ember launches from your pointing finger. You must succeed on a ranged touch attack with the ember to deal damage to a target. The ember deals 1d3 points of fire damage. This spell cannot catch objects on fire.

Name: Cauterize
Description: This spell deals 1 point of fire damage to the touched creature and reduces any bleed damage the character is suffering by 2. Additionally, this cauterization stabilizes the target if it is dying and bleeding out. Creatures that do not take fire damage from this spell do not gain the beneficial effects either.

Name: Electric Jolt
Description:
A white-hot electric spark dances on your fingertip and then bolts toward your target.
You release a small stroke of electrical energy. You must succeed on a ranged touch attack with the ray to strike a target. The spell deals 1d3 points of electricity damage.

Name: Sonic Snap
Description: You create a brief but loud noise adjacent to the target. The subject takes 1 point of sonic damage and must succeed on a Fortitude saving throw or be deafened for 1 round. This spell has no effect if cast into the area of a silence spell.

Name: Spark
Description: You can make an unattended Fine flammable object catch on fire. This works as if you were using flint and steel except that you can use spark in any sort of weather and it takes much less time to actually ignite an object.

Name: Amplify
Description: You need to hear what’s going on. A hand motion or two, and the voices become louder to your ears.

Name: Anarchic Water
MaterialComponents: 5 pounds of powdered iron and silver worth 25 gp
Description: This transmutation imbues a flask (1 pint) of water with the energy of chaos, turning it into anarchic water.

Name: Bonded Spurs
Target: Your bonded companion acting as a mount
Description: This spell increases your bonded companion’s base land speed by 40 feet so long as it’s acting as a mount. This adjustment is treated as an enhancement bonus.

Name: Burning Disarm
Target: Held metal item of one creature or 15 lbs. of unattended metal
Description: This spell causes a metal object to instantly become red hot. A creature holding the item may attempt a Reflex save to drop it and take no damage (even if it is not their turn), otherwise the hot metal deals 1d4 points of fire damage per caster level (maximum 5d4). Circumstances that prevent the creature from dropping the item (such as a locked gauntlet) mean the creature gets no saving throw. The heat does not harm the item, and it does not get hot enough or last long enough to ignite flammable objects. The item cools to its previous temperature almost instantly. If cast underwater, burning disarm deals half damage and boils the surrounding water.

Name: Burning Gauntlet
Description: Bristling shards of red-hot rock surround your fist.

Name: Burning Grasp
Description: Your successful melee touch attack deals 1d6 points of fire damage per caster level (maximum 5d6).

Name: Burning Hands
Description: A cone of searing flame shoots from your fingertips.

Name: Burst Bonds
Target: One object or creature restraining you
Description: You blast your restraints, dealing 1d6 points of bludgeoning damage per caster level to the target object (maximum 5d6), ignoring hardness of 10 or less. A Fortitude save halves the damage, although only magical restraints receive a Saving Throw.

Name: Catfall
Description: You recover instantly from a fall and can absorb some damage from falling. You land on your feet no matter how far you fall, and you take damage as if the fall were 10 feet shorter than it actually is. This spell affects you and anything you carry or hold (up to your maximum load). The force of your impact on anything you hit while falling is not reduced.

Name: Catsfeet
Description: As you complete this spell, you feel as lithe and quick as a cat.

Name: Cheat
Description: At one point during the duration of this spell, you can attempt to alter the outcome of a game of chance. This spell can affect only nonmagical games, such as those using cards or dice. It cannot affect a game involving magic, nor a magic item involved in a game of chance (such as a Deck of Illusion). Whenever a dice roll is made to determine the outcome of the game, a character under the effect of this spell can demand a reroll and take the better of the two rolls.

Name: Clarion Call
MaterialComponents: A tiny piece of brass
Description: The subject of this spell gains two benefits. First, the affected creature gains the ability to create a sound like the blast of a mighty horn or trumpet simply by miming the action of sounding one. Second, the subject can speak in a booming voice that carries easily over great distances, lowering the DC of any check to hear what is said by –15. This spell is particularly prized by battlefield commanders and champions who wish to make themselves clearly heard or gain the attention of their allies or foes.

Name: Detect Fire
Focus: A lens of fire agate worth 10 gp
Description: You can sense the presence of fire and heat. The amount of information revealed depends on how long you study a particular area or subject.

Name: Endure Heat
Description: A creature protected by endure heat suffers no harm from being in a hot environment. The target is treated as if it had Fire Resistance 10 for the purposes of determining its level of protection against hot environments. This means that the creature can typically exist comfortably in conditions as hot as 100 degrees Fahrenheit without having to make Fortitude saves.

Name: Firebelly
MaterialComponents: A small bit of coal
Description: A magical fire warms your belly, granting you fire resistance 5 and making your gut warm to the touch (but not enough to damage you or anything else). As a standard action, you can breathe a 15-foot cone of flame that deals 1d4 points of fire damage (Reflex half, SR applies). Each time you use this breath weapon, reduce the remaining duration of the spell by 1 minute.

Name: Flamespike
Duration: Until the end of your next turn.
Description: When you cast this spell, flame ripples around your weapons, ready to strike out.

Name: Giant's Fist
Description: You transform one of your hands into the mighty fist of a giant, gaining a +6 enhancement bonus to Strength for the purpose of attack rolls, grapple checks or breaking and crushing items with that hand. In addition, you gain the ability to make one natural slam attack, dealing 1d6 points of damage your new Strength bonus (or 1-1/2 times your Strength bonus if you make no other attacks in that round). You can make the slam attack as a natural secondary attack, with the normal -5 penalty, as part of a full attack action. However, you cannot gain more than one slam attack per round with this spell due to a high base attack bonus.

Name: Horn of Pursuit
Description: You create the sound of a large hunting horn, blowing up to three notes as loud as a roaring dragon. These notes can be heard up to 2 miles away in typical outdoor conditions. You can make these sounds at any point during the spell’s duration as a free action, and each sounding can be short or long, allowing you to send very simple coded messages.

Name: Incite
Description: You cast this spell and your opponents are swallowed in a spiral of sparkling motes that urge them to act.

Name: Lesser Orb of Electricity
Description: The air crackles around your outstretched hand and the smell of ozone assaults your nostrils as a ball of electrical energy, its surface crackling with bolts of lightning, streaks from your open palm.

Name: Lesser Orb of Fire
Description: Your hand heats to an uncomfortable temperature just moments before you release the spell’s energy in the form of an orb of flames speeding from your outward facing palm.

Name: Lesser Orb of Sound
Description: An orb of sonic energy about 2 inches across shoots from your palm at its target. You must succeed on a ranged touch attack to hit your target. On a successful hit you deal 1d6 points of sonic damage plus 1d6 points of sonic damage per two caster levels above 2nd level (up to a maximum of 5d6 at 10th level).

Name: Lightningspike
Duration: Until the end of your next turn.
Description: When you cast this spell, electricity ripples around your weapons, ready to strike out.

Name: Longstrider
MaterialComponents: A pinch of dirt
Description: This spell gives you a +10 foot enhancement bonus to your base speed. It has no effect on other modes of movement, such as burrow, climb, fly, or swim.

Name: Lucky Number
Description: You capture a moment in the flow of luck that surround your target, letting them tap into that potential fortune in the future.

Name: Magic Weapon
MaterialComponents: Powdered lime and carbon
Description: Magic weapon gives a weapon a +1 enhancement bonus on attack and damage rolls. An enhancement bonus does not stack with a masterwork weapon’s +1 bonus on attack rolls.

Name: Murderous Command
Description: You give the target a mental urge to kill its nearest ally, which it obeys to the best of its ability. The target attacks its nearest ally on its next turn with a melee weapon or natural weapon. If necessary, it moves to or charges to the nearest ally in order to make this attack. If it is unable to reach its closest ally on its next turn, the target uses its turn to get as close as possible to the ally.

Name: Produce Flame
Description: Flames as bright as a torch appear in your open hand. The flames harm neither you nor your equipment.

Name: Protection from Law
Description: This spell functions like Protection from Evil, except that the deflection and resistance bonuses apply to attacks made by lawful creatures. The target receives a new saving throw against control by lawful creatures and lawful summoned creatures cannot touch the target.

Name: Shocking Grasp
Description: Your successful melee touch attack deals 1d6 points of electricity damage per caster level (maximum 5d6). When delivering the jolt, you gain a +3 bonus on attack rolls if the opponent is wearing metal armor (or is carrying a metal weapon or is made of metal).

Name: Spark Spray
Description: Any creature in the area of the sparking energy takes 1d4 points of electricity damage per caster level (maximum 5d4).

Name: Static Disarm
Target: Held metal item of one creature or 15 lbs. of unattended metal
Description: This spell causes a metal object to instantly become charged with static electricity. A creature holding the item may attempt a Reflex save to drop it and take no damage (even if it is not their turn), otherwise the electricity discharges and deals 1d4 points of electricity damage per caster level (maximum 5d4) to them. Circumstances that prevent the creature from dropping the item (such as a locked gauntlet) mean the creature gets no saving throw. The electricity does not harm the item. If cast underwater, static disarm deals half damage, some of the energy discharging harmlessly into the surrounding water.

Name: Sudden Leap
Description: You leap to a new position in the blink of an eye, leaving your opponents baffled.

Name: Sure Strike
Description: You gain a fleeting glimpse into the future, enough to guide your impending attack.

Name: Targeting Ray
Focus: A small metal or stone tube
Description: From your clenched fist you produce a luminous ray. The ray pulsates between the target creature and you.

Name: Thunderhead
MaterialComponents: A small piece of copper wire
Description: Black mist forms near the ground and sweeps upward to join a small cloud forming above the creature you designate as your target. Miniature peals of thunder erupt from the cloud.

Name: True Strike
Focus: Small wooden replica of an archery target
Description: You gain temporary, intuitive insight into the immediate future during your next attack. Your next single attack roll (if it is made before the end of the next round) gains a +20 insight bonus. Additionally, you are not affected by the miss chance that applies to attackers trying to strike a concealed target.

Name: Unerring Weapon
Target: One weapon or 20 projectiles, all of which must be together at the time of casting
Description: This spell causes a weapon to veer closer to vital areas, improving the result of a critical threat. This transmutation grants a +2 bonus on attack rolls to confirm critical hits plus 1 additional bonus point per four caster levels (maximum total bonus +7). If the spell is cast on projectiles, the effect ends on a specific projectile whenever that projectile is used to make an attack, regardless of whether the attack hits. For this spell, shuriken are considered projectiles.

Name: Vocal Alteration
Description: You alter the target’s voice to something else. For example, you could make the target’s voice high-pitched, husky, or nasal, or change its accent to an accent you are familiar with. If this spell is used as part of a disguise, the target gets a +10 bonus on the Disguise check when trying to fool a listener.

Name: Wild Strike
Duration: Till the end of your next turn.
Description: When you cast this spell, wild energies ripple around your weapons, ready to strike out.

Name: Aggressive Thundercloud
MaterialComponents: A piece of a tree struck by lightning
Description: A crackling, spherical storm cloud flies in whichever direction you point and deals electricity damage to those it strikes. It has a fly speed of 20 feet with perfect maneuverability. If it enters a space that contains a creature, the storm stops moving for the round and deals 3d6 points of electricity damage to that creature, though a successful Reflex save negates that damage. It provides concealment (20% miss chance) to anything within it, and its flickering light illuminates the same area a candle would.

Name: Arrow Eruption
MaterialComponents: Arrow or crossbow bolt
Description: You create exact duplicates of the arrow or crossbow bolt you used to kill a creature in the previous round and launch one at enemy creatures within a 30-foot radius of the corpse. You can target one creature per caster level (maximum 15) within range of the burst and must make a single attack roll and apply it to each arrow. These duplicate arrows possess all the intrinsic magical properties of the arrow that killed the original creature as well as those passed on to it by your bow. They also enjoy the full benefit of any bonuses or modifiers you applied to the attack from other magical items, feats, and class or racial features. However, this spell cannot reproduce any spells or other limited-use magical effects that you used to enhance that particular attack. This includes such effects as the true strike spell, as well as any area spell you might have placed on the arrow by means of the arcane archer’s imbue arrow class feature.

Name: Balor Nimbus
MaterialComponents: A pinch of soot
Description: You smash the soot against your flesh and intone the ancient, dark words. Like the legendary balor, your body bursts into lurid flames.

Name: Battering Ram
Focus: A piece of carved ram’s horn
Description: You point the shard of carved ram’s horn at your foe and snap off the last words of the spell. An invisible wedge of force slams into the creature’s midsection, doubling it over and driving it back.

Name: Bigby's Striking Fist
Description: A large glowing fist, the size of a human torso, appears in front of the creature and slams into it with great force.

Name: Blast of Force
Description: Drawing upon magical force in its purest form, you send invisible energy whistling through the air to batter your foe.

Name: Blurred Movement
Description: Whenever you move your outline appears blurred, shifting, and wavering. This distortion grants the subject concealment (20% miss chance). This blurring occurs only when you move at least 10 feet on your turn and ceases at the end of your movement. It is therefore mainly used to protect against attacks on your turn, such as attacks of opportunity. If you move at least twice your speed on your turn, the blurring lasts until the start of your next turn.

Name: Blood in the Water
Description: As part of the casting of this spell, you must deal 1 point of piercing or slashing damage to yourself to release your blood. This causes you to take 1 point of bleed damage. While the spell is in effect, all sharks, feeders in the depths, and creatures with the blood frenzy ability in the area gain a +2 morale bonus to Strength and Constitution and take a –2 penalty to AC. This is treated as blood frenzy for the purposes of other feats and effects, and doesn’t stack with the effects of actual blood frenzy. If you cease bleeding, the spell immediately ends.

Name: Burning Arc
Target: One primary plus one additional /3 levels (each of which must be within 15 ft. of the primary
Description: This spell causes an arc of flame to leap from your fingers, burning a number of enemies nearby. It deals 1d6 points of fire damage per caster level (maximum 10d6). For every additional target the discharge arcs to, reduce the number of damage dice by half (rounded down). Therefore, at 9th level, your burning arc deals 9d6 points of fire damage to the primary target, then 4d6 points of fire damage to a secondary target, then 2d6 points of fire damage to an additional target.

Name: Burning Arrow
MaterialComponents: A pinch of tar
Description: An arrow of fire springs from your hand and speeds to its target. You must succeed on a ranged touch attack to hit your target. The arrow deals 2d4 points of fire damage with no splash damage. For every three caster levels you possess, the fire, unless put out, lasts for another round (to a maximum of 6 additional rounds at 18th level), dealing another 2d4 points of fire damage in each round.

Name: Burning Sword
Description: You cause a held weapon to become wreathed in flickering red  flames. The flames from this spell shed light as per a torch. These flames do not harm the weapon or its wielder, but for the duration of the spell, it delivers fire damage in addition to its normal damage.

Name: Burst of Napalm
Description: You release a burst of sticky flames. Creatures caught in the burst take 3d6 points of fire damage plus an additional 1d6 points of fire damage on your next round. Those that save take half damage from the initial burst and no damage on the next round.

Name: Cinder Wake
Description: Flaming cinders trail behind the targeted weapon, potentially damaging foes even when the weapon misses.

Name: Cloud of Knives
MaterialComponents: A dagger worth 2 gp
Description: You conjure a cloud of sharp knives around you. The knives float in the air around your upper body, pointing in the direction you look. Each round as a free action at the beginning of your turn, you can release one of these knives at any target within 30 feet that you can see. This is a ranged attack that uses an attack bonus equal to your caster level+your Charisma modifier. Each successful hit deals 1d6 points of piercing damage +1 per three caster levels (maximum +5) and threatens a critical hit on a roll of 19-20. Damage reduction applies to knife attacks from this spell. The knives are treated as magic for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction.

Name: Communal Longstrider
MaterialComponents: A pinch of dirt
Description: This spell gives each creature touched a 10-foot enhancement bonus to their base land speed. The duration is split into 1-hour intervals for each creature touched.

Name: Communal Protection From Law
Description: This spell functions like Protection from Law, except you divide the duration in 1-minute intervals among the creatures touched.

Name: Decastave
Description: You conjure into existence a quarterstaff of force, approximately 8 feet long and 2 inches in diameter. The decastave lasts only so long as you keep it in hand; if you give it to another character or drop it, it vanishes. (You can cast other spells with somatic components by holding the staff in one hand).

Name: Defensive Shock
MaterialComponents: A hollow metal sphere
Description: Electrical energy floods your body, shocking the next creature that touches you. Any creature striking you with its body or a handheld weapon takes 1d6 points of electricity damage per two caster levels (maximum 6d6). If the attacker has spell resistance, it applies against this damage. Each time the spell discharges, the number of damage dice it deals is halved (rounded down); when the spell’s damage dice reach 0, the spell ends.

Name: Desiccate
MaterialComponents: A pinch of salt
Description: You boil away moisture from the body of a target creature, dealing it 1d6 points of desiccation damage per two caster levels (maximum 5d6) and is dehydrated. A successful Fortitude save results in half damage and negates the dehydration.

Name: Dissonant Chant
Description: Your intricate hand motions slow and then stop even as you begin chanting the arcane words that unlock the spell’s power. As you conclude, your disembodied words continue on, growing both in tempo and volume.

Name: Distort Speech
Description: By pointing and making a number of loud, nonsensical sounds you release the power of the spell. The target attempts to speak, but spews forth only gibberish instead.

Name: Ectoplasmic Feedback
Description: A shimmering sheath of energy surrounds you, promising harm to incorporeal creatures that touch you.

Name: Electric Loop
MaterialComponents: A loop of copper wire
Target: S: One creature/3 levels, each of which is adjacent to another
Description: Spitting a harsh-sounding arcane word, you snap your fingers, and lightning leaps among your foes.

Name: Electric Ray
Description: You blast your enemies with a crackling beam of electricity. You may fire one ray, plus one additional ray for every four levels beyond 3rd (to a maximum of three rays at 11th level). Each ray requires a ranged touch attack to hit and deals 4d6 points of electricity damage. The rays may be fired at the same or different targets, but all rays must be aimed at targets within 30 feet of each other and fired simultaneously.

Name: Electric Sword
Description: You cause a held weapon to become wreathed in crackling electricity. The electricity generated this spell sheds light as per a torch. This electricity does not harm the weapon or its wielder, but for the duration of the spell, it delivers electricity damage in addition to its normal damage.

Name: Electric Vengeance
Description: As the creature strikes you, an arc of lightning springs from your body and blasts the creature in return.

Name: Fireburst
MaterialComponents: A bit of sulfur
Description: With a small circular gesture the air around you fills with flame. An instant later the fire explodes outward, engulfing everything close to you.

Name: Flame Blade
MaterialComponents: A drop of lamp oil
Description: A 3-foot-long, blazing beam of red-hot fire springs forth from your hand. You wield this blade-like beam as if it were a scimitar. Attacks with the flame blade are melee touch attacks. The blade deals 1d8 points of fire damage + 1 point per two caster levels (maximum +10). Since the blade is immaterial, your Strength modifier does not apply to the damage. A flame blade can ignite combustible materials such as parchment, straw, dry sticks, and cloth.

Name: Flames of the Faithful
Description: With a touch, you cause a glowing rune to appear on a single weapon, granting that weapon the flaming property (and allowing it to cause an extra 1d6 points of fire damage on a successful hit). If you are using the judgment class feature, your weapon gains the flaming burst property instead.

Name: Flaming Sphere
MaterialComponents: Tallow, brimstone, and powdered iron
Description: A burning globe of fire rolls in whichever direction you point and burns those it strikes. It moves 30 feet per round. As part of this movement, it can ascend or jump up to 30 feet to strike a target. If it enters a space with a creature, it stops moving for the round and deals 3d6 points of fire damage to that creature, though a successful Reflex save negates that damage. A flaming sphere rolls over barriers less than 4 feet tall. It ignites flammable substances it touches and illuminates the same area as a torch would.

Name: Heat Metal
Target: Metal equipment of one creature per two levels, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart; or 25 lbs. of metal/level, all of which must be within a 30-ft. circle
Description: Heat metal causes metal objects to become red-hot. Unattended, non-magical metal gets no saving throw. Magical metal is allowed a saving throw against the spell. An item in a creature’s possession uses the creature’s saving throw bonus unless its own is higher.

Name: Linebreaker
Description: You gain a +20 foot enhancement bonus to your base speed when charging and a +2 bonus on combat maneuver checks made to bull rush or overrun.

Name: Lucky Streak
Description: A tinkling laugh and a momentary shine surround your ally, leaving him with an aura of confidence and a sly smile.

Name: Magic Siege Engine
Description: This spell permits an indirect fire siege engine to bombard its targets with greater accuracy, delivering more damage. The siege weapon receives a +1 enhancement bonus on targeting rolls and damage rolls. If used on a direct fire siege weapon, this spell acts a Magic Weapon.

Name: Mighty Throw
Description: You use superior leverage and a jolt of magical energy to send an opponent tumbling to the ground.

Name: Painful Echoes
Target: One living creature/4 levels, no two of which are more than 30 ft. apart
Description: Your shout seems to echo into eternity, causing your foes to twitch and writhe as the reverberations pummel them internally.

Name: Pyrotechnics
MaterialComponents: One fire source
Target: One fire source, up to a 20-ft. cube
Duration: 1d4+1 rounds, or 1d4+1 rounds after creatures leave the smoke cloud; see text
SavingThrow: Will negates or Fortitude negates; see text
Description: Pyrotechnics turns a fire into a burst of blinding fireworks or a thick cloud of choking smoke, depending on your choice. The spell uses one fire source, which is immediately extinguished. A fire so large that it exceeds a 20-foot cube is only partly extinguished. Magical fires are not extinguished, although a fire-based creature used as a source takes 1 point of damage per caster level.

Name: Quick March
Description: Upon casting this spell, your feet and those of your allies glow with a yellow nimbus of light.

Name: Quick Throwing
MaterialComponents: Golden yellow topaz dust
Target: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: Those under the effects of this spell become faster in the use of thrown weapons. They can draw thrown weapons (including rocks if they have the rock throwing ability) on their bodies or within their space without the need for the Quick Draw feat, allowing them to make their full normal rate of attacks with such weapons. This has no effects on other forms of ranged weapon ammunition.

Name: Raging Flame
Description: Hot, burning passion fills your soul as you complete the spell. You release the passionate energy into the chosen area, causing fires there to flare with their own elemental desire to burn.

Name: Resonating Clang
Description: You create a loud, resonating clangor that causes metallic objects to vibrate wildly. A creature attending multiple metallic objects objects makes just 1 saving throw and applies that to all attended objects.

Name: Returning Weapon
Description: The weapon targeted by this spell gains the ability to return to the hand of its thrower (as the Returning weapon special ability)

Name: Scorching Ray
Description: You blast your enemies with a searing beam of fire. You may fire one ray, plus one additional ray for every four levels beyond 3rd (to a maximum of three rays at 11th level). Each ray requires a ranged touch attack to hit and deals 4d6 points of fire damage. The rays may be fired at the same or different targets, but all rays must be aimed at targets within 30 feet of each other and fired simultaneously.

Name: Scourge of Force
Description: One or more whiplike tendrils of force spring from your hand and lash targets within range. Make a melee touch attack for each tendril using your highest attack bonus. If a tendril hits, it deals 1d8 points of force damage plus 1 point of force damage per two caster levels (maximum 1d8+5). You can lash a target with multiple tendrils.

Name: Seducer's Eyes
Focus: Mookaite in the shape of an eye
Description: You gain a bonus on Charisma-based skill checks equal to 1 +1 for every 4 caster levels you possess (to a maximum of +5), but only when interacting with those who might conceivably find you sexually attractive. You do not gain this bonus against those you or your allies are attacking or threatening.

Name: Seeking Ray
Description: A ray of electricity springs from your hand. It snakes around obstacles, cover, and other impediments on its way toward your target. The ray deals 4d6 points of electricity damage if it strikes your target. While this ray requires a ranged touch attack to strike an opponent, it ignores concealment and cover (but not total concealment or total cover), and it does not take the standard penalty for firing into melee.

Name: Shard of Chaos
Description: You hurl a multicolored shard of congealed chaos from your holy symbol, affecting any one target in range as a ranged touch attack.

Name: Shatter
MaterialComponents: A chip of mica
SavingThrow: Will negates (object); Will negates (object) or Fortitude half; see text
Description: Shatter creates a loud, ringing noise that breaks brittle, non-magical objects; sunders a single solid, non-magical object; or damages a crystalline creature.

Name: Sonic Scream
Description: Up to three times during this spell’s duration, you can emit a cone of powerful sound as a standard action. The first cone deals 4d4 points of sonic damage to every creature in the area. The second deals 2d4 points of sonic damage to every creature in the area. The third deals 1d4 points of sonic damage to every creature in the area. A successful Reflex save against a cone halves that cone’s damage. After the third cone of sound, the spell ends. Until you use all three cones, you cannot use your voice for any magic-related purpose (bardic performance, verbal spellcasting, and so on), and cannot speak at any volume lower than a shout.

Name: Sound Burst
Description: You blast an area with a tremendous cacophony. Every creature in the area takes 1d8 points of sonic damage and must succeed on a Fortitude save to avoid being stunned for 1 round. Creatures that cannot hear are not stunned but are still damaged.

Name: Sparking Wake
Description: Sparking electricity trails behind the targeted weapon, potentially damaging foes even when the weapon misses.

Name: Spontaneous Immolation
MaterialComponents: Pinch of saltpeter
Description: You point your finger at a creature, causing it to spontaneously burst into flame. The target takes 3d6 points of fire damage and catches on fire. A successful Fortitude save reduces this damage by half and prevents the target from catching on fire. Each round on your turn, a burning target can attempt a new save to extinguish the flames (DC equal to the DC of the spell); otherwise it takes another 1d6 fire damage.

Name: Unnatural Lust
Description: Your target is filled with lust and desire for a single creature or object as designated by you at the time of casting. That creature or object must be within the spell’s range and perceivable by the target of the spell. The target is filled with the compulsion to rush to the subject of its lust and passionately kiss or caress that subject on its next turn, taking no other actions. If the target would not normally have lustful feelings toward the designated creature or object, it receives a +4 bonus on its saving throw.

Name: Voltaic Touch
Description: Your melee touch attack deals 4d6 points of electricity damage and causes the target to be staggered for 1 round. The target can make a Fort save to negate the staggered condition but not the electricity damage

Name: Accelerated Movement
MaterialComponents: A dead cockroach
Description: While this spell is in effect, you can move at your normal speed when using Acrobatics, Climb, or Stealth without taking any penalty on your check. This spell does not affect the penalty for using these skills while running or charging.

Name: Adroit Retrieval
Description: You instill the target with the ability to withdraw small items from her pockets or packs with supernatural swiftness. When the target retrieves an item stored on itself, it can retrieve the item either as a move action without provoking attacks of opportunity, or as a swift action that provokes attacks of opportunity. This effect functions only when the target attempts to retrieve a stored item that weighs less than 1 pound per caster level (maximum 15 pounds).

Name: Anarchic Blood
Description: Your innate chaos infuses your body with anarchic energy. While this energy does not directly empower you, it can harm embodiments of law. Any creature that damages you with a slashing or piercing melee weapon is sprayed by your chaotic blood. If the attacker is a creature with the lawful subtype, it takes 1d6 points of anarchic damage each time it successfully hits you. If you have the chaos subtype or an ability that grants you an aura of chaos (like some clerics), your blood instead deals 2d6 points of anarchic damage. Creatures that don’t have the lawful subtype or that are using reach weapons are not subject to this damage.

Name: Anarchic Storm
MaterialComponents: A flask of anarchic water worth 25 gp
Description: You call upon the powers of chaos, and a heavy rain of crimson energy begins to fall around you, its drops a rainbow of soft radiances. Above you, a multicolored lightning bolt flashes.

Name: Animate Knife
Focus: A pocket knife or other small blade
Description: You create a small blade of floating force. In each turn, this knife makes a single melee attack against the first creature that you make a melee attack against each round. Unless you specifically will it to do otherwise, or it proves impossible to do so, the knife always maneuvers itself so that it can flank your opponent before making the attack, granting you both flanking for the round (including your first attack).

Name: Ash Storm
MaterialComponents: A pinch of ash
Description: Driving ash blocks all sight (even darkvision) within the spell’s area of effect, and falling cinders cause the ground in the area to become difficult terrain.

Name: Bigby's Disrupting Hand
Description: A small, crimson hand of force springs into existence before your target. It hovers in the air, ready to deliver a backhanded blow.

Name: Bonecrusher
Description: You deliver your attack, and your enemy’s eyes jerk wide open in panic as his skeleton begins to fracture in hundreds of places.

Name: Borrow Fortune
Description: When you’re about to make a d20 roll, you may choose to immediately cast this spell. For that d20 roll, you may roll twice and select which die roll to use. For two rounds following your casting of the spell, you must roll two dice each time a d20 roll is called for, keeping the less favorable result.

Name: Burst Lightning
MaterialComponents: A tiny ball of copper
Description: A burst lightning spell generates a crackling explosion of lightning that detonates with a low roar and deals 1d6 points of electricity damage per caster level (maximum 10d6) to every creature within the area. Unattended objects also take this damage. The explosion creates almost no pressure.

Name: Burst of Speed
Description: Until the end of your turn, you gain a +20-foot bonus to speed (or +10-foot bonus if you are wearing Medium or Heavy armor), your movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity, and you can move through the space of creatures that are larger than you are, but you cannot end your movement this round in a space occupied by a creature.

Name: Call Lightning
Description: Immediately upon completion of the spell, and once per round thereafter, you may call down a 5-foot-wide, 30-foot-long, vertical bolt of lightning that deals 3d6 points of electricity damage. The bolt of lightning flashes down in a vertical stroke at whatever target point you choose within the spell’s range (measured from your position at the time). Any creature in the target square or in the path of the bolt is affected.

Name: Campfire Wall
MaterialComponents: Ash made from burnt thorns
Description: You can create a barrier around a fire of at least campfire size that shelters everyone inside so long as the fire continues to burn. The barrier appears as a crackling sphere of thin flames that is clearly visible, providing as much illumination as a torch.

Name: Chain of Perdition
MaterialComponents: A chain link
Description: A floating chain of force with hooks at each end appears within an unoccupied space of your choosing within range. This chain is a Medium object that has a 10-foot reach. Physical attacks cannot hit or harm the chain of perdition, but any dispelling effect (such as  Dispel Magic in White or Blue, or  Purify), disintegrate, a sphere of annihilation, or a rod of cancellation affects it normally. The chain’s AC against touch attacks is 10 + your Charisma modifier.

Name: Chaotic Weapon
Description: This transmutation makes a weapon strike true against lawful foes. The weapon is treated as having a +1 enhancement bonus for the purpose of bypassing the DR of lawful creatures or striking lawful incorporeal creatures (though the spell doesn’t grant an actual enhancement bonus). The weapon also becomes chaotic-aligned, which means it can bypass the DR of certain creatures. (This effect overrides and suppresses any other alignment the weapon might have.) Individual arrows or bolts can be transmuted, but affected projectile weapons (such as bows) don’t confer the benefit to the projectiles they shoot.

Name: Disable Construct
Description: You can make a melee touch attack to send a pulse into the target, interfering with the magic that endows it with life. If the construct fails its saving throw, it becomes helpless, but it receives a new save each round at the end of its turn to shake off the effect. If the construct is normally immune to magic, the pulse is less effective and the construct receives a +4 bonus on its saving throw.

Name: Distracting Cacophony
Description: The air fills with loud and discordant noise, making concentration difficult. Casting a spell in this area of cacophony requires a concentration check (DC 15 + the level of the spell being cast). Any other concentration checks in the area have their DCs increased by 5. The DC of Perception checks involving hearing is likewise increased by 5.

Name: Electric Arrow
Target: Fifty projectiles, all of which must be together at the time of casting
Description: This spell allows you to turn ammunition (such as arrows, crossbow bolts, shuriken, and sling stones) into electric projectiles. Each piece of ammunition deals an extra 1d6 points of electricity damage to any target it hits.

Name: Explosive Runes
MaterialComponents: A piece of waterstar worth 5 gp
Target: One touched object weighing no more than 10 lbs.
Description: You trace mystic runes upon a book, map, scroll, or similar object bearing written information, creating a magical trap. The explosive runes detonate when read, dealing 6d6 points of force damage. Anyone next to the explosive runes (close enough to read them) takes the full damage with no saving throw; any other creature within 10 feet of the explosive runes is entitled to a Reflex save for half damage. When you cast this spell you must choose to have the object on which the explosive runes were written be immune to the damage from the runes or it it will also take full damage (in which case it gets no saving throw).

Name: Fire Trail
Description: When you cast this spell, flammable liquid oozes from your pores, dripping onto the ground and spontaneously combusting. The flame does not harm you. During this spell’s duration, each time you leave your space, you create a trail of fire that burns within the spaces you move through for 1 round before it burns out. You can leave up to 60 feet of flame trail each round, assuming you are Small or Medium. If you are larger than Medium, the maximum trail length is reduced based on your size. If you are Large, you can leave a trail up to 30 feet long (and 10 feet wide), and if you are Huge, you can leave a trail up to 15 feet long (and 15 feet wide); even larger casters can only leave a trail up to 10 feet long (and as wide as your space) each round. You choose where to leave a flame trail. Creatures that start their turn adjacent to the flame trail take 1d6 points of fire damage. Creatures that start their turn within the flame trail or that enter an area of flame take a number of points of fire damage equal to 1d6 + 1 per caster level (maximum +10). If a creature moves into an area of the flame trail multiple times in a round, it takes this damage each time it enters the area of the flame trail. Flammable objects in or adjacent to the fire trail catch fire.

Name: Fireball
MaterialComponents: A ball of bat guano and sulfur
Description: A fireball spell generates a searing explosion of flame that detonates with a low roar and deals 1d6 points of fire damage per caster level (maximum 10d6) to every creature within the area. Unattended objects also take this damage. The explosion creates almost no pressure.

Name: Firestream
Duration: Concentration, up to 1 round/level; see text
Description: A rushing stream of fire sprays from your outstretched hand, dealing 2d6 points of fire damage to every creature in the area. Each round you continue to concentrate on the spell, you can select a new area for it to affect.

Name: Flame Arrow
Target: Fifty projectiles, all of which must be together at the time of casting
Description: This spell allows you to turn ammunition (such as arrows, crossbow bolts, shuriken, and sling stones) into fiery projectiles. Each piece of ammunition deals an extra 1d6 points of fire damage to any target it hits. A flaming projectile can easily ignite a flammable object or structure, but it won’t ignite a creature it strikes.

Name: Flaming Axe
MaterialComponents: A small shard of volcanic glass, such as obsidian
Description: This spell creates a battleaxe-shaped formation of blazing fire and fast-swirling shards of molten stone in your hand. You are automatically considered proficient with the flaming axe. Attacks with the flaming axe are melee touch attacks. The axe deals 2d12 points of fire damage +1 point per two caster levels (maximum +10) with a successful hit. You cannot be disarmed of the flaming axe nor can it be sundered. Since the axe is virtually weightless, your Strength modifier does not apply on damage rolls. If your base attack bonus is high enough to allow for multiple attacks in a round, you can make them with the flaming axe.

Name: Force Anchor
MaterialComponents: A twisted nail
Description: You conjure an anchor of pure force that immediately skewers your target on a successful ranged touch attack. If it hits, the attack deals the target 1d4 points of force damage per 2 caster levels (max 5d4) and the anchor becomes firmly lodged in the target’s torso. The anchor has no weight, but its wide flukes prevent the target from moving through any space smaller than the creature’s size. The anchor also prevents incorporeal targets from moving through solid objects. Whenever the target moves through a square occupied by another creature, the square counts as 2 squares for the purpose of calculating movement, even if the square’s occupant is the target’s ally.

Name: Force Hammer
Description: Force hammer is designed to bring down a single opponent without causing lasting harm. You fire a ray of force at a single target, making a ranged touch attack. If you hit, the bolt deals 1d4 points of nonlethal force damage per level (maximum 10d4). If the target fails a Fortitude save, it is dazed for one round. (A successful saving throw does not reduce the damage.) Force hammer has no effect on nonliving creatures or objects. Creatures that are immune to nonlethal damage cannot be dazed by the spell.

Name: Force Hook Charge
Target: One creature or object within range and you
Description: You create a hook of force that strikes the target and drags you to a space adjacent to it. Make a ranged touch attack against the target; if the touch attack succeeds, the target takes 1d6 points of force damage per 2 caster levels (maximum 5d6 at 10th level). If the target takes damage from the attack, the force hook sets and drags you in a straight line to a square adjacent to the target. This movement provokes attacks of opportunity as normal. The pulling hook keeps you from falling as part of this movement; therefore you can use it to cross a pit or chasm, or reach a higher or lower elevation. If the line of effect from you to the target passes through an area that is too small to fit your body (such as a portcullis or arrow slit), the hook pulls you to that location and you take damage as if you had fallen the distance from your starting point to that location. If you are restrained, such as being chained to a wall, the hook pulls you to the maximum extent of your restraints but does not break the restraints.

Name: Force Punch
Description: This spell charges your hand with telekinetic force. Your successful melee touch attack deals 1d4 points of force damage per level (maximum 10d4) and causes the target to be pushed away from you in a straight line up to 5 feet per two caster levels. For every size category of the target above Medium, reduce the distance pushed by 5 feet (–5 feet for Large, –10 feet for Huge, –15 for Gargantuan, and –20 feet for Colossal) to a minimum of 0 feet. A successful Fortitude save negates the movement but not the damage.

Name: Forcewave
MaterialComponents: A small piece of string and a drop of sweat
Description: You catch the drop of sweat on the string and snap it at your target. The drop swells and becomes a pale red wave of magical force, tumbling toward your opponents.

Name: Greater Magic Weapon
Target: One weapon or 50 projectiles (all of which must be together at the time of casting)
Description: This spell functions like magic weapon, except that it gives a weapon an enhancement bonus on attack and damage rolls of +1 per four caster levels (maximum +5). This bonus does not allow a weapon to bypass damage reduction aside from magic.

Name: Jet of Flame
MaterialComponents: Sulfur and a stone rod
Description: You release a powerful jet of flame that deals 1d6 points of fire damage per caster level (maximum 10d6) to each creature within its area. The jet begins at your fingertips.

Name: Keen Edge
Target: S: One weapon or 50 projectiles, all of which must be together at the time of casting
Description: This spell makes a weapon magically keen, improving its ability to deal telling blows. This transmutation doubles the threat range of the weapon. A threat range of 20 becomes 19-20, a threat range of 19-20 becomes 17-20, and a threat range of 18-20 becomes 15-20. Despite the name, the spell can be cast on bludgeoning weapons, not just piercing or slashing weapons. If cast on arrows or crossbow bolts, the keen edge on a particular projectile ends after one use, whether or not the missile strikes its intended target. Treat shuriken as arrows, rather than as thrown weapons, for the purpose of this spell.

Name: Lightning Bolt
MaterialComponents: Fur and a glass rod
Description: You release a powerful stroke of electrical energy that deals 1d6 points of electricity damage per caster level (maximum 10d6) to each creature within its area. The bolt begins at your fingertips.

Name: Lightning Surge
Duration: 1 round/caster level or until discharged; see text
Description: Lightning crackles out along your weapons as you cast this spell.

Name: Magic Circle against Law
Description: This spell functions like Magic Circle against Evil, except that it is similar to Protection from Law instead of Protection from Evil, and it can imprison a non-chaotic called creature.

Name: Mantle of Chaos
Description: You invoke the powers of chaos, and a flickering crimson field of anarchic energy surrounds you.

Name: Malfunction
Description: Malfunction pours disruptive energies though a magical item or magical artifact, shutting off the object’s mystical properties. When attempting to dispel a magic item or an artifact, you make a dispel check against the item’s caster level (DC = 11+the item’s caster level). If you succeed, all the item’s magical properties are suppressed for 2d4 rounds, after which the item recovers its magical properties. A suppressed item becomes nonmagical for the duration of the effect. An extradimensional or interdimensional opening (such as a bag of holding) is temporarily closed. A magic item’s physical properties are unchanged: A suppressed magic sword is still a sword (a masterwork sword, in fact). Legendary items and other objects of great power are unaffected by magic such as this.

Name: Opportune Strike
Description: Until the beginning of your next turn, you may choose to gain a +4 insight bonus on the attack and damage roll for a single attack of opportunity.

Name: Rage
Target: One willing living creature per three levels, no two of which may be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: Each affected creature gains a +2 morale bonus to Strength and Constitution, a +1 morale bonus on Will saves, and a -2 penalty to AC. The increase to Constitution grants the characters 1 hit point per Hit Dice, but these disappear when the rage ends and are not lost first like temporary hit points. While in rage, the characters cannot use any Charisma—, Dexterity—, or Intelligence-based skills (except Acrobatics, Fly, Intimidate, and Ride) or any ability that requires patience or concentration. The characters can only use aggressive, swift or immediate-cast spells while raging (GM discretion).

Name: Resonating Bolt
Description: Your quick movements and rapid utterances release the spell’s energy, culminating in a final cry that unleashes a tremendous bolt of sonic energy from your open hand.

Name: Ring of Blades
MaterialComponents: A dagger worth 2 gp
Description: As you twirl the dagger in your hand, it slowly fades from existence and is replaced by dozens of similar blades swirling about you in a horizontal ring.

Name: Shrapnel Blast
Target: One weapon appropriate for your size in your possession
Description: You touch a weapon, causing a red light to glow within it and then expand outward like an internal heat. Once it glows like molten steel, it explodes, fragments lashing out at your enemies.

Name: Sound Lance
Description: This spell causes a projectile of intense sonic energy to leap from you to a target within range.

Name: Spell Lash
Description: Red force writhes and coils around your arm, springing from your hand in a whip of scintillating energy.

Name: Spellslayer Strike
Description: You pour energy through your weapon that destabilizes other forms of magic. The next melee attack you make before the end of the turn deals an additional 1d6 points of arcane damage for each ongoing spell or spell-like ability currently in effect on the target. For example, the attack would deal an extra 3d6 points of arcane damage to a creature under the effects of bull’s strength, haste, and mage armor.

Name: Swift Chaotic Weapon
Description: This spell functions like Chaotic Weapon, except as noted above.

Name: Thunderous Roar
Description: The resulting blast of sound from the casting of thunderous roar can be heard for nearly a mile, but the spell affects only those in its area. All creatures in the affected area take 1d6 points of sonic damage per two caster levels (maximum 5d6). A successful Fortitude saving throw halves the damage. Additionally, any creature that takes damage from this spell must make a Reflex saving throw or be knocked prone from the force of the roar. Crystalline creatures take 1d6 points of sonic damage per caster level (maximum 10d6).

Name: Volcanic Hammer
Description: You create a warhammer of hardening magma and send it hurling toward the target. You must succeed at a ranged touch attack to strike the target. If hit, the target takes 1d8 points of damage per caster level you possess (maximum 10d8); half this damage is bludgeoning damage, half is fire damage. The hammer counts as having a +1 enhancement bonus for the purpose of bypassing DR. If the target takes any bludgeoning damage from the hammer, the hammer attempts a trip combat maneuver check against that target, using your base attack bonus and Strength modifier to calculate its CMB. However, you may use your caster level instead of your BAB and your Charisma modifier instead of your Strength modifier.

Name: Wreath of Flames
Description: This spell surrounds you and your weapons with blistering flames. At the end of each of your turns, any enemy adjacent to you or sharing your space takes 1d6 points of fire damage. Your melee and ranged attacks deal an extra 1d6 points of fire damage.

Name: Wreath of Lightning
Description: This spell surrounds you and your weapons with crackling electricity. At the end of each of your turns, any enemy adjacent to you or sharing your space takes 1d6 points of electricity damage. Your melee and ranged attacks deal an extra 1d6 points of electricity damage.

Name: Allegro
MaterialComponents: A tail feather from a bird of prey
Target: S: Up to 1 creature/level, all of which must be within 15 feet of you.
Description: With a quick wiggle of your fingers and a few arcane words, you release the feather in your hand to complete the spell. Suddenly, translucent red motes burst outward from you and collect on yourself and your nearby allies before fading away.

Name: Aura of Chaos
Description: A wild haze of multihued energy surrounds you as you cast this spell. Chaos reigns and nothing is certain.

Name: Ball Lightning
MaterialComponents: A small iron ring
Description: You create two globes of lightning that fly in whichever direction you indicate. For every 4 caster levels above 7th, you create an additional globe of lightning (3 globes at 11th, 4 globes at 15th, to the maximum of 5 globes at 19th). These globes fly at a rate of 20 feet per round and have perfect maneuverability. Wind does not affect a flying sphere’s course.

Name: Brilliant Energy Arrow
Focus: The arrow or bolt to be fired
Description: This spell is cast upon an arrow or bolt, transforming its head into brilliant energy that gives off light as a torch (20-foot radius). A brilliant energy missile ignores nonliving matter. Armor bonuses to AC (including any enhancement bonuses to that armor) do not count against it because the missile passes through armor. It deals normal damage and has no effect on constructs, undead, and objects. The arrow or bolt must be fired during the same round the spell is cast, or the magic dissipates and is lost. The projectile is destroyed even if it misses its target.

Name: Chain Missile
Target: One creature, plus one more creature/2 levels (each of which must be within 30 ft. of the primary )
Description: A large missile of magical energy darts from your fingertip to unerringly strike a creature. The large missile strike one creature initially, then fractures off to other targets. The large missile strikes the primary target, dealing 1d4+1 points of Force damage per two caster levels (max 10d4+10 points of force damage at 20th level). After the large missile strike, normal magic missiles fragment off to strike up to 1 additional target per 2 caster levels. Each secondary target takes 1d4+1 points of damage, struck by a single magic missile. You choose secondary targets as you like, but they must all be within 30 feet of the primary target, and no secondary target can be struck more than once (nor can the original target be chosen). You can choose to affect fewer secondary targets than the maximum (to avoid allies in the area, for example).

Name: Channeled Pyroburst
Description: A sphere of fiery energy comes into being before you. You channel energy into it, causing it to bubble and seethe with power. When you have poured enough energy into the sphere, you send it flying into your foes.

Name: Chaos Hammer
Description: You unleash chaotic power to smite your enemies. The power takes the form of a multicolored explosion of leaping, ricocheting energy. Only lawful and neutral (not chaotic) creatures are harmed by the spell.

Name: Chaos Ward
Description: The warded creature gains some protection against lawful powers. This spell absorbs 10 points of axiomatic damage (such as from Axiomatic Weapon) or damage from lawful-aligned spells (such as Order’s Wrath). This spell absorbs a maximum of 10 points of damage per caster level (up to a maximum of 150 points at 15th level), at which point the spell ends.

Name: Deafening Blast
Description: A deafening blast of sound, louder than thunder and more piercing that the shrieks of the damned, erupts where you point.

Name: Discordant Blast
Description: You create a wave of thunder and force, either in a 10-foot radius burst centered on you or in 30-foot cone-shaped burst.

Name: Disorient Construct
Description: This functions as Confusion, except it only affects one targeted construct, and instead of babbling incoherently, the construct takes no actions on its turn (but may still make attacks of opportunity). If the construct is normally immune to magic, the disorientation is less effective and the construct receives a +4 bonus on its saving throw.

Name: Exacting Shot
Description: As you complete the complicated ritual of the spell you see in your mind’s eye the vital areas of your favored enemy’s anatomy.

Name: Fervor
Description: This spell grants your natural land speed a 30 foot insight bonus and grants a +2 competence bonus on initiative checks. It has no effect on other modes of movement.

Name: Fire Trap
MaterialComponents: Gold dust worth 25 gp
Description: Fire trap creates a fiery explosion when an intruder opens the item that the trap protects. A fire trap spell can ward any object that can be opened and closed.

Name: Firefall
MaterialComponents: One fire source
Target: One fire source, up to a 20-foot cube
SavingThrow: Will negates and Reflex negates; see text
Description: Firefall causes a fire to erupt into a geyser of dazzlingly bright liquid flame. The spell uses one fire source, which is immediately extinguished. A fire larger than a 20-foot cube is only partly extinguished. Magical fires are not extinguished, but a creature of the fire subtype used as the source takes 1 point of damage per caster level (no Saving Throw).

Name: Firestride Exhalation
Description: With a word and a gesture, you fill your lungs with swirling, burning energy. Then, with a mighty exhalation, you flood the space before you with a powerful cone of fire. As the last wisps of energy leave your lips, your body becomes part of the breath weapon, allowing you to flow through space and reform your body anywhere within the breath’s area.

Name: Flashing Sun
Description: You can cast this spell only at the beginning of your turn, before you take any other actions. After casting flashing sun, if you take a full-attack action this turn you can make 1 additional attack at the end of the full-attack. This additional attack is not considered a bonus attack (such as those granted by Haste) and take the normal penalties for making additional attacks due to a higher base attack bonus. For instance, an 8th level Spellblade making a full attack would normally have his first attack at his full attack bonus and his second at a -5, then this spell would grant him a third at a -10.

Name: Force Missiles
Target: S: Up to four creatures, no two of which are more than 30 ft. apart
Description: Sparking bolts of crimson magic, like giant magic missiles, streak from your outstretched hand to strike your foes and explode in sparkling bursts.

Name: Forceful Strike
Range: Touch or reach of melee weapon
Description: You cast this spell as you strike a creature with a melee weapon, unarmed strike, or natural attack to unleash a concussive blast of force. You deal normal weapon damage from the blow, but also deal an additional amount of force damage equal to 1d4 points per caster level (maximum of 10d4). A successful Fortitude save halves the force damage. The force of the blow may be enough to knock the target backward as well. To determine if the target is pushed back, make a combat maneuver check with a bonus equal to your caster level to resolve a bull rush attempt against the creature struck. This bonus is halved (rounded up) against a target who succeeded on their Fortitude save against this spell. You do not move as a result of this free bull rush, but it can push the target back if it defeats the target’s CMD.

Name: Greater Aggressive Thundercloud
Focus: A piece of a tree struck by lightning
SavingThrow: Reflex negates and Fort negates (see text)
Description: This spell functions as Aggressive Thundercloud, except it deals 6d6 points of electricity damage to any creature it strikes. The first creature damaged by the cloud is also stunned for 1 round (Fort negates); this is a sonic effect.

Name: Greater Flaming Sphere
MaterialComponents: Tallow, brimstone, and powdered iron
Description: This spell functions as Flaming Sphere, except that it deals 6d6 points of fire damage to any creature it strikes. Any creature that fails its save against the sphere catches on fire. If a creature catches on fire, the DC to extinguish the flames is equal to the DC of this spell.

Name: Greater Magic Siege Engine
Description: This spell functions like Magic Siege Engine, except it gives an indirect fire siege weapon an enhancement bonus on targeting and damage rolls of +1 per four caster levels (maximum +5). If used on a direct-fire siege weapon, this spell functions as Greater Magic Weapon.

Name: Lesser Spellcrash
Description: You create a discordant blast of energy that disrupts the target’s available mana. The target loses 6 mana points from a random mana pool they possess (or up to the maximum they have remaining in that pool, if less than 6). A successful Will save reduces the lost mana by half. The target takes 1d4 points of Arcane damage per mana point lost and if they failed the Will save they cannot cast spells until the beginning of their next turn, as if they’d suffered Mana Burn. This spell has no effect on spell-like abilities.

Name: Metal Melt
MaterialComponents: A drop of mercury in a vial
Target: Nonmagical metal object weighing up to 5 lb./level
Description: You uncork the vial and pour out its contents, and the armor you designate begins to soften and flow.

Name: Orb of Electricity
Description: An orb of crackling electricity about 3 inches across shoots from your palm at its target. You must succeed on a ranged touch attack to hit your target. On a successful hit you deal 1d6 points of electricity damage per caster level (maximum 15d6).

Name: Orb of Fire
Description: An orb of fire about 3 inches across shoots from your palm at its target. You must succeed on a ranged touch attack to hit your target. On a successful hit you deal 1d6 points of fire damage per caster level (maximum 15d6).

Name: Orb of Force
Description: As you gather the energies of the spell, you feel against your palm a spherical weight that seems almost bonded to your skin. The sphere grows, until with a final precise movement, you release the translucent crimson orb, sending it hurtling toward your intended target.

Name: Orb of Sound
Description: Symbols recognizable as musical notation, the visual representation of sound, appear in midair within the curve of your palm accompanied by the fractious sounds they represent. The notes begin to whirl and stretch, forming into a spherical whirlwind of cacophonic chaos, as you make ready to release the spell. At last, you send the sphere of noise toward your chosen target.

Name: Parboil
MaterialComponents: Water and a pinch of sulfur.
Description: You flash-heat the air in an area, boiling the blood and baking the brains of creatures caught inside.

Name: Rapid Counter
Description: You lash out, your weapon a blur, hammering at the slightest gap that appears in your foe’s defenses.

Name: Rapid Pursuit
Description: Your movements perfectly match your foe’s, allowing you to move as they do. Try as they might to escape, you remain at their side.

Name: Resilient Reservoir
Description: This spell creates a magical well of retribution that a caster can unleash with blinding speed.

Name: Sculpt Sound
Target: S: One creature or object/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: You can change the sounds that creatures or objects make. You can create sounds where none exist, quiet sounds, or warp sounds to resemble other sounds. All affected creatures or objects must be transmuted in the same way. Once the transmutation is made, you cannot change it. You can change the qualities of sounds but cannot create words with which you are unfamiliar yourself. This transformation of sound cannot give bonuses or eliminate constant penalties (such as armor check), but may impose or reduce environmental modifiers to stealth checks.

Name: Shockwave
MaterialComponents: A small glass sphere
Description: Even if a battle is for a just cause, using fireball on a crowded city street places innocents at risk. The shockwave spell creates a burst of concussive force that disorients victims without causing any permanent damage, dealing 1d4 points of nonlethal force damage per caster level (maximum 10d4) to every creature within the area and staggers them for 1 round. A successful Fortitude save reduces the damage by half and negates the staggered effect. The shockwave has no effect on nonliving creatures or objects. Creatures that are immune to nonlethal damage cannot be staggered by the spell.

Name: Shout
SavingThrow: Fortitude partial or Reflex negates (object); see text;
Description: You emit an ear-splitting yell that deafens and damages creatures in its path. Any creature within the area is deafened for 2d6 rounds and takes 5d6 points of sonic damage. A successful save negates the deafness and reduces the damage by half. Any exposed brittle or crystalline object or crystalline creature takes 1d6 points of sonic damage per caster level (maximum 15d6). An affected creature is allowed a Fortitude save to reduce the damage by half, and a creature holding fragile objects can negate damage to them with a successful Reflex save. A shout spell cannot penetrate a silence spell.

Name: Shunt
Description: Shunt targets a creature and is cast much like a counterspell. You must make a caster level check (1d20+your caster level) against the opponent (DC = 11+the spell’s caster level), to successfully affect the other spellcaster’s spell. Unlike a counterspell, shunt instead allows you to change the target or area of the spell to any target or location within shunt’s range. If you choose an illegal target or area (because of the spell’s range limitation or other restrictions), the spell functions normally and shunt is wasted.

Name: Slaad's Prey
MaterialComponents: Dried blood from a lawful outsider, sprinkled on the weapon
Description: When you cast this spell on a melee weapon you imbue it with a powerful chaotic energy, granting the weapon the Bane weapon quality against lawful outsiders. Furthermore, whenever you score a successful critical hit against an outsider with the lawful subtype, you not only deal normal critical damage with the weapon but also nauseate the outsider for 1d3 rounds—the outsider can reduce this nauseated condition to sickened for 1 round with a successful Fortitude save.

Name: Spellslayer Arrow
Focus: The arrow or bolt to be fired
Description: This spell is cast upon a arrow or bolt, transforming it into a glowing missile that destabilizes other forms of magic. In addition to dealing normal damage, a spellslayer arrow deals an extra 1d6 points of arcane damage for each ongoing spell or spell-like ability currently in effect on the target. For example, an arrow would deal an extra 3d6 points of arcane damage to a creature under the effects of bull’s strength, haste, and mage armor. The arrow or bolt must be fired during the same round the spell is cast, or the magic dissipates and is lost. The projectile is destroyed even if it misses its target.

Name: Storm Wall
MaterialComponents: A shard of lodestone
Description: An immobile, sparking curtain of radiant electricity springs into existence. One side of the wall, selected by you, sends forth miniature bolts of lightning, causing 2d4 points of electricity damage to creatures within 10 feet and 1d4 points of electricity damage to those past 10 feet but within 20 feet. The wall deals this damage when it appears and each round that a creature enters or remains in the area. In addition, the wall deals 2d4 points of electrical damage+1 point of electrical damage per caster level (maximum +20) to any creature passing through it. The wall deals double damage to metal creatures, creatures wearing metal armor or carrying a lot of metal objects.

Name: Superior Magic Weapon
Description: Superior magic weapon gives every manufactured weapon you possess an enhancement bonus on attack rolls and damage rolls equal to +1 per four caster levels (maximum +5 at 20th level).

Name: Surging Flame
SpellResistance: None and Reflex half; see text
Description: As your weapon strikes your foe, his body convulses as waves of flame run down your blade into his body. The fire causes him to briefly glow with a brilliant internal fire before the flames erupt from his body in a terrible explosion.

Name: Swift Haste
Description: Two quick syllables release the power of the spell, and the world moves a bit slower about you.

Name: Telekinetic Charge
Description: In a rough approximation of telekinesis, you forcibly launch an ally across the battlefield. So long as the movement would have been valid for a charge, you can move your ally to anywhere within this spell’s range. While moving, your ally is thrown just above the ground. Movement from this spell provokes attacks of opportunity as normal. If your ally lands adjacent to an opponent, he can spend an immediate action to make a melee attack against that opponent with a +2 bonus on the attack roll (this attack is not considered to be a charge attack).

Name: Uncanny Speed
Description: In the blink of an eye, you make your move.

Name: Volcanic Storm
MaterialComponents: Obsidian and ash
Description: Chunks of hot volcanic rock and clumps of ash pound down when this spell is cast, dealing 3d6 points of bludgeoning damage and 2d6 points of fire damage to every creature in the area. This damage only occurs once, when the spell is cast. For the remaining duration of the spell, heavy ash rains down in the area. Creatures inside this area take a –4 penalty on Perception skill checks and the entire area is treated as difficult terrain. At the end of the duration, the rock and ash disappear, leaving no aftereffects (other than the damage dealt).

Name: Voltaic Strike
Description: Your next successful melee attack deals an additional 1d6 points of electricity damage per two caster levels (maximum 5d6 at 10th level). In addition, your opponent must make a Fortitude save or be stunned for 1 round.

Name: Wall of Fire
MaterialComponents: A piece of phosphor
Description: An immobile, blazing curtain of shimmering violet fire springs into existence. One side of the wall, selected by you, sends forth waves of heat, dealing 2d4 points of fire damage to creatures within 10 feet and 1d4 points of fire damage to those past 10 feet but within 20 feet. The wall deals this damage when it appears, and to all creatures in the area on your turn each round. In addition, the wall deals 2d6 points of fire damage + 1 point of fire damage per caster level (maximum +20) to any creature passing through it. The wall deals double damage to undead creatures.

Name: Archon Snare
MaterialComponents: A pouch of silvered powder worth 25 gp
Description: Your touch creates an invisible circle on a flat surface.

Name: Cacophonic Burst
Description: You complete the spell with a scream, and echoes of your cry travel outward and burst into ear-shattering sounds.

Name: Call Lightning Storm
Description: This spell functions like Call Lightning, except that each bolt deals 5d6 points of electricity damage (or 5d10 if created outdoors in a stormy area), and you may call a maximum of 15 bolts.

Name: Channeled Sound Blast
Description: You channel energy into the shimmering waves of sound, causing them to tremble and quake with power. When you have poured enough energy into the spell, you send a thunderous blast into your foes.

Name: Comet Throw
Description: With a surge of mystical might use your foe’s momentum against him, throwing him through the air to crash into a second enemy.

Name: Cone of Flame
MaterialComponents: A charcoal cone
Description: Cone of flame creates a wave of intense flames, originating at your hand and extending outward in a cone. The flames wash out with a low roar, dealing 1d6 points of fire damage per caster level (maximum 15d6). The flames create almost no pressure.

Name: Dalamar's Lightning Lance
MaterialComponents: An amber, crystal, or glass rod
Description: You create a crackling lance of lightning that you can hurl at your foes. You must succeed at a ranged touch attack roll to hit. The lance deals 3d6 points of piercing damage from the impact of the strike, plus 1d12 electricity damage per two caster levels (maximum 5d12). The impact damage is not subject to being reduced by protection from elements (electricity), grounding shield, and similar magic or effects, but the target is entitled a Fortitude save to halve the electricity damage.

Name: Dispel Cold
Focus: A fire agate amulet worth 10 gp
Target: Or s: You and a touched cold or water creature from another plane, or you and an enchantment or cold or water spell on a touched creature or object
Duration: 1 round/level or until discharged, whichever comes first
Description: This spell functions like Dispel Evil, except that you are surrounded by constant red, orange, and yellow flames, and the spell affects cold or water creatures and spells rather than evil ones.

Name: Dispel Law
Focus: A vial of mixed rubies and lead dust
Target: Or s: You and a touched lawful creature from another plane, or you and an enchantment or lawful spell on a touched creature or object
Duration: 1 round/level or until discharged, whichever comes first
Description: This spell functions like Dispel Evil, except that you are surrounded by flickering, yellow chaotic energy, and the spell affects lawful creatures and spells rather than evil ones.

Name: Etheric Shards
MaterialComponents: Broken glass
SavingThrow: Reflex partial or Reflex negates (see text)
Description: You harden interpenetrated ethereal substance into deadly transdimensional razors that are invisible to normal sight.

Name: Fire Snake
MaterialComponents: A snake scale
Description: You create a sinuous line of flames that you may shape as desired. The fire snake affects one 5-foot square per caster level, and each square must be adjacent to the previous square, starting with you. The fire snake may not extend beyond its maximum range. Creatures in the path of the fire snake take 1d6 points of fire damage per caster level (maximum 15d6).

Name: Greater Electric Vengeance
Description: As the creature strikes you, an arc of lightning springs from your body and blasts the creature in return.

Name: Greater Fireburst
MaterialComponents: A bit of sulfur
Description: With a grand circular gesture the air around you fills with flame. An instant later, roaring fire consume everything near you.

Name: Haste
MaterialComponents: A shaving of licorice root
Target: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: The transmuted creatures move and act more quickly than normal. This extra speed has several effects.

Name: Heart of Fire
Description: You feel a sudden flame burning within you. This spell converts part of your body into elemental fire, which speeds your step and toughens your flesh.

Name: Insubordination
Target: One living creature/level, none of which are more than 30 ft. apart
Description: You enflame a hatred within your enemies, implanting an urge to kill and destroy their allies. All subjects receive a Will save to resist the enchantment. Each individual failing its save turns on the closest ally and attacks (using the most lethal method available to them) until the first time it deals damage, which causes the spell to end for that attacker. (For the purposes of this spell, familiars are considered to be a part of the character, and thus familiar and master will never attack one another).

Name: Kilroy's Searing Spear
MaterialComponents: A shard of coal
Description: You create a searing spear of flame that you can hurl at your foes. You must succeed at a ranged touch attack roll to hit. The spear deals 3d6 points of piercing damage from the impact of the strike, plus 1d12 fire damage per two caster levels (maximum 5d12). The impact damage is not subject to being reduced by protection from elements (fire), elemental shield, and similar magic or effects, but the target is entitled a Fortitude save to halve the fire damage.

Name: Lightning Arc
MaterialComponents: Fur and two glass figurines
Target: S: Two creatures or objects which must be no more than 60 ft. apart
Description: You generate an arc of lightning between two targets. The lightning deals 1d6 points of electricity damage per caster level (maximum 15d6) to both targets and any creatures in a line connecting them. The spell fails if there is no line of effect between the targets. Lightning arc sets fire to combustibles and damages objects in its path. It can melt metals that have a low melting point, such as lead, gold, copper, silver, or bronze.

Name: Lightning Leap
Description: With a sudden flash, you find yourself standing on the other side of the battle, leaving a smoking trail behind you.

Name: Lightning Wave
MaterialComponents: A tiny crystal cone
Description: Lightning wave creates a wave of crackling lightning, originating at your hand and extending outward in a cone. The electricity washes out with a low roar, dealing 1d6 points of electricity damage per caster level (maximum 15d6).

Name: Lingering Flames
Duration: Until the end of your next turn; see text
Description: When you cast this spell, flame surges around your weapons, ready to strike out.

Name: Lingering Lightning
Duration: Until the end of your next turn; see text
Description: When you cast this spell, electricity surges around your weapons, ready to strike out.

Name: Meteoric Strike
SavingThrow: None or Reflex half; see text
Description: Your melee weapon bursts into orange, red, and gold flames, and shining sparks trail in its wake.

Name: Napalm Spray
MaterialComponents: A vial of alchemist’s fire worth 10 gp
Description: A spray of sticky flames erupts from your outstretched hand, dealing 1d6 points of fire damage per caster level (maximum 15d6) to each creature within its area (Reflex half).
