This fire continues to burn for 1 round, dealing 1d6 points of fire damage per two caster levels (maximum 7d6) to any creature that took damage from the spell (a second Reflex save on the creature’s turn negates this additional damage).

Name: Reciprocal Gyre
MaterialComponents: A tiny closed loop of copper wire
Description: You finger the tiny loop of wire in your hands as you complete the spell. You manipulate the magical aura of the target, creating a damaging feedback reaction, and the target explodes with white sparks.

Name: Shard Storm
MaterialComponents: A small shard of clear glass or crystal
Description: Tossing the shard from your grasp, you complete the spell. An instant later, translucent shards of arcane energy blast the area you designated. In addition to deadly shards, the area fills with the chiming sound of shattering glass.

Name: Streamers
MaterialComponents: 6-inch strand of red silk
Description: You cause a number of glowing, red streamers to shoot forth from the your hand when you cast the spell. You may fire one streamer, plus one additional streamer for every three levels beyond 9th (to a maximum of four streamers at 18th level). Each streamer targets one creature and each streamer must target a different creature.

Name: Wall of Magma
MaterialComponents: A small piece of pumice, obsidian, or other volcanic rock.
Description: This spell creates a wall of thick magma that glows with a dull red heat. It merges into adjoining rock surfaces, melting the rock at the point of connection to form a smooth bond. The wall can seal off a passage or breach, but the intense heat causes flammable materials in contact with the wall of magma to catch fire instantly.

Name: Wall of Sound
MaterialComponents: A tuning fork and a quartz crystal
Description: A translucent barrier of pure sound springs into existence. This wall is silent except for a faint hum, but bursts with discordant noise when touched by an object or creature. The wall deflects arrows, bolts, loose debris, and Small or smaller flying creatures like a Wind Wall spell, except these things rebound harmlessly rather than being directed upward. The burst of discordant noise deals 2d4 points of sonic damage to creatures within 10 feet of the triggering object or creature; touching or passing through the wall deals 2d6 points of sonic damage + 1 point of sonic damage per caster level (maximum +20). If you evoke the wall so that it appears where creatures are, each creature takes damage as if passing through the wall. A silence spell suppresses the wall within its area, but the wall reappears when the silence ends.

Name: Wreath of Blades
Focus: A masterwork dagger, worth at least 302 gp
Description: The dagger serving as focus of this spell take on a deadly sharpness as they animate and spin around you, creating a 5-foot-radius emanation of spinning mithral blades that moves with you. Any creature that starts its turn within the area of the spinning blades takes 1d4 points of slashing damage for every two caster levels (maximum 10d4 at 20th level). Furthermore, the daggers ward off some attacks, in a way similar to the Warding Weapon spell. While subject to this spell, you do not provoke attacks of opportunity for casting spells, even from creatures with the Disruptive feat. Creatures with the Spellbreaker feat can easily bypass this defensive property, though they still take damage from the spell. Your casting (even failing to cast defensively) still provokes attacks of opportunity from creatures with that feat.

Name: Arrow Storm
Description: Your bow glows with a pale fire for an instant and now feels as light as a feather in your hand. In your mind’s eye you see the arrows in your quiver, and your hand feels drawn to them.

Name: Battering Blast
Description: You hurl a fist-sized ball of force resembling a sphere of spikes to ram a designated creature or object. You must succeed on a ranged touch attack to strike your target. On a successful hit, you deal 1d6 points of force damage per two caster levels (maximum 5d6). For every 5 caster levels you possess beyond 5th, you gain an additional ball of force (up to a maximum of 4 balls at 20th level). The balls may be fired at the same or different targets, but all balls must be aimed at targets within 30 feet of each other and fired simultaneously.

Name: Blade Barrier
SavingThrow: Reflex half or Reflex negates; see text
Description: An immobile, vertical curtain of whirling blades shaped of pure force springs into existence. Any creature passing through the wall takes 1d6 points of damage per caster level (maximum 15d6), with a Reflex save for half damage.

Name: Blade Storm
Description: With a thought and a word you complete the spell. Your weapons shift color, crackling with energy for a moment, and feel lighter in your hands. An unseen force guides them, pulling them toward your enemies.

Name: Chain Lightning
Focus: A bit of fur; a piece of amber, glass, or a crystal rod; plus one silver pin per caster level
Target: S: One primary , plus one secondary /level (each of which must be within 30 ft. of the primary )
Description: This spell creates an electrical discharge that begins as a single stroke commencing from your fingertips. Unlike Lightning Bolt, chain lightning strikes one object or creature initially, then arcs to other targets.

Name: Chains of Fire
Focus: A drop of oil and a small piece of flint
Target: S: One primary , plus one secondary /level (each of which must be within 30 ft. of the primary )
Description: This spell functions like Chain Lightning, except as noted above, and the spell deals fire damage instead of electricity damage.

Name: Contagious Flame
Description: You blast several enemies with beams of fire. You may fire three rays, plus one additional ray for every four levels beyond 11th (to a maximum of five rays at 19th level). Each ray requires a ranged touch attack to hit and deals 4d6 points of fire damage.

Name: Dance of a Hundred Cuts
Description: You become a lethal combat dancer, swirling and spinning with grace and precision.

Name: Envious Urge
Target: S: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: You fill creatures with feelings of seething envy. Affected targets turn upon the nearest creature (whether an ally or enemy) and attempt to disarm it of a valuable weapon, steal something it is holding, or grapple it and strip it of something it prizes (your choice). Affected targets can attempt a new Will save each round as a free action to end this effect.

Name: Fevered Inspiration
MaterialComponents: The trade tools being used, see text
Target: You and a tool kit held (see text)
Duration: 10 minutes/level or 1 week/level until discharged (see text)
Description: You are filled with the burning inspiration of the forge. You push your tools beyond their limits, producing incredible results but destroying the tools in the process. When you first cast this spell, you must choose a set of tools you currently possess and a duration, choosing to have the spell last 10 minutes/level or for the duration of one specific task (to a maximum of 1 week/level).

Name: Foster Hatred
Target: Any number of living creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: You build upon your targets’ innate prejudice, stoking it from a simmer to the full flame of hatred. Choose a creature type (if you choose humanoid or outsider, you must also choose a subtype).

Name: Furious Fire Barrage
MaterialComponents: Two balls of guano
Description: Upon casting this spell, you conjure forth one or two balls of flame, each resting in a free hand. As part of casting this spell or as a standard action, you can throw one flame ball a maximum of 300 feet, dealing 10d6 points of fire damage to all creatures within a 10-foot-radius spread. If you use that hand for any purpose other than holding the ball of flame, the ball dissipates.

Name: Greater Spell Lash
Description: This spell functions like Spell Lash, except that the lash has a reach of 20 feet, a successful attack with it deals 1d8 points of slashing damage+1 point per caster level (maximum +20), and can be used to deliver touch spells of 7th level or lower.

Name: Haze of Smouldering Stone
Description: Glowing embers swirl around your body, then fly outward to pummel nearby foes with searing volcanic rock.

Name: Heatwave
MaterialComponents: A paper cone
Description: A wave of intense wavering heat projects from you, originating at your outstretched hand and extending outward in a cone. The heat causes creatures in the area to suffer from heatstroke as their body temperature dramatically increases, dealing 1d6 points of nonlethal fire damage per caster level (maximum 15d6). A creature that fails their save against this spell additionally suffers from heatstroke (treat as fatigued). The heatstroke ends when the character rests in a cool environment and recovers the damage they took from the heat. A successful Fortitude save reduces the damage by half and negates the heatstroke. Characters wearing heavy clothing or armor of any sort take a –4 penalty on their saves against this spell.

Name: Lightning Strike
Description: You create a wave of crackling lightning, which blasts out from your hand in a line. The line deals 1d6 points of electricity damage per caster level (maximum 15d6).

Name: Mass Desiccate
MaterialComponents: A pinch of salt
Target: S: One living creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: You boil away moisture from the bodies of target creatures, dealing them 1d6 points of desiccation damage per two caster levels (maximum 7d6) and making them dehydrated. A successful Fortitude save results in half damage and negates the dehydration.

Name: Searing Strike
Description: You create a blast of searing fire, which rushes out from your hand in a line. The line deals 1d6 points of fire damage per caster level (maximum 15d6).

Name: Sign of Wrath
Focus: A gem worth 1,000 gp inscribed with the symbol of wrath
Description: A giant, glowing symbol of wrath appears below you, forcibly repulsing all nearby creatures.

Name: Slaadi's Strike
Description: Chaotic energies surge across your weapon. Your next melee attack this round is Chaotic aligned. If your attack hits and your opponent has a Lawful alignment, a blast of multihued chaotic energy erupts from them. The struck opponent takes an extra 1d10 points of anarchic damage per 3 CL (max 6d10 at 18th level) and must succeed on a Fortitude save or take a -2 luck penalty on attack rolls for 1 minute. All other Lawful creatures within a 30 foot radius burst of the target creature must also succeed on a Fortitude save. Those who fail take the same amount of anarchic damage dealt to the primary target and take a -2 luck penalty on attack rolls for 1 minute. A successful Fortitude save reduces to half damage and negates the attack penalty. Spell resistance applies to this effect, and prevents the burst if failed against the primary target.

Name: Smelt
Description: Smelt pours burning energies into an object, rendering it to ash. The targeted object takes 1d6 points of damage per caster level (maximum 15d6). Half the damage is fire damage, but the other half is arcane damage and is thus not subject to fire resistance. Smelt deals full damage to objects, regardless of material, but may be reduced by resistances or immunities. The targeted object may attempt a fortitude save against this effect, success halves this damage. An item in a creature’s possession is allowed to use that creature’s fortitude save, unless its own is higher, but does not benefit nor suffer from any other ability the creature has (such as the ability to roll twice on a saving throw and take the better, or a curse that forces them to roll twice and take the worse). An object that takes any fire damage from Smelt superheats – a combustible item catches fire, taking 2d6 points of fire damage per turn until destroyed or the fire put out, while a noncombustible item acts as if on the 3rd turn of a Heat Metal spell (regardless of material), dealing damage and cooling off as-per the spell.

Name: Spellcrash
Description: You create a discordant blast of energy that disrupts the target’s available magic. The target loses 10 mana points from a random mana pool they possess (or up to the maximum they have remaining in that pool, if less than 10). A successful Will save reduces the lost mana by half. The target takes 1d4 points of Arcane damage per mana point lost and if they failed the Will save they cannot cast spells until the beginning of their next turn, as if they’d suffered Mana Burn. This spell has no effect on spell-like abilities.

Name: Utter Contempt
MaterialComponents: Spittle
Description: You fill the target’s heart with malice for all other creatures. The target’s attitude toward all creatures other than itself worsens by two steps.

Name: Animate Siege Weapon
Target: One siege weapon of up to Gargantuan size
Description: You imbue a siege weapon of up to size Gargantuan, such as a ballista or a battering ram, with mobility and the semblance of life. The siege weapon uses your caster level as its targeting bonus. The siege weapon attacks whomever or whatever you initially designate when casting the spell, continuing to do so as long as the spell lasts, though you must spend a standard action to aim the siege weapon anytime thereafter when you want it to fire at a new target. You must supply ammunition for siege weapon to use, but it will automatically load itself with any ammunition placed next to it. If multiple types of ammunition are available, you may command it as a free action to pick a specific one, otherwise it will choose randomly.

Name: Arcane Cannon
Focus: A 5,000 gp ornate miniature cannon, forged with a drop of your blood.
Description: Your focus becomes a Medium arcane cannon that appears in an unoccupied square within the spell’s range. If no unoccupied square is within range, the spell fails. The cannon comes into existence loaded. Each round thereafter, the cannon can either fire or load. A cannon must be loaded to fire. You do not need to supply ammunition for the cannon. On your turn, you can spend a move action to direct the cannon to wheel itself to a new location, moving the cannon up to 20 feet. If the arcane cannon ever leaves your line of sight, it winks out of existence, and the spell’s duration ends. The cannon has a range increment of 50 feet. It targets touch attack in the first range increment, and it has no misfire chance. The cannon acts as a weapon with the conductive special weapon ability, which you can use to channel your spell-like or supernatural abilities as long as you are within the range of arcane cannon. The cannon’s attack bonus is equal to your caster level + your Charisma bonus with an additional +1 per four caster levels (maximum +5 at 20th level). On a hit, the cannon deals 4d10 damage. The arcane cannon attacks have a critical modifier of ×4.

Name: Ballista Throw
Description: You catch your opponent with your weapon and spin them like a top, swinging him around before throwing him at your opponents like a bolt from a ballista.

Name: Blessing of the Rebellious
Target: One weapon/level, no two of which are more than 30 ft. apart
Description: This spell makes all targeted weapons chaotic-aligned and deal an additional 1d6 points of anarchic damage on hit. A weapon that is aligned can bypass the damage reduction of certain creatures. This spell has no effect on a weapon that already has an alignment other than chaotic. Every group of up to 50 projectiles (which must be together at the time of casting) counts as one weapon for the purpose of benefiting from this spell. This spell can be cast on both natural and manufactured weapons.

Name: Brilliant Blade
Description: This spell allows you to channel incredible power into a melee weapon, turning it into a luminous blade of energy. The weapon acts as a +5 Brilliant Energy weapon. The spell is automatically canceled 1 round after the weapon leaves your hand. You cannot have more than one brilliant blade at a time.

Name: Chaotic Sword
Description: This spell allows you to channel the powers of chaos into your sword, or any other melee weapon you choose. The weapon acts as a +5 anarchic weapon (+5 enhancement bonus on attack and damage rolls, extra 2d6 damage against lawful opponents). It also emits a magic circle against law effect (as the spell). If the magic circle ends, the sword creates a new one on your turn as a free action. The spell is automatically canceled 1 round after the weapon leaves your hand. You cannot have more than one chaotic sword at a time.

Name: Deafening Song Bolt
Target: S: Up to 3 creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: Three notes you sing or perform become tangible bolts of arcane energy that shriek across the battlefield. Each bolt requires a ranged touch attack to hit and deals 3d10 points of sonic damage, deafening the target for 1d6 rounds. The bolts may be fired at the same or different targets, but all must be fired simultaneously.

Name: Delayed Blast Fireball
MaterialComponents: A ball of bat guano and sulfur
Description: This spell functions like Fireball, except that it is more powerful and can detonate up to 5 rounds after the spell is cast. The burst of flame deals 1d6 points of fire damage per caster level (maximum 20d6). The glowing bead created by delayed blast fireball can detonate immediately if you desire, or you can choose to delay the burst for as many as 5 rounds. You select the amount of delay upon completing the spell, and that time cannot change once it has been set unless someone touches the bead. If you choose a delay, the glowing bead sits at its destination until it detonates. A creature can pick up and hurl the bead as a thrown weapon (range increment 10 feet). If a creature handles and moves the bead within 1 round of its detonation, there is a 25% chance that the bead detonates while being handled.

Name: Electric Brand
Target: One creature/4 levels, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: You mark several allies with a sparking rune, causing them no damage. When you cast an electricity spell with an area effect and a duration of instantaneous, you may exclude any or all of the marked allies from the immediate effects of your spell, though any lingering effects of the spell may still affect them.

Name: Electrical Storm
MaterialComponents: A small copper key
Description: Crackling bolts of electricity arc through the spell’s area, dealing 4d6 electricity damage to all creatures within (Fort save half). A creature that fails on its Fortitude save is dazed for 1 round.

Name: Expend
MaterialComponents: Miniature broken hourglass
Target: Or Area: One creature; or a 20-ft.-radius burst
Description: You cause one or more creatures to use up one or more of their limited-use magical abilities without any actual effect. A limited-use magical ability is any supernatural or spell-like ability which a creature can only activate a certain number of times during a set interval (3/day, 1/hour, etc.). The spell does not affect abilities which the creature can use at will or which are constant. It also does not apply to magical items or anything else external to a creature.

Name: Fire Brand
Target: One creature/4 levels, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: You mark several allies with a flaming rune, causing them no damage. When you cast a fire spell with an area effect and a duration of instantaneous, you may exclude any or all of the marked allies from the immediate effects of your spell, though any lingering effects of the spell may still affect them.

Name: Flame Slash
Description: A slashing blade of incinerating flame lashes out at a nearby creature or object. The target instantly takes 10 points of fire damage per caster level (to a maximum of 200 points at 20th level). A successful Fortitude save halves this damage.

Name: Justice of the Wyrm King
Description: Spines of harsh red light burst outward from your body, giving the impression that you are covered in burning spikes.

Name: Ki Shout
Description: With a guttural bark, you unleash a sudden blast of sonic energy that strikes your opponent. The target takes 1d6 points of sonic damage per level (maximum 20d6) and is stunned for 1 round. Additionally, the force of the blast may be enough to knock the target away from you as well. To determine if the target is pushed away from you, make a combat maneuver check with a bonus equal to your caster level plus your Charisma modifier to resolve a bull rush attempt against the creature struck. The target is pushed to the extent of the bull rush result, and the result of the bull rush can push creatures beyond the spell’s normal range.

Name: Mage's Sword
Focus: A miniature platinum sword worth 250 gp
Description: This spell brings into being a shimmering, sword-like plane of force. The sword strikes at any opponent within its range, as you desire, starting in the round that you cast the spell. The sword attacks its designated target once each round on your turn. Its attack bonus is equal to your caster level + your Charisma bonus with an additional +3 enhancement bonus. As a force effect, it can strike ethereal and incorporeal creatures. It deals 4d6+3 plus one and a half times your Charisma modifier points of force damage, with a threat range of 19–20 and a critical multiplier of ×2.

Name: Magic Army
Target: One weapon/level, no two of which are more than 30 ft. apart
Description: You imbue a number of  manufactured weapons within range with magic, granting each weapon a +1 enhancement bonus on attack rolls and damage rolls per 5 caster levels (maximum +4). Every group of up to 50 projectiles (which must be together at the time of casting) counts as one weapon for the purpose of benefiting from this spell.

Name: Manabarbs
Description: The creature you designate is surrounded by a crackling red aura of vengeful energy. Once per round when the target makes an attack or casts a spell, it must succeed at a Fortitude saving throw (DC equal to the saving throw of this spell). If the target fails the saving throw, it takes 4d6 plus your Charisma modifier electricity damage. It takes half damage on a successful saving throw. You can dismiss this spell as an immediate action when its subject confirms a critical hit to negate the critical hit and daze the creature for 1 round. The attack still hits its target and deals normal damage. The effects of the daze occur after the attack.

Name: Napalm Eruption
MaterialComponents: A vial of alchemist’s fire worth 10 gp
Description: Sticky flames erupt from your space in all directions, causing 1d6 points of fire damage per caster level (maximum 20d6) to creatures and unattended objects in the area. This fire continues to burn for 2 rounds, dealing 1d6 points of fire damage per two caster levels (maximum 10d6) to any creature that took damage from the spell (a second Reflex save on each of the creature’s turns halves this additional damage for that round).

Name: Resonating Word
Description: You speak a terrible word of power, setting up potentially lethal vibrations in the chosen target. The target must save once each round on your turn, and the effects grow stronger for each saving throw the creature fails.

Name: Song of Discord
Description: This spell causes those within the area to turn on each other rather than attack their foes. Each affected creature has a 50% chance to attack the nearest target each round. (Roll to determine each creature’s behavior every round at the beginning of its turn.) A creature that does not attack its nearest neighbor is free to act normally for that round. Creatures forced by a song of discord to attack their fellows employ all methods at their disposal, choosing their deadliest spells and most advantageous combat tactics. They do not, however, harm targets that have fallen unconscious.

Name: Symbol of Stunning
MaterialComponents: Mercury and phosphorus, plus powdered ruby and opal worth a total of 5,000 gp
Description: When triggered, all creatures within 60 feet of a symbol of stunning become stunned for 1d6 rounds. Once triggered, the symbol becomes active and glows, lasting for 10 minutes per caster level. A creature that enters the area while the symbol is active is subject to its effect, whether or not that creature was in the area when it was triggered. A creature need save against the symbol only once as long as it remains within the area, though if it leaves the area and returns while the symbol is still active, it must save again.

Name: Waves of Ecstasy
Description: You emanate waves of intense pleasure that cause all targets within range to falter. Affected creatures are stunned for 1 round and are staggered for the remainder of the spell. A creature that makes its save is staggered for the first round and can act normally thereafter.

Name: Word of Chaos
Description: Any non-chaotic creature within the area of a word of chaos spell suffers the following ill effects, depending on their HD, whether the creature can hear the spell or not.

Name: Clenched Fist
Description: This spell functions like Interposing Hand except that the hand can also push or strike one opponent that you select. The floating hand can move as far as 60 feet and can attack in the same round. Since this hand is directed by you, its ability to notice or attack invisible or concealed creatures is no better than yours.

Name: Cloak of Chaos
Target: S: One creature/level in a 20-ft.-radius burst centered on you
Description: A random pattern of color surrounds the subjects, protecting them from attacks, granting them resistance to spells cast by lawful creatures, and causing lawful creatures that strike the subjects to become confused. This abjuration has four effects.

Name: Dance of a Thousand Cuts
Description: This spell functions as Dance of a Hundred Cuts, except you also gain the benefits of Haste while it is active.

Name: Dancing Mongoose
Description: You can cast this spell only at the beginning of your turn, before you take any other actions. After casting dancing mongoose, if you take a full-attack action this turn you can make an additional 2 attacks at the end of the full-attack. These additional attacks are not considered bonus attacks (such as those granted by Haste) and take the normal penalties for making additional attacks due to a higher base attack bonus. For instance, a 13th level Spellblade making a full attack would normally have his first attack at his full attack bonus, his second at a -5, and his third at a -10, then this spell would grant him a fourth at a -15, and a fifth at a -20.

Name: Fire Storm
Description: When a fire storm spell is cast, the whole area is shot through with sheets of roaring flame. All creatures within the area takes 1d6 points of fire damage per caster level (maximum 20d6). Unattended objects also take this damage. Creatures and objects that fail their Reflex save catch on fire, taking 4d6 points of fire damage each round until the flames are extinguished. Extinguishing the flames is a full-round action that requires a DC 20 Reflex save. The flames on non-flammable objects usually die out in 1 to 4 rounds depending on material.

Name: Greater Shout
SavingThrow: Fortitude partial or Reflex negates (object); see text
Description: This spell functions like Shout, except that the cone deals 10d6 points of sonic damage (or 1d6 points of sonic damage per caster level, maximum 20d6, against exposed brittle or crystalline objects or crystalline creatures). It also causes creatures to be stunned for 1 round and deafened for 4d6 rounds. A creature in the area of the cone can negate the stunning and halve both the damage and the duration of the deafness with a successful Fortitude save. A creature holding vulnerable objects can attempt a Reflex save to negate the damage to those objects.

Name: Greater Spellcrash
Description: You create a discordant blast of energy that disrupts the target’s available magic. The target loses 14 mana points from a random mana pool they possess (or up to the maximum they have remaining in that pool, if less than 14). A successful Will save reduces the lost mana by half. The target takes 1d4 points of Arcane damage per mana point lost and if they failed the Will save they cannot cast spells until the beginning of their next turn, as if they’d suffered Mana Burn. This spell has no effect on spell-like abilities.

Name: Incendiary Cloud
Description: An incendiary cloud spell creates a cloud of roiling smoke shot through with white-hot embers. The smoke obscures all sight as a fog cloud does. In addition, the white-hot embers within the cloud deal 6d6 points of fire damage to everything within the cloud on your turn each round. All targets can make Reflex saves each round to take half damage.

Name: Incendiary Ray
Description: A red-white ray of searing flame springs from your hand. You must succeed on a ranged touch attack with the ray to deal damage to a target. The ray deals 1d6 points of fire damage per caster level (maximum 25d6) and 1d4 points of Dexterity drain.

Name: Irresistible Dance
Description: The subject feels an undeniable urge to dance and begins doing so, complete with foot shuffling and tapping. The spell effect makes it impossible for the subject to do anything other than caper and prance in place. The effect imposes a -4 penalty to Armor Class and a -10 penalty on Reflex saves, and it negates any Armor Class bonus granted by a shield the target holds. The dancing subject provokes attacks of opportunity each round on its turn. A successful Will save reduces the duration of this effect to 1 round.

Name: Lightning Ring
MaterialComponents: A small glass ring and a bit of fur from any animal
Description: Your body quakes as a ring of crackling electricity explodes from your chest to whirl about you.

Name: Power Word Stun
Target: One creature with 150 hp or less
Description:
You utter a single word of power that instantly causes one creature of your choice to become stunned, whether the creature can hear the word or not. The duration of the spell depends on the target’s current hit point total. Any creature that currently has 151 or more hit points is unaffected by power word stun.


	
		
			Hit Points
			Duration
		
		
			50 or less
			4d4 rounds
		
		
			51-100
			2d4 rounds
		
		
			101-150
			1d4 rounds

Name: Stormbolts
MaterialComponents: A copper rod
Description: When you cast this spell, lightning spills forth from your body in all directions. The bolts do not harm natural vegetation or creatures in the area you wish to exclude from damage. Any other creatures within the area take 1d8 points of electricity damage per caster level (maximum 20d8) and are stunned for 1 round. A successful Saving Throw halves the damage and negates the stun effect.

Name: Symbol of Debauchery
MaterialComponents: A set of bull genitals and powdered ruby worth 5,000 gp
Description: You conjure a sizable symbol into being, a rune suggestive of bloated bodies, flung food, and flowing wine. When triggered, all creatures within 60 feet of the symbol of debauchery are instead filled with lust for the nearest conscious creature. This effect lasts for 1 round per caster level, even after creatures leave the symbol’s area of effect. Affected creatures are compelled to rush to the nearest creature in order to caress and kiss it, and may take no other actions. Each creature receives a single Will save when the symbol of debauchery is triggered to negate the effect. If no other creatures are visible, an affected creature may act normally. Once triggered, the symbol becomes active and glows, lasting for 10 minutes per caster level. A creature that enters the area while the symbol is active is subject to its effect, whether or not that creature was in the area when it was triggered. A creature need save against the symbol only once as long as it remains within the area, though if it leaves the area and returns while the symbol is still active, it must save again.

Name: Wall of Lava
Target: S: Lava wall whose area is up to one 5-ft. square/level (S)
Description: This spell creates a vertical wall of lava that is 1 inch thick for every 4 caster levels and composed of up to one 5-foot square per level. A wall of lava’s maximum height cannot exceed half of its width (with a minimum height of 5 feet). The wall cannot be conjured so that it occupies the same space as a creature or object. A section of a wall of lava can be destroyed by damage (hardness 4, hp 90), but if a section is destroyed, the remaining lava in the wall immediately fills in any such hole created, reducing the wall’s overall size by one 5-foot square but remaining a contiguous barrier. Each time a weapon strikes a wall of lava, it takes 2d6 points of fire damage (or the creature who strikes the wall takes 2d6 fire damage if the attack was via an unarmed strike or natural attack).

Name: Anarchic Exile
Description: With a word, your body gives off an explosion of wild energy, scorching the flesh of those creatures despised by chaotic beings. All lawful creatures in the area take 20d6 points of anarchic damage. A successful Will save reduces this damage by half, creatures with a lawful subtype take a -4 penalty on their save against this spell.

Name: Crushing Hand
Description: This spell functions as interposing hand, except that it can also grapple one opponent as grasping hand. Its CMB and CMD for grapple checks use your caster level in place of its base attack bonus, with a +14 bonus for its Strength score (39) and a +1 bonus for being Large (its Dexterity is 10, granting no bonus to the CMD). A crushing hand deals 4d6+14 points of magical damage on each successful grapple check against an opponent. The crushing hand can instead be directed to bull rush a target (as forceful hand), using the same bonuses outlined above, or it can be directed to interpose itself, as interposing hand does.

Name: Deadly Sunstroke
MaterialComponents: A pinch of salt
Target: S: One creature/level, no two of which are more than 60 ft. apart
Description: Desiccating heat overwhelms your foes, boiling water from their bodies and draining their vitality. Each creature takes 1d6 points of desiccation damage per two caster levels (maximum 15d6) and is dehydrated. A successful Fortitude save results in half damage and negates the dehydration.

Name: Detonate
MaterialComponents: A match and a piece of string
Description: The creature you point at explodes in a massive spray of fire. If the target fails its saving throw, this spell deals 10 points of fire damage per caster level to the creature. If this damage kills the creature, an explosion extends out to a 20-foot-radius burst around it. Creatures in this area take 1d6 points of fire damage per caster level (maximum 20d6), though they can attempt Reflex saves for half damage. The exploded creature’s remains are scattered and vaporized, leaving nothing but dry ash, though its equipment is unaffected and is left behind in the square it was in.

Name: Meteor Swarm
SavingThrow: None or Reflex half; see text
Description: Meteor swarm is a very powerful and spectacular spell that is similar to fireball in many aspects. When you cast it, four 2-foot-diameter spheres spring from your outstretched hand and streak in straight lines to the spots you select. The meteor spheres leave a fiery trail of sparks.

Name: Rain of Red Poppies
MaterialComponents: A fresh red poppy flower
Description: Red poppies fall from the sky. The poppies explode with chaotic energy upon striking lawful creatures, each of which takes 5d6 points of anarchic damage whenever they begin their turn or pass through Rain of Red Poppies. In addition, creatures that take damage from Rain of Red Poppies must make a Fortitude save. Those that fail the Fortitude save are nauseated (unable to attack, cast spells, concentrate on spells, perform any task requiring concentration, or take anything other than a single move action per turn) as long as the creature is in the area and for 1d4+1 rounds after it leaves.  A creature that exits the spell’s area and enters again must begin making Fortitude saves against the nausea effect again.

Name: Ring of Fire
MaterialComponents: A disc of basalt  worth 5 gp
Description: You utter deep, rumbling tones as you make arcane gestures over the basalt disc, causing it to glow white hot and evaporate in your hand. When you finish, the ground tears open and hot lava wells up from the depths of the earth.

Name: Shatterstorm
Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels); see text
Description: Shatterstorm creates a blast of energy that disrupts magical items or magical artifacts, shutting off their mystical properties. Each magic item or magical artifact must make a successful Will save or be turned into a normal item for the duration of this spell. An item in a creature’s possession uses its own Will save bonus or its possessor’s Will save bonus, whichever is higher.

Name: Symbol of Strife
MaterialComponents: Mercury and phosphorus, plus powdered ruby and opal worth a total of 15,000 gp
Description: When triggered, all creatures within the radius of a symbol of strife are compelled to attack the nearest conscious creature for 1 round per caster level (similar to the “attack nearest creature” result of the confusion spell), even after leaving the symbol’s area of effect. If no other creatures are visible, an affected creature can act normally. Once triggered, the symbol becomes active and glows, lasting for 10 minutes per caster level. A creature that enters the area while the symbol is active is subject to its effect, whether or not that creature was in the area when it was triggered. A creature need save against the symbol only once as long as it remains within the area, though if it leaves the area and returns while the symbol is still active, it must save again.

Name: Telekinetic Storm
Description: You generate a storm of telekinetic energy that emanates from you, ripping through the spell’s area of effect with devastating force. Any creature caught in the spell’s radius takes 1d6 points of force damage per caster level (maximum 20d6) and is dazed and stunned for 1 round. A successful Fortitude save reduces the damage by half and negates the dazed and stunned effects.

Name: Transmute Rock to Lava
Description: As you release the spell’s energy, the targeted area of stone instantly turns to molten lava, and the uncomfortable burning in your chest immediately ceases.

Name: Lightning Monolith's Grasp
Description: You channel the force of a lightning monolith into your hand to deliver a melee touch attack that deals 1d10 points of electricity damage per caster level (maximum 30d10) and stuns your opponent for 1d4 rounds. A successful Fortitude save negates the stunning, but does not reduce the electricity damage. When delivering the jolt, you gain a +10 bonus to hit enemies wearing or made of metal. Such enemies take a -2 penalty on their saving throw against this spell.

Name: Molten Edge
MaterialComponents: A basalt dagger, worth 5 gp
Description: A 5-foot-long blade of crimson energy and molten stone erupts forth into your hand. You wield this molten edge as if it were a longsword. Attacks with the molten edge are melee touch attacks. The blade deals 20d6 points of fire damage when it strikes a creature, like submerging the creature into magma. A creature struck by this blade takes 5d6 points of fire damage at the beginning of their next turn and is entangled by the cooling magma. A creature may make a Reflex save when struck to reduce the damage by half and negate the additional effects. Since the blade is largely immaterial, your Strength modifier does not apply to the damage. A molten edge can ignite materials with extremely high melting points, much like magma is normally able to do.

Name: Steel Hurricane
Description:
You can cast this spell only at the beginning of your turn, before you take any other actions. After casting steel hurricane, you can take a full-round action to make a special round of attacks. You may choose one of two options when casting this spell:


	
	Focused Assault: Spending the full-round action you make one melee attack at your full base attack bonus against each opponent within reach. You gain a +5 circumstance bonus on all of these attack and damage rolls. 
		Rapid Assault: If you are wielding two or more weapons, or a double weapon, you can attack each enemy within reach once with each weapon or end (up to a maximum of two attacks per enemy). These attacks are made at your full base attack bonus but take the normal penalty for wielding multiple weapons.

Name: Acid Splash
Description: You fire a small orb of acid at the target. You must succeed on a ranged touch attack to hit your target. The orb deals 1d3 points of acid damage. This acid disappears after 1 round.

Name: Caltrops
Description: You speak the words and spread your palm open, as if you were throwing jacks. Coppery sparks spring from your palm, filling the corridor with small four-pronged spikes.

Name: Daze Animal
Target: One animal of 4 HD or less
Description: This spell clouds the mind of an animal with 4 or fewer Hit Dice so that it takes no actions. Animals of 5 or more HD are not affected. A dazed subject is not stunned, so attackers get no special advantage against it. After a creature has been dazed by this spell, it is immune to the effects of this spell for 1 minute.

Name: Detect Poison
Target: Or Area: One creature, one object, or a 5-ft. cube
Description: You determine whether a creature, object, or area has been poisoned or is poisonous. You can attempt to identify the exact type of poison (or poisons) with a Craft (Poison) check, a Craft (alchemy) check at a -5 penalty, or an Intelligence check (choose one option when casting the spell). Identifying a poison is typically a DC 20, though unusual or rare poisons may be a DC 30 or higher. The spell can penetrate barriers, but 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt blocks it (though it can typically only target a 5-ft. cube if the caster’s line of sight is blocked).

Name: Know Direction
Description: When you cast this spell, you instantly know the direction of north from your current position. The spell is effective in any environment in which “north” exists, but it may not work in extraplanar settings. Your knowledge of north is correct at the moment of casting, but you can get lost again within moments if you don’t find some external reference point to help you keep track of direction.

Name: Minor Alteration
Description: Your fingertips glow green, and you add a few details to enhance your disguise.

Name: Purify Food and Drink
Target: 1 cu. ft./level of contaminated food and water
Description: This spell makes spoiled, rotten, diseased, poisonous, or otherwise contaminated food and water pure and suitable for eating and drinking. This spell does not prevent subsequent natural decay or spoilage. Unholy water and similar food and drink of significance is spoiled by purify food and drink, but the spell has no effect on creatures of any type nor upon magic potions. Water weighs about 8 pounds per gallon. One cubic foot of water contains roughly 8 gallons and weighs about 60 pounds.

Name: Stick
MaterialComponents: A bit of dried glue
Target: Nonmagical, unattended object weighing up to 5 lb.
Description: Lacking someone to hold the item where you need it, you mutter and wave your hand in a simple gesture before sticking the item in place.

Name: Acidspike
Duration: Until the end of your next turn.
Description: When you cast this spell, caustic gasses ripple around your weapons, ready to strike out.

Name: Adhesive Spittle
Description: You spit out a viscous liquid at a nearby creature. If you succeed on a ranged touch attack, the liquid sticks to the target like a tanglefoot bag.. The DCs to counteract this adhesive (to avoid being stuck to the floor, to fly, to break the adhesive, or to cast a spell) use the spell’s DC rather than a tanglefoot bag’s normal DCs. The adhesive persists for 1d4+1 rounds after you spit it. The normal rules for a tanglefoot bag are listed below.

Name: Ant Haul
MaterialComponents: A miniature pulley or the body of an ant
Target: Creature of size gargantuan or smaller touched
Description: The target’s carrying capacity increases, as if the target were one size category larger. This spell fails to function on a creature greater than size gargantuan. This does not affect the creature’s actual Strength in any way, merely the amount of material it can carry while benefiting from this spell. It also has no effect on encumbrance due to armor. If the creature wears armor it still takes the normal penalties for doing so regardless of how much weight the spell allows it to carry.

Name: Blockade
MaterialComponents: A block of wood, less than 3 inches on a side
Description: You drop a tiny wooden block before you. It rapidly begins growing and hits the ground with a heavy thud, now a perfect 5-foot cube of dense wood.

Name: Bowstaff
Description: The bow that is touched takes on the rigidity and toughness of forged steel, allowing it to be used as a melee weapon. The spell allows a shortbow to be used as a club or a longbow to be used as a quarterstaff, although the bow retains its normal hit points and hardness. The bow’s enhancement bonus, if any, applies on melee attack and damage rolls. Additional weapon special weapon qualities also apply to melee attacks if such qualities can be added to a melee weapon.

Name: Call Animal
Description: This spell calls the nearest wild animal of a particular type you designate (provided the animal’s CR is equal to or less than your caster level) to seek you out. The animal moves toward you under its own power, so the time it takes to arrive depends on how close an animal of the desired type is when you cast the spell. If there is no animal of that type capable of reaching you within the spell’s duration, you are aware of this fact, but the spell is wasted. Knowledge of the local fauna makes this spell more effective, and the GM may permit a Knowledge (nature) skill check (DC 15) to know what animals can be found in an area.

Name: Calm Animals
Target: Animals within 30 ft of each other
Description: This spell soothes and quiets animals, rendering them docile and harmless. Only ordinary animals (those with Intelligence scores of 1 or 2) can be affected by this spell. All the subjects must be of the same kind, and no two may be more than 30 feet apart. The maximum number of HD of animals you can affect is equal to 2d4 plus caster level.

Name: Caustic Gauntlet
Description: Bristling shards of rock surround your fist, a caustic mist enshrouding your forearm.

Name: Caustic Grasp
Description: Your successful melee touch attack deals 1d6 points of acid damage per caster level (maximum 5d6).

Name: Caustic Spray
Description: Any creature in the area of the acid spray takes 1d4 points of acid damage per caster level (maximum 5d4).

Name: Climbing Tree
Description: At your call, a tree snakes up from the earth, in seconds growing as tall as trees that have lived for years.

Name: Detect Animals or Plants
Description:
You can detect a particular kind of animal or plant in a cone emanating out from you in whatever direction you face. You must think of a kind of animal or plant when using the spell, but you can change the animal or plant kind each round. The amount of information revealed depends on how long you search a particular area or focus on a specific kind of animal or plant.


	
	1st Round: Presence or absence of that kind of animal or plant in the area.
	


	
	2nd Round: Number of individuals of the specified kind in the area and the condition of the healthiest specimen.
	


	
	3rd Round: The condition (see below) and location of each individual present. If an animal or a plant is outside your line of sight, then you discern its direction but not its exact location.

Name: Detect Metal
Focus: A magnetized nail or nugget of ore
Description: You detect any metal objects or creatures within a 60-foot cone.

Name: Diagnose Disease
Target: Or Area: One creature, one object, or a 5-ft. cube
Description: You determine whether a creature, object, or area carries any sort of disease or infestation (including molds, slimes, and similar hazards), or any exceptional or supernatural effects causing the sickened or nauseated effects. You can attempt to identify the exact type of disease (or diseases) with a Heal check or a Wisdom check (choose one option when casting the spell). Identifying a disease is typically a DC 20, though unusual or rare disease may be a DC 30 or higher. If the target is a creature, you gain a +4 bonus on Heal checks to treat the creature’s disease(s) if you successfully identify them. The spell can penetrate many barriers, but 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt blocks it (though it can typically only target a 5-ft. cube if the caster’s line of sight is blocked).

Name: Enhance Water
Description: This spell transforms water into a  basic alcoholic beverage, typically ale, beer, mead, or wine. The alcohol is of poor to middling quality but perfectly drinkable. The spell also serves to remove poisons, diseases, minerals, and other toxins from the water as it transforms, similar to Purify Food and Drink. The more contaminants that exist in the water, the darker the ale or the more full-bodied the wine becomes. The beverage’s alcohol content is not affected by the presence or absence of contaminants. Any alcoholic beverage created in this way is as filling as it would normally be but it provides no nutrients (effectively empty calories).

Name: Entangle
Focus: A bit of tangled hemp rope
Description: This spell causes tall grass, weeds, and other plants to wrap around creatures in the area of effect or those that enter the area. Creatures that fail their save gain the entangled condition. Creatures that make their save can move as normal, but those that remain in the area must save again at the end of your turn. Creatures that move into the area must save immediately. Those that fail must end their movement and gain the entangled condition. Entangled creatures can attempt to break free as a move action, making a Strength or Escape Artist check. The DC for this check is equal to the DC of the spell. The entire area of effect is considered difficult terrain while the effect lasts.

Name: Expeditious Excavation
MaterialComponents: Tiny shovel
Description: You can excavate and move earth, dust, and sand up to the size of a 5-foot cube. If you are buried, you may open a 5-foot cube around yourself, but the spell cannot be used for tunneling.

Name: Fist of Stone
MaterialComponents: A pebble
Description: The spell ends as you clench your fist, which now has the texture and look of stone.

Name: Foundation of Stone
Target: One creature/level, no two of which are more than 30 ft. apart
Description: Calling upon the strength of the earth, you lend some of the stability of stone to your allies as their legs appear to turn stony.

Name: Glue Seal
Description: You cover a solid surface with a layer of sticky glue. Anyone in the area when the spell is cast must attempt a Reflex save. Those who fail become entangled, but can break free by succeeding at a combat maneuver check or an Escape Artist check as a standard action against the DC of this spell. The area of the spell is considered difficult terrain. A creature moving through the glue must succeed at a combat maneuver check or an Escape Artist check as part of its move action (DC = the spell’s DC). Creatures that fail lose their movement and become entangled in the first square they enter.

Name: Grease
MaterialComponents: Butter
Description: A grease spell covers a solid surface with a layer of slippery grease. Any creature in the area when the spell is cast must make a successful Reflex save or fall. A creature can walk within or through the area of grease at half normal speed with a DC 10 Acrobatics check. Failure means it can’t move that round (and must then make a Reflex save or fall), while failure by 5 or more means it falls (see the Acrobatics skill for details). Creatures that do not move on their turn do not need to make this check and are not considered flat-footed.

Name: Goodberry
Description: Casting goodberry makes 2d4 freshly picked berries magical. You (as well as any other druid of 3rd or higher level) can immediately discern which berries are affected. Each transmuted berry is acts as if it were a normal meal for a Medium creature. The berries become caloric, but are no more nutritious than a normal berry would be (effectively empty calories). The berry also cures 1 point of damage when eaten, subject to a maximum of 8 points of such curing in any 24-hour period. This healing is not positive energy, but it cannot heal the undead or any other creature that does not recover hit points with rest.

Name: Hairline Fractures
MaterialComponents: A broken twig
Target: 5-foot-square section of stone or a creature with the earth subtype
Description: With a single touch, you create temporary hairline fractures in a piece of stone or a creature with the earth subtype. If you cast this spell on a section of stone, you reduce its hardness to 5 and its hit points to 10/inch of thickness. If you cast this spell on a creature with the earth subtype, that creature takes a –2 penalty to AC for the spell’s duration. Make whole reverses this spell’s effect.

Name: Iron Scarf
Description: When you cast this spell, you flick a silk scarf at one creature within range, magically propelling it toward the target. The scarf assumes an iron-like hardness on the way. You must have line of sight to the target and hit with a normal ranged attack with the scarf. If you hit, the target takes 1d8 points of slashing damage +1 point per caster level (maximum +5). The scarf counts as magic for the purposes of overcoming damage reduction. The scarf returns to you after being thrown if it can.

Name: Lesser Orb of Acid
Description: Your quick, precise movements culminate in your open palm facing your target. An orb of dark green acid flies from your hand.

Name: Mighty Fist of the Earth
Focus: A miniature carved fist made of granite
Description: You create a fist-sized rock that flies toward one enemy. Make an unarmed strike attack roll against the target as if it were in your threatened area. If the attack is successful, the rock deals bludgeoning damage to the target as if you had hit the target with your unarmed strike. If you have a ki pool, as long as you have at least 1 point in your ki pool, the rock counts as a ki strike.

Name: Mimicry
Description: You feel a brief tingle in your throat. When you open your mouth, your voice is no longer your own.

Name: Monkey Fish
Description: Your hands and feet alter to make you better at climbing and swimming. You gain a 10 foot climb speed and swim speed. This spell has no effect if you are wearing medium or heavy armor or carrying a medium or heavy load.

Name: Mudball
Description: When you cast this spell, you conjure a single ball of sticky mud and launch it at an enemy’s face as a ranged touch attack. If the mudball hits, the target must make a Reflex save. On a failed save, the target is blinded. On a successful save, the creature keeps some of the mud out of their eyes, but still suffers a 50% miss chance on all attack rolls. Each round at the beginning of its turn, a creature effected by this spell can attempt a Reflex saving throw to shake off the mud, ending the effect. The mudball can also be wiped off by the creature affected by it or by a creature adjacent to the creature affected by it as a standard action.

Name: Mudslap
Description: You surround your hand with an expanding blob of sticky mud. Your successful melee touch attack deals 1d6 points of bludgeoning damage per 2 caster levels (minimum 1d6, maximum 3d6) and entangles the target in the mud. A successful Reflex save negates the entangle effect but not the damage. Entangled creatures can attempt to break free as a move action, making a Strength or Escape Artist check. The DC for this check is equal to the DC of the spell.

Name: Negate Aroma
MaterialComponents: A pinch of alum
Target: S: one creature or object/level, all of which must be within 30 ft.
Description: With a gesture, this spell allows you to muffle even the foulest or most distinctive scents. When cast, the spell weakens all natural and unnatural odors of the targeted creatures or objects. Increase the DC by +10 to track, locate, or pinpoint by the scent special quality a creature under the effect of negate aroma. In addition, this spell prevents the target creature from using the stench special ability and similar odor-based abilities (such as those possessed by troglodytes).

Name: Pass without Trace
Description: The subject or subjects of this spell leave lighter footprints while moving. Survival checks made to track the subjects of this spell suffer a -10 circumstance penalty. This penalty applies to all tracks made by the subjects during the spell’s duration, even after the spell has ended.

Name: Remove Sickness
Description: You quell feelings of illness and nausea in the target, giving it a +4 morale bonus on saving throws against nausea and sickened effects. If the subject is already under the influence of one of these effects when receiving the spell, that effect is suppressed for the duration of the spell.

Name: Speak with Animals
Description: You can ask questions of and receive answers from animals, but the spell doesn’t make them any more friendly than normal. Wary and cunning animals are likely to be terse and evasive, while the more stupid ones make inane comments. If an animal is friendly toward you, it may do some favor or service for you.

Name: Spore Burst
MaterialComponents: A tiny puffball mushroom
Target: One willing plant creature; see text
Description: You cause a willing plant creature’s body to sprout small, puffy mushrooms that remain for 1 minute per caster level or until the creature uses them. As a standard action, the target can cause these mushrooms to burst open, releasing a cloud of toxic spores that affect all creatures in a 20-foot-radius spread. Those in the area must succeed at Fortitude saves or be sickened for 1d6 rounds as they are overcome by sneezing and coughing.

Name: Stone Fist
MaterialComponents: A chip of granite
Description: This spell transforms your hands into living stone. While this spell is in effect, your unarmed strikes do not provoke attacks of opportunity and deal 1d6 points of lethal bludgeoning damage (1d4 if you are Small). In addition, your unarmed strikes ignore the hardness of any object with a hardness less than 8.

Name: Stone Shield
Description: A 1-inch-thick slab of stone springs into existence, floating around you and interposing itself between you and an opponent of your choice that you can see. The stone shield provides you with cover from that enemy until the beginning of your next turn, granting you a +4 bonus to Armor Class and a +2 bonus on Reflex saving throws. If the opponent’s attack misses you by 4 or less, the attack strikes the shield instead. The stone shield has hardness 8 and 15 hit points. If the shield is destroyed, the spell ends and the shield crumbles away into nothingness. Spells and effects that damage an area deal damage to the shield. The shield uses your save bonuses for saving throws.

Name: Stumble Gap
Description: You create a shallow extra-dimensional hole perfectly sized to trip anyone who steps within it. This hole occupies a single 5-foot square with a depth of six inches. Any creature occupying the square when you first create the hole, or who later steps into the square containing the hole, must make a Reflex saving throw to avoid falling prone in an adjacent square and taking 1d6 points of damage. A creature that makes its saving throw still stumbles ever so slightly and takes a -1 penalty on all Dexterity-based skill checks for 1 round. The spell has no effect on creatures adjacent to the square containing the hole.

Name: Thorn Dagger
Description: You create a masterwork dagger out of an acidic thorn. The dagger deals 1 point of acid damage in addition to normal dagger damage, but cannot bear its wielders weapon enchantment bonuses. If the dagger leaves your hand for more than 1 round, the acids within the thorn consumes the dagger and the spell ends. At 6th level, the dagger functions as a +1 caustic dagger. At 11th level, it gains the returning property when thrown, boiling away and reforming in your hand just before your next turn.

Name: Thorn Javelin
Description: A wooden thorn the size of a javelin (appropriate for your size) appears in your open hand. You can wield this thorn as a javelin, and you are proficient in its use. Any creature struck by the javelin must succeed at a Fortitude save or be sickened for 1 round. If you throw the javelin, another one appears in your hand. Any javelin that leaves your grasp disappears at the end of your turn. Each javelin attack you make reduces the spell’s remaining duration by 1 minute. If an attack reduces the remaining duration to 0 minutes or less, the spell ends after that attack resolves.

Name: Tracking Mark
Description: You gain a supernatural ability to detect tracks and other clues left behind by the target. You treat the DCs of all Survival checks made to track the target as if they were 5 lower than normal, and you gain a +5 bonus on Perception checks made to notice the target if it is using Stealth or recognize it if it is using Disguise.

Name: Tripvine
Description: You animate a rope, vine, or similar object so that it attempts to trip any creature that comes near. The rope attacks anything in a 10-foot-square area you designate. The rope does not provoke an attack of opportunity. Its CMB is equal to your caster level +2. A tripped target that was running, jumping, or charging takes 1d6 points of nonlethal damage. Creatures aware of the tripvine gain a +4 bonus to their CMD against it.

Name: Web Bolt
Description: You launch a ball of webbing at a target, which must make a save or be affected as if by a web spell occupying only the creature’s space. If the creature saves or breaks free of the webbing, the remaining webs dissolve and the square is not considered difficult terrain. The spell has no effect if the target is not on or adjacent to a solid surface that can support the webbing.

Name: Wood Wose
Description: Whistling up nature’s power and waving a branch of holly, you create a helper for the task at hand.

Name: Acid Arrow
MaterialComponents: Rhubarb leaf and an adder’s stomach
Description: An arrow of acid springs from your hand and speeds to its target. You must succeed on a ranged touch attack to hit your target. The arrow deals 2d4 points of acid damage with no splash damage. For every three caster levels you possess, the acid, unless neutralized, lasts for another round (to a maximum of 6 additional rounds at 18th level), dealing another 2d4 points of damage in each round.

Name: Acid Maw
Target: Your animal companion, familiar, or other bonded creature
Description: Your bonded companion’s bite attack deals an additional 1d4 points of acid damage, and the acid deals another 1d4 points of acid damage to the target on the next round. The acid continues to deal damage for 1 additional round per 4 caster levels (to a maximum of 6 total rounds at caster level 20th). This ongoing acid damage doesn’t stack from multiple attacks, but the duration resets if a newer bite would cause the ongoing damage to last longer than the duration remaining from a previous one.

Name: Adhesive Blood
Description: Your blood thickens to becomes a glue-like substance upon contact with air. A piercing or slashing weapon that deals hit point damage to you is stuck fast unless the wielder succeeds at a Reflex save. A creature can pry off a stuck weapon on its turn as a standard action with a successful Strength check against the spell’s DC. While stuck to you, a weapon cannot be used to make an attack. Strong alcohol or universal solvent dissolves the adhesive. If you get a natural weapon stuck to you or a creature refuses to let go of their stuck weapon, you both gain the grappled condition. The glue breaks down 5 rounds after you die, or when the duration ends. This glue has no effect while underwater or in environments that lack air.

Name: Animal Aspect
Description:
You gain some of the beneficial qualities of an animal. Your base form is largely unchanged and your size is unaltered, but some of your body parts are altered. Armor or gear you are wearing adjusts to your new shape for the duration of the spell. When you cast animal aspect, choose one of the following animals to gain the associated benefits. You can only have one animal aspect or greater animal aspect spell active on you at a time.


	
	Frog: Your legs become elongated and muscular. You gain a +4 competence bonus on Acrobatics checks, and you always jump as if you had a running start.
	


	
	Gorilla: Your arms become long, flexible, and strong like those of a great ape. Your unarmed damage die type increases by one step, and you gain a +4 competence bonus on combat maneuver checks when making the grapple or reposition combat maneuver.
	


	
	Monkey: Your hands and arms become dexterous like those of a simian. You gain a +4 competence bonus on Climb checks, and you can throw objects as if you had the Throw Anything feat.
	


	
	Otter: Your hands and feet gain webbing, and your lungs gain capacity, allowing you to move through the water with ease. You gain a Swim speed equal to half your speed, and all the benefits of having a swim speed. Additionally, you can hold your breath for 4 rounds per point of Constitution before being forced to make Constitution checks to keep holding your breath.
	


	
	Raccoon: Your hands become extremely dexterous, and your feet become padded. You gain a +2 competence bonus on Disable Device, Sleight of Hand, and Stealth checks.
	


	
	Raptor: Your legs become built for running speed, like those of a deinonychus. You gain a enhancement bonus of +20 feet to your base speed.
	


	
	Tree Lizard: Your hands and feet gain climbing claws and climbing pads. You gain a climb speed equal to half your normal speed and all the benefits of having a natural climb speed.

Name: Animalistic Power
MaterialComponents: A few hairs each from a bull, bear, and cat
Description: You imbue the subject with an aspect of the natural world. The subject gains a +2 enhancement bonus to Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution.

Name: Animal Messenger
MaterialComponents: A morsel of food the animal likes
Description: You compel a Tiny animal to go to a spot you designate. The most common use for this spell is to get an animal to carry a message to your allies. The animal cannot be one tamed or trained by someone else, including such creatures as familiars and animal companions.

Name: Animal Purpose Training
MaterialComponents: A swatch of black cloth
Description: You instill the target animal with a general purpose (see the Handle Animal skill), which can be any purpose except combat training—fighting, guarding, heavy labor, hunting, performance, or riding. This purpose supersedes the animal’s previous trained purpose and any tricks it knows. When the spell ends, the animal reverts to its previous trained purpose and known tricks.

Name: Animal Trance
Target: S: Animals or magical beasts with Intelligence 1 or 2
Description: Your swaying motions and music (or singing, or chanting) compel animals and magical beasts to do nothing but watch you. Only a creature with an Intelligence score of 1 or 2 can be fascinated by this spell. Roll 2d6 to determine the total number of HD worth of creatures that you fascinate. The closest targets are selected first until no more targets within range can be affected. Targets must be able to see and hear you for them to remain fascinated, if they ever go a full round without being able to see and hear you the fascination breaks.

Name: Aspect of the Bear
Focus: A miniature amulet of a bear
Description: You take on an aspect of a bear. You gain a +2 enhancement bonus to natural armor and a +2 enhancement bonus on CMB rolls. You can also perform bull rush, grapple, and overrun combat maneuvers without provoking attacks of opportunity.

Name: Barkskin
Focus: A bit of bark from an oak preserved in resin
Description: Barkskin toughens a creature’s skin. The effect grants a +2 enhancement bonus to the creature’s existing natural armor bonus. This enhancement bonus increases by 1 for every three caster levels above 3rd, to a maximum of +5 at 12th level.

Name: Beastspeak
Description: When you’re in the form of an animal (such as when you are using wild shape or are affected by a polymorph effect), you can speak normally, including when you cast spells with verbal components, and you sound like your normal self when you speak. You can cast this spell while in animal form, using animal-appropriate somatic components.

Name: Binding Earth
Target: One creature or unattended object (see text)
Description: If the target of this spell fails its Fortitude save, areas of earth and stone floor act as a snapping quagmire that pulls the target down and damages it if it attempts to move through such terrain.

Name: Branch to Branch
Description: With the last guttural utterance, you have the impression that you would feel more at ease in a canopy of trees.

Name: Briar Web
Description: With a sound like a thousand knives being unsheathed, the plants in the area grow sharp thorns and warp into a thick briar patch.

Name: Bristle
Description: You give a creature the ability to redirect a portion of its innate toughness away from its own defense and toward the amount of damage it deals with natural attacks. Each round, as a swift action at the start of its turn, the creature can choose to reduce some or all of its natural armor bonus to AC and gain an enhancement bonus on all damage rolls for natural attacks equal to that amount. The reduction to natural armor, and thus the enhancement bonus on damage rolls, cannot exceed 1 point per 3 caster levels, to a maximum penalty/bonus of -5/+5 at 15th level. A creature cannot reduce its natural armor bonus to less than 0 with this spell.

Name: Brittle Portal
Description: This spell weakens the bonds of materials, and reduces the hardness of any one non-magical surface within its area of effect by 1 per caster level (to a maximum reduction of 10 at 10th level), to a minimum hardness of 0. The spell is centered on a flat surface chosen by the caster, and the hardness reduction effect persists for the duration of the spell. You affect one surface of up to a 5-foot square in area to a depth of 1 to 4 feet, depending on the toughness or resilience of the material.

Name: Burst of Nettles
Description: You release a burst of barbed, acid-filled nettles. Creatures caught in the burst take 3d6 points of acid damage plus an additional 1d6 points of acid damage on the next round. Those that save take half damage from the initial burst and no damage on the next round.

Name: Carry Companion
MaterialComponents: A pinch of sand or limestone dust
Description: You touch an animal or magical beast that has a helpful attitude toward you, instantly transforming the creature into a miniature figurine of stone, small enough to fit into the palm of your hand. Creatures with an attitude of less than helpful will not tolerate this spell, nor will creatures under a magical compulsion effect, and it automatically fails to work on them.

Name: Caustic Sword
Description: You cause a held weapon to become wreathed in sizzling acids. This acid does not harm the weapon or its wielder, but for the duration of the spell, it delivers acid damage in addition to its normal damage.

Name: Caustic Wake
Description: Caustic mists trail behind the targeted weapon, potentially damaging foes even when the weapon misses.

Name: Certain Grip
MaterialComponents: A tiny ball of tar
Description: The subject’s grip and footing become sure, granting a +4 competence bonus on Climb checks, on Acrobatics checks to balance, and to CMD against bull rush, disarm, drag, reposition, and trip attempts.

Name: Communal Ant Haul
Focus: A miniature pulley or the body of an ant
Target: Creatures of size gargantuan or smaller touched
Description: This spell functions like Ant Haul except you may divide the duration in 2-hour intervals among the creatures touched.

Name: Commune with Birds
Description: You utter a question in the form of a low-pitched bird call that can be heard up to a mile away, and can understand the responses given by birds in the area. Over the next 10 minutes, the birds reply as if you had asked them the question using speak with animals, giving you a general consensus answer to the question based on their knowledge. For example, you could ask if there is drinkable water in the area, the location of predators or other creatures, directions to a mountaintop or other natural feature, and so on, and the local bird communities would answer to the best of their ability.

Name: Create Pit
Description: You create a 10-foot-by-10-foot extra-dimensional hole with a depth of 10 feet per two caster levels (maximum 30 feet). You must create the pit on a horizontal surface of sufficient size. Since it extends into another dimension, the pit has no weight and does not otherwise displace the original underlying material. You can create the pit in the deck of a ship as easily as in a dungeon floor or the ground of a forest. Any creature standing in the area where you first conjured the pit must make a Reflex saving throw to avoid falling into it. In addition, the edges of the pit are sloped, and any creature ending its turn on a square adjacent to the pit must make a Reflex saving throw with a +2 bonus to avoid falling into it. Creatures subjected to an effect intended to push them into the pit (such as bull rush) do not get a saving throw to avoid falling in if they are affected by the pushing effect.

Name: Delay Disease
Description: If the target is currently infected with a disease or is exposed to a disease during the spell’s duration, you must make a caster level check against the disease’s DC to suspend it for the duration of the spell; otherwise, that disease affects the target normally. Delay disease does not cure any damage a disease may have already done.

Name: Delay Poison
Description: If the target is currently afflicted with a poison or is exposed to a poison during the spell’s duration, you must make a caster level check against the poison’s DC to suspend it for the duration of the spell; otherwise, that poison affects the target normally. Delay poison does not cure any damage a poison may have already done.

Name: Detect Disease
Description: You are able to sense the presence of disease. The amount of information revealed depends on how long you study the particular area or subjects.

Name: Detect Relations
Target: S: One creature per level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description:
You can determine whether or not two or more creatures are related by blood. The amount of information gleaned depends on how long you study a particular area or set of subjects.


	
	1st round: Whether or not the subjects are related by blood.
	


	
	2nd round: Number of related subjects and their general relation to one another (for example, this would reveal that one subject is a descendant of the other, but it would not specify “mother” or “grandmother”).
	


	
	3rd round: Precise relationship between subjects in the area. A target’s Will save prevents you from determining its exact relationship with another creature, and only one subject needs to succeed at this save to prevent you from determining its relationship with another creature. (So, for instance, if two brothers are in the area and one succeeds at his Will save, you could tell that they are siblings, but could not distinguish whether they are full- or half-siblings.) Each round, you can turn to detect relations in a new area. The spell can penetrate barriers, but 6 inches of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 1 foot of wood or dirt will block it.

Name: Earth Lock
MaterialComponents: A diamond chip worth 5 gp, embedded in a piece of charcoal
Target: One 1-foot length of tunnel with a diameter of up to 10 feet.
Description: You scribe a spiral in the air with the diamond-tipped bit of charcoal, chanting the words of the spell. Immediately the sides of the cavern begin to contract, sealing the passage behind you.

Name: Earthen Grasp
MaterialComponents: A miniature hand sculpted from clay
Description: You raise your arm above your hand, your fingers flexed like talons. Nearby, an arm made of earth but as large as a person erupts from the ground, its hand grasping at the air.

Name: Easy Trail
Description: You radiate an energy that gently pushes plants aside, allowing easy passage for long journeys.

Name: Flotsam Vessel
MaterialComponents: Driftwood branch or river rat’s tail
Description: This spell assembles a sturdy raft and oars from driftwood, reeds, and other river detritus. The smallest raft created by the spell is roughly 5 feet square, increasing by an additional 5 feet square for every 2 caster levels you possess. Each 5-foot section of the raft can 250 pounds, carrying one Medium passenger or a similar volume of cargo. The vessel functions as a normal raft.

Name: Forest Friend
MaterialComponents: A pinch of manure
Target: One willing living creature per three levels, no two of which may be more than 30 ft. apart.
Description: While subject to this spell, the targets find that forested areas become helpful instead of hindering. The targets suffer no hindrances to movement and suffer no penalties on Acrobatics and Stealth checks from undergrowth in forested terrain. Furthermore, forested overgrowth imposes a miss chance 10% lower than normal. When moving in and among trees, those subject to the spell gain a +5 circumstance bonus on Acrobatics checks and Climb checks. Rangers in their favored terrain can also add their favored terrain bonus on such Acrobatics and Climb checks.

Name: Glitterdust
MaterialComponents: Ground mica
Description: A cloud of golden particles covers everyone and everything in the area, causing creatures to become blinded and visibly outlining invisible things for the duration of the spell. All within the area are covered by the dust, which cannot be removed and continues to sparkle until it fades. Each round at the end of their turn blinded creatures may attempt new saving throws to end the blindness effect.

Name: Grapnel Arrow
Focus: The arrow or bolt to be fired
Description: This spell is cast upon an arrow or bolt, causing it to grow a tangle of rope-like vines. You must fire the arrow at any relatively solid Medium or larger object before the end of your turn, otherwise the spell ends. With a successful attack roll against an AC equal to 5 plus the hardness of the target object, the grapnel arrow strikes and embeds itself in that object with the strength of an iron grappling hook. If successfully embedded, the grapnel arrow lasts for 1 minute/level.

Name: Grasping Vines
Range: Personal and Medium (100 ft. + 10 ft./level) (see text)
