Description: Vines grow from the caster’s arm, reaching out at a target within medium range. On a successful ranged touch attack, the vines wrap around the target and allow the caster to make an Opposed Strength check with the target. Success indicates the target is dragged adjacent to the caster and cannot move further away from the caster until the beginning of the caster’s next turn. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity, but may result in falling damage if the target was airborne. Failure indicates the caster ends up prone and is drug along behind the target as they move until the caster regains their footing or the spell ends. The vines may be attacked to free the creature (AC 20, DR 5/slashing, 20 hit points). This destruction does not end the spell, but merely frees the creature, more vine growing to replace that lost.

Name: Green Blockade
Description: You raise a barrier of plant life before you. Any creature trying to pass through this blockade must succeed at a Strength check (DC 15) to do so; success ends its movement on the other side of the wall.

Name: Greensight
MaterialComponents: A leaf
Description: Upon casting this spell, the recipient is empowered to see up to 60 feet through thick plant matter as though it were transparent. Leaves, vines, and greenery—even moss, lichen, and slime—offer no concealment to the recipient’s sight, though her vision still can be blocked by solid wood, as if from trees or wooden structures. Undergrowth does not grant concealment to a creature against a recipient of the effects of greensight.

Name: Groundswell
Description: This spell allows the target to cause the ground to rise up beneath him. As a swift action, the target can cause the ground to rise 5 feet, while all adjacent squares are treated as steep slopes. The groundswell precludes flanking from creatures standing at lower elevations than the target. If the target moves after creating a groundswell, the ground returns to its normal elevation at the end of his turn; otherwise, it remains in place until the target moves or uses a swift action to return the ground to normal. A groundswell cannot increase elevation of the ground beyond 5 feet.

Name: Hail of Stone
MaterialComponents: A chip of jade worth 5 gp
Description: You hold the jade chip before you and blow on it as you end the spell. The chip flares with a green light and vanishes as rocks begin to fall on your pursuers.

Name: Hold Animal
Description: The subject becomes paralyzed and freezes in place. It is aware and breathes normally but cannot take any actions, even speech. Each round on its turn, the subject may attempt a new saving throw to end the effect. This is a full-round action that does not provoke attacks of opportunity. A winged creature who is paralyzed cannot flap its wings and falls. A swimmer can’t swim and may drown.

Name: Hunter's Lore
Description: While subject to this spell, you take upon yourself the mantle of the hunter, channeling the insights of the spirits of the wild. You gain a +4 insight bonus on all Survival checks for the duration of the spell, and you do not take a penalty to move up to your normal speed while tracking (you still take the normal -20 penalty if you want to move twice your normal move speed per round while tracking).

Name: Incendiary Slime
MaterialComponents: A drop of oil
Description: A slick, greasy liquid seeps from the targeted object, thoroughly coating it.

Name: Instant Rampart
MaterialComponents: A handful of earth or stone
Description: You create a low wall or other simple structure of packed earth or loose stone measuring 3 feet thick, 3 feet tall, and 10 feet long per 3 caster levels you possess (minimum 10 feet). Each square of the structure can appear only in unoccupied spaces atop earthen or stone surfaces able to support it. The wall grants cover as per a low wall and can be climbed with a successful DC 5 Climb check.

Name: Lay of the Land
MaterialComponents: A piece of soil from the land to be memorized
Description: In a flash of recognition, you learn about the geography of your surroundings within a radius of 1 mile per 2 caster levels (minimum 1 mile). This instant familiarity grants you an insight bonus equal to your caster level (maximum +5) on Knowledge (geography) checks and Survival checks to avoid getting lost so long as you remain in the affected area.

Name: Lead Plating
Description: You enclose the target in a thin sheath of lead. This doesn’t alter the target’s functionality, but prevents the penetration of many divination spells and may help protect it against other effects (such as radiation).

Name: Local Tremor
Duration: 1 minute/level or until expended; see text
Description: The earth around your feet begins to ripple, and a directed shock wave of tectonic force is released that shoots through the ground.

Name: Lockjaw
MaterialComponents: Sticky tree gum
Description: You give a creature the ability to use one of its natural attacks to firmly attach itself to an opponent. Choose one of the creature’s natural attacks (usually a claw or bite attack). The creature gains the grab ability with that natural attack, including the +4 bonus on combat maneuver checks to start or maintain a grapple. A creature with multiple natural attacks can strike at its grappled opponent with its other natural attacks, but cannot attack any other creature.

Name: Magic Boulder
Target: S: Up to three boulders touched
Description: You transmute as many as three boulders (roucks up to two size categories smaller than yourself) to use with the rock throwing ability or as siege engine ammunition. The boulder’s damage increases by one step, and the boulder gains a +1 enhancement bonus on attack and damage rolls. The magic is discharged from a boulder after it is used.

Name: Mud Buddy
MaterialComponents: 1 pint of water
Target: 5 cubic feet of earth or mud
Description: You create a Small minion out of mud, and it obeys your commands.

Name: Nature's Favor
Description: By calling on the power of nature, you grant the subject animal a +1 luck bonus on attack and damage rolls for every three caster levels you possess, to a maximum bonus of +5 at 15th level.

Name: Natural Insight
MaterialComponents: A few hairs from a fox, an owl feather, and an eagle feather
Description: You imbue the subject with the insights of the natural world. The subject gains a +2 enhancement bonus to Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma.

Name: One with the Land
Description: You cast the spell and are briefly bathed in a natural green light. As it fades, you feel in touch with your natural surroundings.

Name: Reduce Animal
Target: One willing animal of small, medium, large or huge size
Description: This spell causes instant diminution of an animal creature, halving its height, length, and width and dividing its weight by 8. This decrease changes the creature’s size category to the next smaller one. The target gains a +2 size bonus to Dexterity, a -2 size penalty to Strength (to a minimum of 1), and a +1 bonus on attack rolls and AC due to its reduced size.

Name: Remove Addiction
Description: Remove addiction can cure all addictions from which the subject is suffering. You must make a caster level check (1d20 + caster level) against the DC of each addictions affecting the target. Success means that the addictions is cured.

Name: Scale Spikes
MaterialComponents: A small thorn
Target: S: One living creature/level that is a reptile, has the dragon type, or has the reptilian subtype, and that also has a natural armor bonus of at least +1, all of which must be within 30 ft.
Description: When a target is affected by this spell, its scales grow jagged spikes.

Name: Scamper
Description: Your animal companion moves with astonishing agility and speed until the end of its turn.

Name: Scent
MaterialComponents: A sprinkle of mustard and pepper, and a drop of sweat.
Description: You give the target an enhanced sense of smell, equivalent to the scent ability of some monsters. This enhanced sense of smell lets a creature detect approaching enemies, sniff out hidden foes, and track by sense of smell, just as if using the scent ability.

Name: Scent Trail
Target: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: You, or a willing creature you touch, lay down a trail of scents that only the creatures you designate at the time of can detect. These creatures find it very easy to follow this trail.

Name: Scimitar of Sand
MaterialComponents: A pinch of sand, salt, and iron filings
Description: A curved, 3-foot-long blade of sand springs forth from your hand, screaming and churning like a caged sandstorm.

Name: Sickening Entanglement
Focus: A bit of tangled hemp rope
SavingThrow: Reflex partial and Fort negates (see text);
Description: This spell causes tall grass, weeds, and other plants to wrap around creatures in the area of effect or those that enter the area. Creatures that fail their save gain the entangled condition. Creatures that make their save can move as normal, but those that remain in the area must save again at the end of your turn. Creatures that move into the area must save immediately. Those that fail must end their movement and gain the entangled condition. Entangled creatures can attempt to break free as a move action, making a Strength or Escape Artist check. The DC for this check is equal to the DC of the spell. The entire area of effect is considered difficult terrain while the effect lasts.

Name: Silk to Steel
Description: You imbue an ordinary scarf (or similar piece of clothing) with the strength of steel without altering its weight or flexibility. Each round on your turn, you can decide to hold the scarf like a shield and use it to defend yourself (gaining a +2 shield bonus to your Armor Class) or to hold it like a lash and make attack as if the scarf were a whip. Only you may use the scarf in this way. If the scarf is ever out of your possession for more than a turn the spell ends and the scarf reverts to normal.

Name: Soften Earth and Stone
Description: When this spell is cast, all natural, undressed earth or stone in the spell’s area is softened. Wet earth becomes thick mud, dry earth becomes loose sand or dirt, and stone becomes soft clay that is easily molded or chopped. You affect a 10-foot square area to a depth of 1 to 4 feet, depending on the toughness or resilience of the ground at that spot. Magical, enchanted, dressed, or worked stone cannot be affected. Earth or stone creatures are not affected.

Name: Spore Spray
Description: The caster summons a mass of spores that fill the area around him. The spores deal 1d8 points of piercing damage to all creatures within 5 feet other than the caster as the cloud burrows into their flesh. If the creatures then fail a Fortitude save, the spores gain root and begin to grow, dealing an additional 1d2 points of piercing damage to them each round for 10 rounds. At the end of this time, a tangle of viny growths covers each subject. A Delay Disease spell can stopthe spores’ growth for its duration, and a Remove Disease can kill the spores.

Name: Spider Climb
MaterialComponents: A spider leg
Description: The subject can climb and travel on vertical surfaces or even traverse ceilings as well as a spider does. The affected creature must have its hands free to climb in this manner. The subject gains a climb speed of 20 feet and a +8 racial bonus on Climb skill checks; furthermore, it need not make Climb checks to traverse a vertical or horizontal surface (even upside down). A spider climbing creature retains its Dexterity bonus to Armor Class (if any) while climbing, and opponents get no special bonus to their attacks against it. It cannot, however, use the run action while climbing.

Name: Splinterbolt
MaterialComponents: A splinter of wood
Description: You extend your hand toward your foe, flicking a single sliver of wood into the air, and a splinter larger than a titan’s javelin whistles through the air.

Name: Squeeze
Description: The target becomes flexible regardless of its actual size and mass. It can move through areas at least half its size with no penalty for squeezing. It can move through a space at least one-quarter its width using the penalties for squeezing through a space at least half its width.

Name: Stalactite
MaterialComponents: A chip of moss agate worth 5 gp
Description: You create stalactites on a ceiling, doorway, or similar overhang. The stalactites fall when a creature walks beneath them, dealing 4d6 points of piercing damage. Anyone directly under the area takes this damage, or half on a successful Reflex save. Others within 5 feet of the stalactites take half damage, or none if they succeed on a Reflex saving throw.

Name: Steal Size
MaterialComponents: A tiny piece of iron shaped like a scale tray
Description: This spell reduces the target’s size by one size category, as if it were affected by Reduce Person. You grow in size by one category, as if affected by Enlarge Person (if you can be targeted by that spell). If the spell is dispelled or otherwise ends for either you or the target, both you and the target return to your normal sizes.

Name: Sticky Saddle
Description: A green glow surrounds you and your mount for an instant. When the glow fades, you feel more attentive to the movements of your mount even while an unseen force holds you fast to it.

Name: Stone Call
Description: A rain of dirt, gravel, and small pebbles fills the area, dealing 2d6 points of bludgeoning damage to every creature in the area. This damage only occurs once, when the spell is cast.

Name: Warp Wood
Target: 1 Small wooden object/level, all within a 20-ft. radius
Description: You cause wood to bend and warp, permanently destroying its straightness, form, and strength. A warped door springs open (or becomes stuck, requiring a Strength check to open, at your option). A boat or ship springs a leak. Warped ranged weapons are useless. A warped melee weapon causes a -4 penalty on attack rolls.

Name: Web
MaterialComponents: Spider web
Description: Web creates a many-layered mass of strong, sticky strands. These strands trap those caught in them. The strands are similar to spiderwebs but far larger and tougher. These masses must be anchored to two or more solid and diametrically opposed points or else the web collapses upon itself and disappears. Creatures caught within a web become grappled by the sticky fibers. Attacking a creature in a web doesn’t cause you to become grappled.

Name: Web Shelter
Focus: A miniature ball of spider webs in resin
Description: You create a shelter of slightly sticky webbing. The shelter has a hinged door large enough to accommodate a Medium creature. The opaque walls of the shelter measure 1 inch thick and provide total cover to anyone within it.

Name: Wilderness Soldiers
Description:
You call on the plants nearby to aid you in combat. This spell is ineffective if no plants you can direct are within the area. You can spend a swift action and/or a standard action on each of your turns to direct one of the following attacks. The attack bonus or CMB for these attacks equals your base attack bonus + your Wisdom modifier. You grant a +1 bonus per three caster levels (maximum +5) on damage rolls due to this spell. Your wilderness soldiers never provoke attacks of opportunity, and they do not count as allies for flanking or other purposes.


	
	Tree: A tree makes a melee attack with a 10-foot reach from its trunk. A hit deals an amount of damage equal to 1d8 points + your Wisdom modifier. The tree can instead attempt a bull rush, drag, or reposition combat maneuver with the same reach, but the tree cannot move itself.
	


	
	Undergrowth or Hedgerow: Acting as a Medium creature, one square of undergrowth or hedgerow attempts a grapple combat maneuver against an opponent within or adjacent to that square. Heavy undergrowth gains a +2 bonus to its CMD. Undergrowth cannot move the grapple or pin a foe, but it can deal an amount of damage equal to 1d4 points plus your Wisdom modifier by making a successful grapple check against a foe it is grappling. The undergrowth’s CMD is 5 plus its CMB. If you fail to direct the undergrowth to maintain the grapple, it releases its opponent.

Name: Wood Shape
Target: One touched piece of wood no larger than 10 cu. ft. + 1 cu. ft./level
Description: Wood shape enables you to form one existing piece of wood into any shape that suits your purpose. While it is possible to make crude coffers, doors, and so forth, fine detail isn’t possible. There is a 30% chance that any shape that includes moving parts simply doesn’t work.

Name: Woodwisp Arrow
Focus: The arrow or bolt to be fired
Description: This spell is cast upon an arrow or bolt, enabling the missile to pass through wood as though it was air, negating any cover benefit the target might enjoy because of wooden doors, tables, or stockade walls, or negating the AC modifier of wooden armor or a wooden shield. A creature made entirely of wood cannot be harmed by a woodwisp arrow. The spell doesn’t grant the spellcaster the ability to see through wooden obstructions, so unless a clairvoyance spell or similar magic is already in effect, the target may be treated as having concealment instead of total cover (GM discretion). The arrow or bolt must be fired during the same round the spell is cast, or the magic dissipates and is lost. The projectile is destroyed even if it misses its target.

Name: Zone of Natural Purity
MaterialComponents: 50 gp worth of precious and carefully prepared herbs
Description: This spell sanctifies an area to the forces of nature. Every fey and plant creature in the area gains a +1 sacred bonus on attack rolls, damage rolls, and saving throws, while aberrations in the area take a -1 penalty on attack rolls, damage rolls, and saves. Aberrations cannot be created within or summoned into the sanctified area. If the sanctified area contains an altar, shrine, or other permanent fixture dedicated to your deity, pantheon, or aligned higher power, the modifiers given above are doubled

Name: Billim's Bort Bridge
MaterialComponents: A rectangular piece of bort
Description: This spell causes an anchored bridge of solid crystal to form, stretching from two areas indicated during the casting (both of which must be in range of the spell) to join in the center. The bridge cannot form in an area occupied by physical objects or creatures. Its surface must be smooth and unbroken when created. It can join two areas of differing heights, as long as the bridge does not climb or descend at an angle of more than 45 degrees (in other words, the vertical distance cannot exceed the horizontal distance between its anchor points).

Name: Burrow
Description: The subject can burrow at a speed of 15 feet (or 10 feet if it wears medium or heavy armor, or if it carries a medium or heavy load) through sand, loose soil, or gravel, or at a speed of 5 feet through packed earth (but never through wood, stone, or other harder substances). Using burrow requires only as much concentration as walking, so the subject can attack or cast spells normally. The burrowing creature cannot charge or run. Loose material collapses behind the target 1 round after it leaves the area. This spell does not give the target the ability to breathe underground, so when passing through loose material, the creature must hold its breath and take only short trips, or else it may suffocate.

Name: Caustic Arrow
Target: Fifty projectiles, all of which must be together at the time of casting
Description: This spell allows you to turn ammunition (such as arrows, crossbow bolts, shuriken, and sling stones) into caustic projectiles. Each piece of ammunition deals an extra 1d6 points of acid damage to any target it hits.

Name: Caustic Nova
MaterialComponents: A tiny piece of lime and a drop of water
Description: A caustic nova spell generates a sizzling explosion of acid that detonates with a low roar and deals 1d6 points of acid damage per caster level (maximum 10d6) to every creature within the area. Unattended objects also take this damage. The explosion creates almost no pressure.

Name: Caustic Smoke
Description: Green-tinged smoke billows from the earth, obscuring sight and burning all it touches.

Name: Charge of the Triceratops
Description: Holding your hand to your head—index and middle fingers extended in a V—you call upon the ancient power of the triceratops. You touch your intended target, which then grows large horns, a bony skull plate, and a thickened hide.

Name: Communal Delay Poison
Description: This spell functions like Delay Poison, except you divide the duration in 10-minute intervals among the creatures touched.

Name: Communal Spider Climb
MaterialComponents: A spider leg
Description: The subjects can climb and travel on vertical surfaces or even traverse ceilings as well as a spider does. The affected creatures must have its hands free to climb in this manner. The subject gains a climb speed of 20 feet and a +8 racial bonus on Climb skill checks; furthermore, it need not make Climb checks to traverse a vertical or horizontal surface (even upside down). A spider climbing creature retain its Dexterity bonus to Armor Class (if any) while climbing, and opponents get no special bonus to their attacks against it. It cannot, however, use the run action while climbing.

Name: Daggermark's Exchange
MaterialComponents: A small bit of powered yew bark
Description: You swallow a dose of non-magical poison with no effect and regurgitate a dose of a different poison (your choice) into the old container (or another you have on hand). Attempt a Craft (poison) check, or a Craft (alchemy) check at a -5 penalty, against the new poison’s creation DC. If you succeed, you create a dose of your chosen poison. If you fail, you expose yourself to the original poison (although you remain immune to that poison if you have venom immunity or a similar class feature or ability). The new poison’s price must be the same as or less than the original poison’s price. The new poison is considered to be a magical poison and lasts for 1 hour per level, after which point it goes inert.

Name: Diminish Plants
Focus: A miniature set of hedge trimmers worth 10 gp
Description:
This spell has two versions.


	
	Prune Growth: This version of the spell causes normal vegetation within long range (400 feet + 40 feet per level) to shrink to about one-third normal size, becoming untangled and less bushy. The affected vegetation appears to have been carefully pruned and trimmed. This version of diminish plants attempts to dispel any spells or effects that enhance plants in the area, such as entangle, or wall of thorns, or even instantaneous effects such as plant growth. A plant growth or similar cast into the area must first attempt to dispel this spell to have any effect. These effects are dispelled only for the areas where the spells overlap, unlike normal dispel effects.

Name: Enhance Familiar
Description: After you touch the target familiar, the creature perks up and appears more alert.

Name: Fabricate
MaterialComponents: The original material, which costs the same amount as the final market value of the item to be created
Target: One object of up to 10 cu. ft./level; see text
Description: You convert raw material of one sort into a worked object that is of the same material, though your require far more of the material than would normally be required to make the object. Creatures or magic items cannot be created or transmuted by the fabricate spell. You must make an appropriate Craft check to fabricate articles requiring any degree of craftsmanship. Objects that require multiple materials to be made cannot be made by the fabricate spell, though the component pieces may be made. Because of the increased cost of fabricating an object over simply making it by hand, fabricate is usually only used when speed is of the essence or price isn’t an object (for instance,

Name: Forest Eyes
Target: Two trees of the same type, one of which must be in physical contact with you
Description: The moment your hand contacts the rough wood, your vision swims, blurs, and resolves into a different image.

Name: Forest Voice
Target: Two trees of the same kind, one of which must be in physical contact with you
Description: You touch the leaves and speak, and your comrade answers you through the plant.

Name: Giant's Wrath
Description: With your best giant’s shout you rattle some pebbles in your closed hand, completing the spell that will allow them to become boulders.

Name: Grasping Wall
Description: Hundreds of disembodied plant-like hands burst from the wall, forming a sea of clutching, probing appendages.

Name: Heart of the Metal
MaterialComponents: A chunk of adamantine worth 100 gp, or one of cold iron or silver worth 20 gp
Description: You lend the nature of adamantine, cold iron, or silver depending on which component you used, to the targeted weapon, allowing it to overcome that type of damage reduction (in addition to any types it already would). No other advantages or disadvantages of these metal types apply. For example, a weapon given the nature of silver does not suffer reduced damage. This spell cannot affect nonmetal weapons.

Name: Lily Pad Stride
MaterialComponents: A frog’s leg
Description: Your every footstep creates aquatic plants capable of supporting your weight and that of any creature of your size or smaller that is following you. These lily pads only appear when you cross water or other liquids which do not immediately destroy plants. You can walk across these liquid surfaces without any fear of stumbling (though if knocked prone, dragged under, or otherwise pulled off your feet you still sink in the liquid). For the duration of the spell, any creature of your size or smaller can attempt to follow you by making a DC 10 Acrobatics check every round. Each such check allows it to move at half its normal land speed. If the creature takes a -5 penalty on its check it can move at its normal speed.

Name: Meld into Stone
Focus: A granite statue of yourself worth 25 gp
Description: Meld into stone enables you to meld your body and possessions into a single block of stone. The stone must be large enough to accommodate your body in all three dimensions. When the casting is complete, you and not more than 100 pounds of non-living gear merge with the stone. If either condition is violated, the spell fails and is wasted.

Name: Nature's Rampart
Focus: A small quartz gem engraved with the image of an exquisite tiny castle, worth at least 100 gp.
Description: With a final wave of your hand, the ground beneath your feet trembles and the landscape shifts into a new form.

Name: Plant Growth
Description:
Plant growth has different effects depending on the version chosen.


	
	Enrichment: This effect targets plants within a range of a half-mile, raising their potential productivity over the course of the next year to one-third above normal.
	


	
	Overgrowth: This effect causes normal vegetation (grasses, briars, bushes, creepers, thistles, trees, vines, and so on) within long range (400 feet + 40 feet per caster level) to become thick and overgrown. The plants entwine to form a thicket or jungle that creatures must hack or force a way through. Speed drops to 5 feet, or 10 feet for Large or larger creatures. The area must have brush and trees in it for this spell to take effect. If this spell is cast on an area that is already affected by any spell or effect that enhances plants, such as entangle or wall of thorns, any DC involved with these spells is increased by 4. This bonus is granted for 1 day after the casting of plant growth.

Name: Remove Disease
Description: Remove disease can cure all diseases from which the subject is suffering. You must make a caster level check (1d20 + caster level) against the DC of each disease affecting the target. Success means that the disease is cured. The spell also kills some hazards and parasites, including green slime and others.

Name: Sensory Amplifier
Description: You open the minds of all creatures near you and enhance their sensory receptors. All living creatures other than you in the area gain a +5 bonus on Perception checks. Sighted creatures gain low-light vision, and creatures with a sense of smell gain scent. In addition, the first time each round that a creature in the area takes damage, it takes an additional 2d6 points of damage of the same type. Despite being within the area, the caster does not take this extra damage.

Name: Serpent's Grasp
MaterialComponents: A serpent scale
Description: You gain a crushing grasp. While this spell is active, you gain the ability to constrict for 2d6 points of bludgeoning damage plus 1-1/2 times your Strength bonus (if any). You can constrict an opponent whenever you make a successful grapple check (in addition to any other effects caused by a successful check, including additional damage).

Name: Shifting Sand
MaterialComponents: A handful of sand
Description: You cause an earthen or sandy surface to shift and churn within the area. The shifting sand obliterates tracks and is considered difficult terrain. Acrobatics checks in the area take a penalty equal to your caster level (maximum +10). Creatures entering or beginning their turn in the shifting sand must make a Reflex save each round or become entangled until the beginning of their next turn. If they attempt to move while entangled, they must make a second Reflex save or fall prone. Creatures with the stability racial trait (like dwarves) may apply it as a bonus on their saving throws.

Name: Snare
MaterialComponents: A vial of prepared sap and tar worth 2 gp
Target: Touched non-magical circle of vine, rope, or thong with a 2ft. diameter + 2ft./level
Description: This spell enables you to make a snare that functions as a magic trap. The snare can be made from any supple vine, a thong, or a rope. When you cast snare upon it, the cord-like object blends with its surroundings (DC 28 Perception check to notice). One end of the snare is tied in a loop that contracts around one or more of the limbs of any creature stepping inside the circle. A successful Reflex save means a creature evades the trap, though a creature that fails to notice the trap is denied their Dexterity bonus for this save.

Name: Speak with Plants
Description: You can communicate with normal plants and plant creatures, and can ask questions of and receive answers from them. A normal plant’s sense of its surroundings is limited, so it won’t be able to give (or recognize) detailed descriptions of creatures or answer questions about events outside its immediate vicinity. The spell doesn’t make plant creatures any more friendly or cooperative than normal. Furthermore, wary and cunning plant creatures are likely to be terse and evasive, while the more stupid ones may make inane comments. If a plant creature is friendly, it may do some favor or service for you.

Name: Spike Growth
Description: Any ground-covering vegetation in the spell’s area becomes very hard and sharply pointed without changing its appearance.

Name: Spiked Pit
Description: You create a 10-foot-by-10-foot extra-dimensional hole with a depth of 10 feet per two caster levels (maximum 50 feet). You must create the pit on a horizontal surface of sufficient size. Since it extends into another dimension, the pit has no weight and does not otherwise displace the original underlying material. You can create the pit in the deck of a ship as easily as in a dungeon floor or the ground of a forest. Any creature standing in the area where you first conjured the pit must make a Reflex saving throw to avoid falling into it. In addition, the edges of the pit are sloped, and any creature ending its turn on a square adjacent to the pit must make a Reflex saving throw with a +2 bonus to avoid falling into it. Creatures subjected to an effect intended to push them into the pit (such as bull rush) do not get a saving throw to avoid falling in if they are affected by the pushing effect.

Name: Stone Shape
Target: Stone or stone object touched, up to 10 cu. ft. + 1 cu. ft./level
Description: You can form an existing piece of stone into any shape that suits your purpose. While it’s possible to make crude coffers, doors, and so forth with stone shape, fine detail isn’t possible. There is a 30% chance that any shape including moving parts simply doesn’t work.

Name: Stonelance
Focus: A carved spike of moss agate worth 50 gp
Description: You clutch the moss agate in your hand, focusing the energy of the spell into a sharp spear. With a thought, you send it whistling through the air at your foe.

Name: Stony Grasp
MaterialComponents: A miniature hand sculpted from stone
Description: By thrusting your arm downward, you complete the casting of the spell. Nearby, a roughly formed arm about the size of a human erupts from the ground and grasps at the air.

Name: Stream of Acid
MaterialComponents: Lime and a stone rod
Description: You release a powerful stream of acid that deals 1d6 points of acid damage per caster level (maximum 10d6) to each creature within its area. The stream begins at your fingertips.

Name: Sudden Aegis
Description: You instantly but briefly grant the subject damage reduction 10/adamantine. Once the spell has prevented a total of 10 points of damage per two caster levels (maximum 50 points), it is discharged.

Name: Synesthesia
Description: You overstimulate the senses of the affected creature, causing its senses to interfere with another. While a creature is under the effects of this spell, sensory input is processed by the wrong senses, such that noise triggers bursts of colors, smells create sounds, and so on. The affected creature moves at half speed, has a 20% miss chance on attacks, and takes a –4 penalty to AC and on skill checks and Reflex saves. Successful spellcasting while affected requires a concentration check with a DC equal to this spell’s save DC plus the level of spell being cast.

Name: Thorn Spears
MaterialComponents: A small thorn
Description: Upon casting this spell, one or more giant thorn spears lance up out of the ground, each oozing with acid. Each stalagmite-like thorn affects a 5-foot square and tapers to a height of 10 feet. You may cause a number of thorn spears equal to one spear for every four caster levels you possess to burst from the ground. A creature that occupies a square from which a spear extends (or that is within 10 feet of the ground below) takes 2d6 points of piercing damage and 2d6 points of acid damage per square – creatures that take up more than one square can be hit by multiple spears if the caster is high enough level. The explosive growth can also trip foes. When the spears erupt from the ground, they make a combat maneuver check against any targets that take damage from the spears, with a total bonus equal to your caster level plus your Wisdom modifier. Each additional thorn spear beyond the first that strikes a single foe grants a +10 bonus to this CMB check. If the check succeeds, the thorn spears knock the foe prone. A successful Reflex save halves the damage and prevents the trip attempt.

Name: Thorny Entanglement
Description: This spell functions as Entangle, except the plants also grow thorns and can fling them up to 15 feet. Any creature that moves within 15 feet of the spell’s area is attacked once on its turn by the animated plants. The plants use your caster level as their base attack bonus and add your Wisdom modifier to the attack roll. A volley of thorns counts as a thrown weapon and deals 2d6 points of piercing damage on a successful hit. A creature that enters the spell’s area or ends its turn there automatically takes 2d6 points of piercing damage.

Name: Tremor
Description: When you cast this spell, a small, localized tremor shakes the ground in the area. Detritus and loose debris rattle with the small quake, and creatures caught in the area stumble and fall.

Name: Tremorsense
MaterialComponents: A fleck of skin from a creature that naturally has tremorsense
Description: You cast this spell and know where each of your opponents stands. Their presence is marked in your mind like ripples radiating along the surface of a pond.

Name: Venomfire
MaterialComponents: A drop of acid
Description: You cause the subject’s venom to become caustic, dealing an additional 2d6 points of acid damage with each use. This spell has no effect on creatures that do not naturally produce poison.

Name: Vine Mine
Description: You hold the crown of ivy leaves aloft, invoking the powers of nature, and an explosion of plant growth fills the area—plants over which you have control.

Name: Vine Strike
Description: Bristles burst from your body, lodging in your opponent and blossoming into entangling vines as you pummel your target.

Name: Vinelash
Range: Personal and Medium (100 ft. + 10 ft./level) (see text)
Description: Vines grow from the caster’s arm, lashing out at a target within medium range. On a successful ranged attack roll against the target, the vines deal piercing damage equal to 1d8 plus their Strength modifier. So long as the vines deal damage, they lodge themselves in the target (Reflex Negates, DC = 10 + physical damage dealt). The caster may choose to begin moving their enchantments over to this vine before it strikes out, treating it as a ranged natural weapon. For the duration of the spell, so long as the vine is not lodged in a target, the caster may make one attack per round with the vine as a standard action.

Name: Wreath of Acid
Description: This spell surrounds you and your weapons with caustic mists. At the end of each of your turns, any enemy adjacent to you or sharing your space takes 1d6 points of acid damage. Your melee and ranged attacks deal an extra 1d6 points of acid damage.

Name: Acid Pit
MaterialComponents: Drop of acid
Description: This spell functions as create pit, except that it places a 5-foot deep pool of acid at the bottom of the pit. The pit has a maximum depth of 100 feet. Creatures who fall into the pit take falling damage as normal (the acid counts as a yielding surface), plus 2d6 points of acid damage per round spent in contact with the acid. In addition, exposed items carried by a creature in the pit may be harmed. Refer to Table: Items Affected by Magical Attacks (also copied here for convenience and in order of most likely to least likely to be affected).

Name: Arboreal Hammer
Focus: A miniature wooden hammer worth 10 gp
Description: This spell animates a tree’s branch and directs it against your foes. At caster level 10th or lower, you can target a Huge tree. At caster level 11th-15th, you can target a Gargantuan tree, and at caster level 16th or higher you can target a Colossal tree. The animated branch makes slam attacks with a Strength score equal to 10 + your caster level. The branch strikes once per round with an attack bonus equal to your caster level plus the branch’s Strength modifier, adjusted by the appropriate size modifier (+2 for Huge, +4 for Gargantuan, +8 for Colossal). A Huge tree’s slam deals 2d6 points of damage, a Gargantuan tree’s slam deals 3d6 points of damage, and a Colossal tree’s slam deals 4d6 points of damage; the tree adds 1-1/2 times its Strength modifier to this damage. A Huge tree has reach 15 feet, a Gargantuan has reach 20 feet, and a Colossal has reach 30 feet. The tree attacks the creature you designate when you cast the spell, and is unable to move. You can direct the tree against a new target as a move action. The tree does not gain a bonus for flanking, nor can it help another combatant flank. It cannot attack a foe you cannot see.

Name: Atavism
Description: By bringing forth the primeval ancestry of the target animal, you awaken a savage engine of destruction. The animal immediately gains the advanced creature simple template. It gains a +2 bonus on all rolls, including damage rolls and special ability DCs, a +4 bonus to AC and CMD, and +2 hit points per HD. The animal’s primal instincts take hold for the duration of this spell—if the animal knows tricks granted by the Handle Animal skill, it loses access to all of those tricks save for “attack.” This spell has no effect on animals that already have the advanced creature template.

Name: Battlefield Fortification
Description: You shift earth to create a shallow trench or a berm. The trench or berm created is a straight line up to 5 feet long per two caster levels. A berm created by this spell is 2 squares wide. A creature in the area can make a Reflex save to leap to either side as the earth is moving, otherwise they move down with it.

Name: Beanstalk
MaterialComponents: A small handful of beans
Description: When casting this spell, you must plant the material components in soil. When you do, at the end of casting, a large beanstalk rises up from the ground. It’s strong enough to support Huge or smaller creatures weighing no more than 2,000 pounds total, and has enough handholds and footholds that it can be climbed as if it were knotted rope (Climb DC 5). At the end of the spell’s duration, the beanstalk withers and dies at an accelerated rate, leaving nothing more than a pile of compost.

Name: Black Tentacles
MaterialComponents: Octopus or squid tentacle
Description: This spell causes a field of rubbery black tentacles to appear, burrowing up from the floor and reaching for any creature in the area.

Name: Bloodhound
MaterialComponents: A drop of blood and a pinch of cinnamon
Description: You enhance your natural sense of smell. If you naturally possess the Scent ability (such as due to your race, class, or a feat) Bloodhound further enhances your sense of smell.  You increase your bonus on appropriate Perception checks and on Survival checks made to track by +4. However, you take an additional -4 penalty on saving throws against odor-related effects such as the stench ability and stinking cloud (stacking with that normally imposed by your scent ability). You further gain the ability detect poison by scent. A typical poison is a DC 20 Perception check, but poisons designed to be difficult to detect may be much more difficult to sniff out.

Name: Calcific Touch
Target: Creature or creatures touched (up to one per level)
Description: Your touch progressively transmutes the substance of creatures you touch into stone. Once per round, you may deliver a touch attack that inflicts 1d4 points of Dexterity damage and slows the target (as the spell) for 1 round. A successful Fortitude save negates the slow effect but not the ability damage. A target reduced to 0 Dexterity is petrified permanently. Break enchantment, restoration, or stone to flesh can reverse the effects of calcific touch.

Name: Command Plants
Target: S: Up to 2 HD/level of plant creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: This spell allows you some degree of control over one or more plant creatures. Affected plant creatures can understand you, and they perceive your words and actions in the most favorable way (treat their attitude as friendly). They will not attack you while the spell lasts. You can try to give a subject orders, but you must win an opposed Charisma check to convince it to do anything it wouldn’t ordinarily do. (Retries are not allowed.) A commanded plant never obeys suicidal or obviously harmful orders, but it might be convinced that something very dangerous is worth doing.

Name: Create Holds
MaterialComponents: Handful of pebbles
Description: You create a path of handholds on earthen, plaster, stone, or wooden walls.

Name: Entangling Staff
Description: You cause your quarterstaff to extrude writhing vines that allow you to easily grab and entrap foes.

Name: Giant Vermin
Focus: Chunk of carapace from a giant vermin worth 20 GP
Target: S: 1 or more vermin, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: You turn a number of normal-sized centipedes, scorpions, or spiders into their giant counterparts. Only one type of vermin can be transmuted (so a single casting cannot affect both a centipede and a spider). The number of vermin which can be affected by this spell depends on your caster level, as noted on the table below.

Name: Gravel Vortex
MaterialComponents: Handful of pebbles
Description: You create a hail of tiny pieces of rock and dust that batter and scrape against all things in the area, dealing 5d6 points of bludgeoning damage. This damage is dealt only once, on the round the spell is cast. For the remaining duration of the spell, fine dust rains down in the area. Creatures other than stone giants inside this area take a –4 penalty on Perception skill checks, and the entire area is treated as difficult terrain. At the end of the spell’s duration, the gravel and dust disappear, leaving no trace of their presence.

Name: Greater Animal Aspect
Description:
You gain some of the beneficial qualities of an animal. Your base form is largely unchanged and your size is unaltered, but some of your body parts are altered. Armor or gear you are wearing adjusts to your new shape for the duration of the spell. When you cast greater animal aspect, choose one of the following options:


	
	Choose two options from the Basic Aspects list (see Animal Aspect). You gain both aspects for the spell’s duration.
		Choose one option from the Basic Aspects list (see Animal Aspect). You gain that aspect and the corresponding Greater Aspect for the spell’s duration.

Name: Heart of Earth
Description: You feel your flesh strengthen with the power of stone. This spell converts part of your body into elemental earth, which toughens you considerably.

Name: Hurtling Stone
Description: This spell creates a 50-pound stone that speeds away from the caster in a straight line, dealing 1d6 points of bludgeoning damage per caster level (max 10d6) to each creature in its path. In addition, any Large or smaller creatures in its path are knocked prone. A successful Reflex save halves the damage and prevents a creature from being knocked prone.

Name: Nature's Wrath
SavingThrow: Will partial or Will half; see text
Description: You call up the power of nature to smite your enemies. Creatures that are a part of the natural world are unaffected; aberrations, undead, constructs, and similar corruptions of nature are harmed by the spell.

Name: Neutralize Poison
Target: Creature or object of up to 1 cu. ft./level touched
Description: You detoxify any sort of venom in the creature or object touched. If the target is a creature, you must make a caster level check (1d20 + caster level) against the DC of each poison affecting the target. Success means that the poison is neutralized. A cured creature suffers no additional effects from the poison, and any temporary effects are ended, but the spell does not reverse instantaneous effects, such as hit point damage, temporary ability damage, or effects that don’t go away on their own.

Name: Orb of Acid
Description: An orb of acid about 3 inches across shoots from your palm at its target. You must succeed on a ranged touch attack to hit your target. On a successful hit you deal 1d6 points of acid damage per caster level (maximum 15d6).

Name: Poison Vines
Description: In an instant you cause glistening green vines to spring up at your command.

Name: Rain of Spines
MaterialComponents: A spine of high quality steel worth 5 gp
Description: With a shout, you call down a rain of spines upon your foes, piercing their flesh and pinning them to the floor.

Name: Rapid Burrowing
Description: This spell grants your natural burrow speed a 30 foot insight bonus. This movement bonus also applies to your natural earth glide speed if you have one. This has no effect on other modes of movement or on burrow or earth glide speeds originating from a magical item or spell.

Name: See Through Stone
Description: You gain the ability to see through solid rock as if it were transparent glass. You may see through 1 foot of stone per caster level. You see within the stone as if you were looking at the area in normal light, even if there is no illumination, though low-light vision and darkvision have no effect on your ability to see through stone. Metal at least 1 inch thick or wood or dirt at least 3 feet thick blocks your vision.

Name: Shelter
MaterialComponents: A chip of stone, sand, a drop of water, and a wood splinter
Description: You conjure a sturdy cottage or lodge made of material that is common in the area where the spell is cast. The floor is level, clean, and dry. The lodging resembles a normal cottage, with a sturdy door, two shuttered windows, and a small fireplace.

Name: Sheltered Grove
Focus: A leaf or blade of grass and a drop of water
Description: You conjure a sheltered grove of trees. The grove appears from nowhere even in the most barren, rocky soil regardless of season, but the spell must be cast outside on open ground.

Name: Slipsand
MaterialComponents: A drop of oil and a tiny glass bead
Description: This spell turns an area of natural sand into a pit of deadly slipsand. Supernatural sandlike materials, such as black sand or slumber sand, are not affected by the spell.

Name: Spike Stones
Focus: Specially carved stone caltrop worth 20 gp
Description: Rocky ground, stone floors, and similar surfaces shape themselves into long, sharp points that blend into the background.

Name: Stone Shatter
SavingThrow: None or Fortitude half; see text
Description: You make a piece of stone shift and rip itself apart. The stone twists and cracks appear in its form.

Name: Stoneskin
MaterialComponents: Granite and adamantine dust worth 250 gp
Description: The warded creature gains resistance to blows, cuts, stabs, and slashes. The subject gains DR 10/adamantine. It ignores the first 10 points of damage each time it takes damage from a weapon, though an adamantine weapon bypasses the reduction. Once the spell has prevented a total of 10 points of damage per caster level (maximum 150 points), it is discharged.

Name: Storm of Needles
MaterialComponents: A 1-inch long metal needle
Description: You flick a needle out in front of you. Instantly, the area is filled with a burst of thousands of tiny needles, which vanish almost as swiftly as they appear.

Name: Strength of Stone
Description: Your flesh turns an ivory-gray hue as you draw power up through the earth itself.

Name: Sudden Stalagmite
Description: You point your finger upward and utter a curt shout. Immediately, a razor-sharp stalagmite bursts from the ground to impale your foe.

Name: Sword to Snake
Description: When you make an undulating gesture using your hand, the target item changes slightly in shape and appearance to resemble a cross between its original form and that of a venomous animal.

Name: Thorn Body
Focus: Thorn from a plant, specially preserved, worth 20 gp
Description: This spell causes spines to grow from your exposed skin, damaging creatures that strike you. Any creature striking you with a melee weapon, an unarmed strike, or a natural weapon takes 1d6 points of piercing damage +1 point per caster level (maximum +15). Creatures using melee weapons with reach are unaffected by this spell. Creatures that successfully grapple you take 2d6 points of piercing damage +1 point per caster level (maximum +15). In addition, your natural attacks and unarmed strikes deal an additional 1d6 points of piercing damage.

Name: Thorn Spray
Target: Up to one creature/level, no two of which are more than 30 ft. apart
Description: You hurl a spray of thorns that deals damage to the targets you select within range. You make a normal ranged attack against each target separately, taking no penalty for lack of proficiency or distance. The thorns deal a total of 1d6 points of piercing damage per caster level (maximum 20d6), but you can divide this damage among the targets you select. You must choose how to divide the damage before making your attack rolls.

Name: Treasure Scent
Description: A multihued glow of metallic colors surrounds you. The swirling glow manifests as a thin mist that forces itself up into your nose. Suppressing a sneeze, you note with excitement the unmistakable scent of treasure.

Name: Tree Shape
Description: This spell allows you to assume the form of a Large living tree or shrub or a Large dead tree trunk with a small number of limbs. The exact type of tree, as well as its appearance, is completely under your control. Even the closest inspection cannot reveal that the tree in question is actually a magically concealed creature. To all normal tests you are, in fact, a tree or shrub, although a detect magic spell reveals a faint transmutation on the tree. While in tree form, you can observe all that transpires around you just as if you were in your normal form, and your hit points and save bonuses remain unaffected. You gain a +10 natural armor bonus to AC and a hardness of 5 (unless your natural hardness is higher), but have an effective Dexterity score of 0 and a speed of 0 feet. You are immune to critical hits while in tree form. All clothing and gear carried or worn changes with you. You can dismiss tree shape as a move action (instead of as a standard action).

Name: Wall of Sand
MaterialComponents: A handful of sand
Description: With a rush of stale air, a swirling wall of blowing sand leaps into being.

Name: Web Cloud
Description: You create a cloud of flame-resistant strands of adhesive webbing that billows and flows much like a cloudkill spell. The cloud moves away from you at a rate of 10 feet per round, rolling along the surface of the ground.

Name: Youthful Appearance
Description: You make your target look like a younger version of itself. You select how much younger it looks (for example, “10 years” or “as a young adult”). You can only reduce a creature’s apparent age category by 1 per 6 caster levels. You cannot otherwise change details of the target’s appearance other than those directly associated with aging (for example, gray hair returns to its original color). The target cannot appear so much younger that it changes size. This spell does not affect any age-based modifications to ability scores or other age-related effects.

Name: Acidic Spray
MaterialComponents: A vial of acid worth 10 gp
Description: A spray of acid erupts from your outstretched hand, dealing 1d6 points of acid damage per caster level (maximum 15d6) to each creature within its area (Reflex half). This acid continues to burn for 1 round, dealing 1d6 points of acid damage per two caster levels (maximum 7d6) to any creature that took damage from the spell (a second Reflex save on the creature’s turn negates this additional damage).

Name: Animal Growth
Description: The target animal grows to twice its normal size and eight times its normal weight. This alteration changes the animal’s size category to the next largest, grants it a +8 size bonus to Strength and a +4 size bonus to Constitution (and thus an extra 2 hit points per HD), and imposes a -2 size penalty to Dexterity. The creature’s existing natural armor bonus improves by 2. The size change also affects the animal’s modifier to AC, attack rolls, and its base damage. The animal’s space and reach change as appropriate to the new size, but its speed does not change. If insufficient room is available for the desired growth, the creature attains the maximum possible size and may make a Strength check (using its increased Strength) to burst any enclosures in the process. If it fails, it is constrained without harm by the materials enclosing it–the spell cannot be used to crush a creature by increasing its size.

Name: Blood Creepers
Description: You embed a seed into your opponent’s flesh. Thorny vines burst from the creature’s body, punching through bone, flesh, and skin to enwrap its arms and legs and tether it to the ground.

Name: Communal Stoneskin
MaterialComponents: Granite and adamantine dust worth 250 gp per creature affected
Description: This spell functions like Stoneskin, except you divide the duration in 10 minute intervals among the creatures touched. Once the spell has prevented 10 points of damage per caster level (maximum 150 points) for a subject, the spell’s effects end for that subject.

Name: Commune with Nature
Description: You become one with nature, attaining knowledge of the surrounding territory. You instantly gain knowledge of as many as three facts from among the following subjects: the ground or terrain, plants, minerals, bodies of water, people, general animal population, presence of woodland creatures, presence of powerful unnatural creatures, or even the general state of the natural setting.

Name: Druid Grove
MaterialComponents: 50 gp worth of emeralds per spell level stored
Description: By casting druid grove, you reshape a living tree so that it can contain a spell, causing the tree to appear a bit more vibrant and magical in the process. Thereafter, you can access this stored spell at any time, as if the tree were a very large, immobile magic item. In conjunction with druid grove, you can cast Green spells totaling no more than one-third of your caster level (rounded down, maximum 6th). Spells cast with any color other than Green can not be stored with Druid Grove. Instead of taking effect, these companion spells are stored in trees within the area. Each tree can hold only one spell.

Name: Earth Hammer
Description: You infuse the touched melee weapon with the power of the earth. The base damage of weapon improves by one step (as if the weapon were one size category larger). Regardless of the weapon’s normal material and damage type, the weapon deals bludgeoning damage and overcomes damage reduction as if it were made of adamantine. If this spell is cast on a weapon made of a different special material (such as alchemical silver), the properties of that material are replaced with those of adamantine for the duration of the spell.

Name: Greater Grease
MaterialComponents: Butter
Target: One object/2 levels or 1 10-ft. square/2 levels; see text
Description: A grease spell covers a solid surface with a layer of slippery grease. Any creature in the area when the spell is cast must make a successful Reflex save or fall. A creature can walk within or through the area of grease at half normal speed with a DC 10 Acrobatics check. Failure means it can’t move that round (and must then make a Reflex save or fall), while failure by 5 or more means it falls (see the Acrobatics skill for details). Creatures that do not move on their turn do not need to make this check and are not considered flat-footed. All 10-ft. squares must form a continuous area, each part of which must be within the spell’s range.

Name: Greater Vinelash
Range: Personal and Long (400 ft + 40 ft./level) (see text)
Description: This spell functions as Vinelash, except the damage done by the vines is 2d6 plus Strength damage. The heal check to remove the vines without taking damage is a 25, and the vines created by this spell have 50 hit points.

Name: Gutsnake
Description: You concentrate on the tooth, speak the words, and a massive tentacle erupts from your stomach. The tentacle has no eyes, but it ends in a set of snapping reptilian jaws.

Name: Hungry Earth
Description: The ground attempts to pull creatures beneath its surface. Immediately, and at the beginning of each of your turns, every creature touching the ground within the area of the spell is the target of a grapple combat maneuver. Creatures that enter the area of effect are also automatically attacked. The ground does not provoke attacks of opportunity. The earth’s CMB is equal to 5 + your caster level for the purpose of this combat maneuver check.

Name: Hungry Pit
SavingThrow: Reflex negates; Reflex half; see text
Description: This spell functions as Create Pit, except that the pit has the ability to squeeze and crush any creature trapped within it and has a maximum depth of 100 feet. Creatures who fall into the hole take falling damage as normal. In addition, anyone within the pit, not just those on the bottom, takes 4d6 points of bludgeoning damage each round as the pit contracts and then returns to its normal size (a successful Reflex save halves this damage). The ever-shifting walls of the pit are quite difficult to scale and have a Climb DC of 35.

Name: Lingering Acids
Duration: Until the end of your next turn; see text
Description: When you cast this spell, acid surges around your weapons, ready to strike out.

Name: Passwall
MaterialComponents: Sesame seeds
Description: You create a passage through wooden, plaster, or stone walls, but not through metal or other harder materials. The passage is 10 feet deep plus an additional 5 feet deep per three caster levels above 9th (15 feet at 12th, 20 feet at 15th, and a maximum of 25 feet deep at 18th level). If the wall’s thickness is more than the depth of the passage created, then a single passwall simply makes a niche or short tunnel. Several passwall spells can then form a continuing passage to breach very thick walls. When passwall ends, creatures within the passage are ejected out the nearest exit. If someone dispels the passwall or you dismiss it, creatures in the passage are ejected out the far exit, if there is one, or out the sole exit if there is only one.

Name: Quill Blast
MaterialComponents: A  porcupine quill
Description: Needle-sharp quills emerge from your skin as you begin casting this spell, then fly outward in every direction when you complete the spell.

Name: Razor Field
MaterialComponents: A tiny obsidian shard
Description: You create a floating field of swirling stone shards.

Name: Siege Scatter
Description: A roiling blast of rough rock and dirt scatters along the ground in the area, dealing 1d6 points of bludgeoning damage per 2 caster levels (maximum 5d6) to all creatures and unattended objects on the ground in the area, even on a successful saving throw. Creatures in the area that fail the Reflex save fall prone and are knocked to the nearest edge of the area, taking 1d6 points of bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet they travel this way. Creatures that did not move during the past round and those with the stability racial trait gain a +4 bonus on this saving throw.

Name: Snake Staff
MaterialComponents: A knife suitable for whittling
Target: S: 1 or more pieces of wood, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: With a long hissing whisper, you transform ordinary pieces of wood into various sorts of snakes that immediately attack your foes.

Name: Thorn Prison
Description: You trap the target in solid mass of acidic thorns 1 inch thick per caster level. If the creature fails its save, it is helpless, but can still breathe (the thorns block line of effect to the target). If the target makes its save, it gains the entangled condition but can otherwise act normally. Whether or not the target saves, it takes 1 point of acid damage per caster level each round it is helpless or entangled in the thorns. The thorns have hardness 0 and 3 hit points per inch of thickness; if broken, the creature is freed. A creature can break the mass of thorns as a full-round action with a successful Strength check (DC 15 + your caster level).

Name: Transmute Mud to Rock
Description: This spell permanently transforms normal mud or quicksand of any depth into soft stone (sandstone or a similar mineral).

Name: Transmute Rock to Mud
Description: This spell turns natural, uncut, or unworked rock of any sort into an equal volume of mud. Magical stone is not affected by the spell. The depth of the mud created cannot exceed 10 feet. A creature unable to levitate, fly, or otherwise free itself from the mud sinks until hip- or chest-deep, reducing its speed to 5 feet and causing a -2 penalty on attack rolls and AC. Brush or similar material thrown atop the mud can support creatures able to climb on top of it. Creatures large enough to walk on the bottom can wade through the area at a speed of 5 feet.

Name: Transmute Sand to Glass
MaterialComponents: A mixture of crushed glass and sand
Description: This spell transforms a mass of normal sand of any depth into solid glass permanently. Any creature in the sand is allowed a Reflex save to escape before the area is hardened to glass. Creatures unable to escape the area become trapped and must be broken out. A creature so caught can break free by making a Strength check to break the glass or by dealing damage to the glass.

Name: Transmute Sand to Stone
MaterialComponents: Sand, dirt, and water
Description: This spell permanently transforms normal sand of any depth into soft stone (sandstone or a similar mineral).

Name: Transmute Stone to Sand
MaterialComponents: Sandstone and granite
Description: This spell turns natural, uncut, or unworked stone of any sort into an equal volume of sand. If the spell is cast upon a boulder, for example, the boulder collapses into a heap of sand. Magical stone is not affected by this spell.

Name: Tree Stride
Focus: Miniature carved representation of an oak tree worth 50 gp
Duration: 1 hour/level or until expended; see text
Description:
When you cast this spell, you gain the ability to step into a tree, magically infusing yourself with the plant. Once within a tree, you can teleport from that particular tree to another tree. The trees you enter must be of the same kind, must be living, and must have girth at least equal to yours. By moving into an oak tree (for example), you instantly know the location of all other oak trees within transport range (see below) and may choose whether you want to pass into one or simply step back out of the tree you moved into.


	
		
			Type of Tree
			Transport Range
		
		
			Oak, ash, yew
			3,000 feet
		
		
			Elm, linden
			2,000 feet
		
		
			Other deciduous
			1,500 feet
		
		
			Any coniferous
			1,000 feet

Name: Unbreakable Construct
MaterialComponents: Powdered adamantine worth 100 gp
Description: This spell increases the target’s DR/adamantine by 5 or its hardness by 5. If the target does not have DR/adamantine or hardness, this spell has no effect.

Name: Wall of Stone
MaterialComponents: A small block of granite plus gold dust worth 25 gp
Description: This spell creates a wall of rock that merges into adjoining rock surfaces. A wall of stone is 1 inch thick per four caster levels and composed of up to one 5-foot square per level. You can double the wall’s area by halving its thickness. The wall cannot be conjured so that it occupies the same space as a creature or another object.

Name: Wall of Thorns
Description: A wall of thorns spell creates a barrier of very tough, pliable, tangled brush bearing needle-sharp thorns as long as a human’s finger. Any creature forced into or attempting to move through a wall of thorns takes piercing damage per round of movement equal to 25 minus the creature’s AC. Dexterity and dodge bonuses to AC do not count for this calculation. (Creatures with an AC of 25 or higher, without considering Dexterity and dodge bonuses, take no damage from contact with the wall.)

Name: Writhing Veil
Description: A shroud of writhing vines, roots, and various other bits of plants surround your form.

Name: Acid Fog
MaterialComponents: Powdered peas and an animal hoof
Description: Acid fog creates a billowing mass of misty vapors like the solid fog spell. Creatures moving through a acid fog move at half their normal speed and take a -2 penalty on all melee attack and melee damage rolls. The vapors prevent effective ranged weapon attacks (except for magic rays and the like). A creature or object that falls into acid fog is slowed so that each 10 feet of vapor that it passes through reduces the falling damage by 1d6. A creature cannot take a 5-foot-step while in acid fog. Acid fog, and effects that work like acid fog, do not stack with each other in terms of slowed movement and attack penalties.

Name: Adamant Might
Description: Your next melee attack (if made before the end of the next round) is empowered with the strength of earth, jagged adamantine and swirling stone surging across your weapon. If the attack is successful, it deals an additional 1d4 points of damage per 2 caster levels (maximum 10d4 at 20th level) and you draw the earthen material into yourself, granting you DR 20/Adamantine until the beginning of your next turn.

Name: Caustic Strike
Description: You create a blast of sizzling acid, which rushes out from your hand in a line. The line deals 1d6 points of acid damage per caster level (maximum 15d6).

Name: Chasing Perfection
MaterialComponents: A carved lotus worth 50 gp
Description: Energy courses through the creature touched. Its muscles grow and become more defined, it starts to move with greater alacrity and grace, and its bearing increases.

Name: Ironwood
Description: Ironwood is a magical substance created by druids from normal wood. While remaining natural wood in almost every way, ironwood is as strong, heavy, and resistant to fire as steel. Spells that affect metal or iron do not function on ironwood. Spells that affect wood do affect ironwood, although ironwood does not burn. Using this spell with wood shape or a wood-related Craft check, you can fashion wooden items that function as steel items. Thus, wooden plate armor and wooden swords can be created that are as durable as their normal steel counterparts. These items are freely usable by druids.

Name: Liveoak
Description: This spell turns an oak tree into a protector or guardian. The spell can only be cast on a single tree at a time; while liveoak is in effect, you can’t cast it again on another tree. Liveoak must be cast on a healthy, Huge oak. A triggering phrase of up to one word per caster level is placed on the targeted oak. The liveoak spell triggers the tree into animating as a Treant (Treant).

Name: Mass Animalistic Power
MaterialComponents: A few hairs each from a bull, bear, and cat
Target: S: One creature/level, no two of which are more than 30 ft. apart
Description: This spell functions like Animalistic Power, except that it affects multiple creature.

Name: Mass Binding Earth
Target: S: One creature or object/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: This spell functions like Binding Earth, except that it affects multiple creatures.

Name: Mass Natural Insight
MaterialComponents: A few hairs from a fox, an owl feather, and an eagle feather
Target: S: One creature/level, no two of which are more than 30 ft. apart
Description: This spell functions like Natural Insight, except that it affects multiple creatures.

Name: Move Earth
MaterialComponents: Clay, loam, sand, and an iron blade, plus gold dust worth 25 gold pieces
Description: Move earth moves dirt (clay, loam, sand, and soil), possibly collapsing embankments, moving hillocks, shifting dunes, and so forth.

Name: Repel Wood
Description: Waves of energy roll forth from you, moving in the direction that you determine, causing all wooden objects in the path of the spell to be pushed away from you to the limit of the range. Wooden objects larger than 3 inches in diameter that are fixed firmly are not affected, but loose objects are. Objects 3 inches in diameter or smaller that are fixed in place splinter and break, and the pieces move with the wave of energy. Objects affected by the spell are repelled at the rate of 40 feet per round.

Name: Sarcophagus of Stone
Description: The ground quakes as native stone erupts from the ground. This sharply rising stone takes the form of a sarcophagus.

Name: Steal Monstrous Size
MaterialComponents: A tiny piece of iron shaped like a scale tray
Target: One creature of Diminutive Size or larger
Description: This spell reduces the target’s size by one size category, as if it were affected by Reduce Monster. You grow in size by one category, as if affected by Giant Growth (if you can be targeted by that spell). If the spell is dispelled or otherwise ends for either you or the target, both you and the target return to your normal sizes.

Name: Stone Tell
Description: You gain the ability to speak with stones, which relate to you who or what has touched them as well as revealing what is covered or concealed behind or under them. The stones relate complete descriptions if asked. A stone’s perspective, perception, and knowledge may prevent the stone from providing the details you are looking for. You can speak with natural or worked stone.

Name: Stone to Flesh
MaterialComponents: A drop of blood mixed with earth
Target: One petrified creature or a cylinder of stone from 1 ft. to 3 ft. in diameter and up to 10 ft. long
Description: This spell restores a petrified creature to its normal state, restoring life and goods. The creature must make a DC 15 Fortitude save to survive the process. Any petrified creature, regardless of size, can be restored. The spell also can convert a mass of stone into a fleshy substance. Such flesh is inert and lacking a vital life force unless a life force or magical energy is available. For example, this spell would turn an animated stone statue into an animated flesh statue, but an ordinary statue would become a mass of inert flesh in the shape of the statue. You can affect an object that fits within a cylinder from 1 foot to 3 feet in diameter and up to 10 feet long or a cylinder of up to those dimensions in a larger mass of stone.

Name: Trobriand's Transparency
MaterialComponents: A sliver of silver topaz worth 50 gp
Target: One nonmagical stone or metal object up to 1 cu. ft. per level
Description: This spell gives the target object the transparency of glass. The transparency is suppressed while any magical effect is active on the object.

Name: Tunnel Swallow
MaterialComponents: A lump of chewed vegetable or meat
Target: Tunnel section up to 20 ft. in diameter and up to 50 ft. long
Description: You unleash the power of this spell, and the walls of the tunnel begin to roil and shift on all sides, clenching in rapid succession as they fling your opponents down the hallway.

Name: Wall of Iron
MaterialComponents: A small iron sheet plus gold dust worth 50 gp
Description: You cause a flat, vertical iron wall to spring into being. The wall inserts itself into any surrounding nonliving material if its area is sufficient to do so. The wall cannot be conjured so that it occupies the same space as a creature or another object. It must always be a flat plane, though you can shape its edges to fit the available space.

Name: Weblash
Range: Personal and Long (400 ft + 40 ft./level) (see text)
Description: Webbing grows from your arm, striking out at a target within long range. On a successful ranged touch attack against the target, the webs latch on, entangling the creature for the duration of the spell and allowing you make a special grapple check against the target. You gain a +8 bonus on your CMB for grapple checks you cause by striking a foe with the webbing. You can attempt this special grapple against any creature regardless of their size. If your grapple check succeeds, your target is caught in the webbing. For the duration of the spell, so long as the webbing has not caught a creature, the caster may make one attack per round with the webbing as a standard action.

Name: Acid Brand
Target: One creature/4 levels, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: You mark several allies with a caustic rune, causing them no damage. When you cast an acid spell with an area effect and a duration of instantaneous, you may exclude any or all of the marked allies from the immediate effects of your spell, though any lingering effects of the spell may still affect them.

Name: Animate Plants
Target: One Large plant per three caster levels or all plants within range; see text
Description: You imbue inanimate plants with mobility and a semblance of life. Each animated plant then immediately attacks whomever or whatever you initially designate as though it were an animated object of the appropriate size category. You may animate one Large or smaller plant, or a number of larger plants as follows: a Huge plant counts as two Large or smaller plants, a Gargantuan plant as four, and a Colossal plant as eight. You can change the designated target or targets as a move action, as if directing an active spell.

Name: Caustic Eruption
MaterialComponents: A vial of acid worth 10 gp
Description: Acid erupts from your space in all directions, causing 1d6 points of damage per caster level (maximum 20d6) to creatures and unattended objects in the area. This acid continues to burn for 2 rounds, dealing 1d6 points of acid damage per two caster levels (maximum 10d6) to any creature that took damage from the spell (a second Reflex save on each of the creature’s turns halves this additional damage for that round).

Name: Changestaff
Focus: A quarterstaff that has been carved, polished, and soaked in an herbal bath for 28 days, worth 500 gp
Description: You change a specially prepared quarterstaff into a Huge treant-like creature, about 24 feet tall. When you plant the end of the staff in the ground and speak a special command to conclude the casting of the spell, your staff turns into a creature that looks and fights just like a Treant (Treant). The staff-treant defends you and obeys any spoken commands. However, it is by no means a true treant; it cannot converse with actual treants or control trees. If the staff-treant is reduced to 0 or fewer hit points, it crumbles to powder and the staff is destroyed. Otherwise, the staff returns to its normal form when the spell duration expires (or when the spell is dismissed), and it can be used as the focus for another casting of the spell. The staff-treant is always at full strength when created, despite any wounds it may have incurred the last time it appeared.

Name: Greater Stone Shape
MaterialComponents: Soft clay coated with an herbal ointment worth 5 gp
Target: Stone or stone object touched, up to 10 cu. ft. + 10 cu. ft./level
Description: You can form an existing piece of stone into any shape that suits your purpose. While it’s possible to make crude coffers, doors, and so forth with stone shape, fine detail isn’t possible. There is a 30% chance that any shape including moving parts simply doesn’t work.

Name: Magnetic Field
Description: You create a spherical magnetic field that surrounds you to a range of 30 feet and follows you for the duration of the spell.

Name: Mass Synesthesia
Target: S: Up to 1 living creature/CL, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: This spell functions like Synesthesia, except it affects multiple creatures.

Name: Rampart
MaterialComponents: A handful of earth
Description: You create a massive rampart of hard-packed earth and stone 5 feet thick. The rampart cannot be conjured so that it occupies the same space as another creature or object. Each 5-foot-wide section of the rampart has hardness 0 and 180 hit points. A section of the rampart whose hit points drop to 0 is breached. If a creature tries to break through the rampart with a single attack, the DC for the Strength check is 60. A creature can climb over the rampart with a DC 20 Climb check.

Name: Regenerate
Focus: The preserved tail of a green anole lizard
Description: The subject’s severed body members (fingers, toes, hands, feet, arms, legs, tails, or even heads of multi-headed creatures), broken bones, and ruined organs grow back. After the spell is cast, the physical regeneration is complete in 1 round if the severed members are present and touching the creature. It takes 2d10 rounds otherwise.

Name: Siege of Trees
Target: S: One Large plant per three caster levels
Description: You imbue inanimate plants with limited mobility and a semblance of life.
