Each plant targeted acts as a light catapult until the end of the spell’s duration, though you must spend a standard action to aim each of these tree catapults before the first time they fire, and anytime thereafter when you want the trees to fire at a new target. The catapult uses your caster level as its targeting bonus. With a free action, you can command one or all of the trees under your command to stop firing. You do not need to supply ammunition to these tree catapults; they will automatically load themselves with rocks and boulders in the area, digging them deep from the ground if need be. You can supply the trees ammunition if you desire. The tree will not load flaming ammunition, and these catapult trees cannot be affected by energy siege shot if the energy selected is fire.

Name: Statue
MaterialComponents: Lime, sand, and a drop of water stirred by an iron nail
Description: A statue spell turns the subject to solid stone, along with any garments and equipment worn or carried. The exact type of stone is completely under the subject’s control. Even the closest inspection cannot reveal that the statue in question is actually a magically concealed creature. To all normal tests they are, in fact, a statue, although a detect magic spell reveals a strong transmutation on the statue. In statue form, the subject’s hit points and save bonuses remain unaffected. They gain a +10 natural armor bonus to AC and a hardness of 8 (unless their natural hardness is higher), but have an effective Dexterity score of 0 and a speed of 0 feet. They are immune to critical hits while in statue form. The subject can see, hear, and smell normally, but it does not need to eat or breathe. Feeling is limited to those sensations that can affect the granite-hard substance of the individual’s body. Chipping is equal to a mere scratch, but breaking off one of the statue’s arms constitutes serious damage. The subject of a statue spell can return to its normal state or return to the statue state (a standard action) if it so desires as long as the spell duration is in effect.

Name: Transmute Metal to Wood
Focus: A piece of iron embedded in an oak wand
Description: This spell enables you to change all metal objects within its area to wood. Weapons, armor, and other metal objects carried by creatures are affected as well. A magic object made of metal effectively has Spell Resistance equal to 20 + its caster level against this spell. Legendary items and objects of similar power (GM discretion) cannot be transmuted. Weapons converted from metal to wood take a -2 penalty on attack and damage rolls. The armor bonus of any armor converted from metal to wood is reduced by 2. Weapons changed by this spell splinter and break on any natural attack roll of 1 or 2, and armor changed by this spell loses an additional point of armor bonus every time it is struck with a natural attack roll of 19 or 20.

Name: Wall of Ooze
MaterialComponents: A bit of dried ochre jelly or grey ooze
Description: The caster causes a flat, vertical wall of festering, stinking organic ooze to bubble into being. This wall can be used to seal off a passage or close a breach, for the wall inserts itself into any surrounding nonliving material if its area is sufficient to do so. The wall cannot be conjured so that it occupies the same space as a creature or another object.

Name: Word of Balance
Description: You utter the elder words of balance. Those who stray too far from the path of even-handedness pay the price for their sins as the words judge them.

Name: Wrack Earth
Description: You stomp your foot, causing a shockwave to shoot out from you.

Name: Bombardment
Focus: A quartz crystal embedded in rock, worth 25 gp
Description: You point to the empty air and boulders tumble into being, burying your opponents.

Name: Control Plants
Focus: The flower of a yellow musk creeper, preserved in amber
Target: Up to 2 HD/level of plant creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: This spell enables you to control the actions of one or more plant creatures for a short period of time. You command the creatures by voice and they understand you, no matter what language you speak. Even if vocal communication is impossible, the controlled plants do not attack you. At the end of the spell, the subjects revert to their normal behavior.

Name: Earth Glide
Description: You gain the ability to glide through earth and stone as easily as an earth elemental does.

Name: Earthquake
Description:
When you cast earthquake, an intense but highly localized tremor rips the ground. The powerful shockwave created by this spell knocks creatures down, collapses structures, opens cracks in the ground, and more. The effect lasts for 1 round, during which time creatures on the ground can’t move or attack. A spellcaster on the ground must make a Concentration check (DC 20 + spell level) or lose any spell he or she tries to cast. The earthquake affects all terrain, vegetation, structures, and creatures in the area. The specific effect of an earthquake spell depends on the nature of the terrain where it is cast.


	
	Cave, Cavern, or Tunnel: The roof collapses, dealing 8d6 points of damage to any creature caught under the cave-in (Reflex DC 15 half) and pinning that creature beneath the rubble (see below). An earthquake cast on the roof of a very large cavern could also endanger those outside the actual area but below the falling debris and rubble.
	


	
	Cliffs: Earthquake causes a cliff to crumble, creating a landslide that travels horizontally as far as it falls vertically. Any creature in the path takes 8d6 points of bludgeoning damage (Reflex DC 15 half) and is pinned beneath the rubble (see below).
	


	
	Open Ground: Each creature standing in the area must make a DC 15 Reflex save or fall down. Fissures open in the earth, and every creature on the ground has a 25% chance to fall into one (Reflex DC 20 to avoid a fissure). The fissures are 40 feet deep. At the end of the spell, all fissures grind shut. Treat all trapped creatures as if they were in the bury zone of an avalanche, trapped without air (see Environment for more details).
	


	
	Structure: Any structure standing on open ground takes 100 points of damage, enough to collapse a typical wooden or masonry building, but not a structure built of stone or reinforced masonry. Hardness does not reduce this damage, nor is it halved as damage dealt to objects normally is. Any creature caught inside a collapsing structure takes 8d6 points of bludgeoning damage (Reflex DC 15 half) and is pinned beneath the rubble (see below).
	


	
	River, Lake, or Marsh: Fissures open under the water, draining away the water from that area and forming muddy ground. Soggy marsh or swampland becomes quicksand for the duration of the spell, sucking down creatures and structures. Each creature in the area must make a DC 15 Reflex save or sink down in the mud and quicksand. At the end of the spell, the rest of the body of water rushes in to replace the drained water, possibly drowning those caught in the mud.
	


	
	 Pinned Beneath Rubble: Any creature pinned beneath rubble takes 1d6 points of nonlethal damage per minute while pinned. If a pinned character falls unconscious, he or she must make a DC 15 Constitution check or take 1d6 points of lethal damage each minute thereafter until freed or dead.

Name: Excavate
MaterialComponents: A miniature adamantine shovel worth 50 gp and a pinch of excavated earth
Description: You toss the bit of earth against the wall and it glitters and burns as it strikes the stone. The rock vaporizes where it hits and a passage opens before you, burrowing into the wall.

Name: Mass Atavism
Target: One animal/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: This spell functions like Atavism, except that it affects multiple creatures.

Name: Repel Metal or Stone
Description: This spell creates waves of invisible energy that roll forth from you. All metal or stone objects in the path of the spell are pushed away from you to the limit of the range. Fixed metal or stone objects larger than 3 inches in diameter and loose objects weighing more than 500 pounds are not affected. Anything else, including animated objects, small boulders, and creatures in metal armor, moves back. Fixed objects 3 inches in diameter or smaller bend or break, and the pieces move with the wave of energy. Objects affected by the spell are repelled at the rate of 40 feet per round.

Name: Stonefury
Focus: A miniature emerald arrowhead worth 50 gp
Target: One creature/level, no two of which are more than 60 ft. apart
Description: Razor-sharp stones surround your targets. Each target takes 1d6 points of slashing damage per caster level (maximum 20d6). In addition, each target’s speed is halved for 1 round per caster level. Creatures that succeed on Reflex saving throws take half damage and their movement is unaffected.

Name: Arboreal Transformation
Description: Your subject’s skin splits open, revealing wood and bark. Leaves sprout from his limbs even as he starts to grow.

Name: Clashing Rocks
Description: You create two Colossal-sized masses of rock, dirt, and stone and slam them together against a single creature between them. The clashing rocks appear up to 30 feet away from the target on opposite sides and rush toward it with a mighty grinding crash. You must make a ranged touch attack to hit the target with the rocks. The clashing rocks ignore concealment and cover, and if there is a solid barrier between the target and either of the clashing rocks, the spell has a +28 bonus on the Strength check to burst through the barrier and continue unimpeded to the target. A creature struck by the clashing rocks takes 20d6 points of bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone. If the target fails a Reflex Saving Throw, it is also buried under the resulting rubble as if by a cave-in.

Name: Greater Siege of Trees
Target: S: One Gargantuan, Huge, or Large plant per three caster levels
Description: As Siege of Trees, but you can affect larger-sized plants. Each plant acts as a catapult of its size.

Name: Mass Thorn Prison
Target: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart.
Description: This spell functions as Thorn Prison, except it affects multiple creatures.

Name: Nature's Avatar
Focus: A miniature figurine of a great wolf, prowling
Description: You infuse the subject with the spirit of nature. The affected creature gains a +10 morale bonus on attack and damage rolls and 1d8 temporary inspired hit points per caster level, plus the effects of Haste. These temporary hit points go away when the spell ends.

Name: Dancing Lights
Description: Depending on the version selected, you create up to four lights that resemble lanterns or torches (and cast that amount of light), or up to four glowing spheres of light (which look like will-o’-wisps), or one faintly glowing, vaguely humanoid shape. The dancing lights must stay within a 10-foot-radius area in relation to each other but otherwise move as you desire (no concentration required): forward or back, up or down, straight or turning corners, or the like. The lights can move up to 100 feet per round. A light winks out if the distance between you and it exceeds the spell’s range.

Name: Dawn
Target: All creatures in a 15-ft.-radius burst centered on you
Description: With a cry similar to a rooster’s you cast the spell. For a moment you feel as if you had just awakened from a comfortable nap, but as the feeling fades, those around you begin to stir.

Name: Discern Health
Description:
You can see the aura that surrounds all living beings, and can read from it the target creature’s health. The amount of information revealed depends on how long you concentrate on a particular target:


	
	1st round: A creature’s total and remaining hit points.
	


	
	2nd round: Whether the creature is suffering from any debilitating condition.
	


	
	3rd round: The name of the creature’s debilitating condition (ability drained, confused, fatigued, etc.).

Name: Flare
Description: This cantrip creates a burst of light. If you cause the light to burst in front of a single creature, that creature is dazzled for 1 minute unless it makes a successful Fortitude save. Sightless creatures, as well as creatures already dazzled, are not affected by flare.

Name: Guidance
Description: This spell imbues the subject with a touch of divine guidance.

Name: Virtue
Description: With a touch, you infuse a creature with a tiny surge of life, granting the subject 1 temporary bolstered hit point.

Name: Alarm
Focus: A tiny bell and a piece of very fine silver wire
Description:
Alarm creates a subtle ward on an area you select. Once the spell effect is in place, it thereafter sounds a mental or audible alarm each time a creature of Tiny or larger size enters the warded area or touches it. A creature that speaks the password (determined by you at the time of casting) does not set off the alarm. You decide at the time of casting whether the alarm will be mental or audible in nature.


	
	Mental Alarm: A mental alarm alerts you (and only you) so long as you remain within 1 mile of the warded area. You note a single mental “ping” that awakens you from normal sleep but does not otherwise disturb concentration. A silence spell has no effect on a mental alarm.
	


	
	Audible Alarm: An audible alarm produces the sound of a hand bell, and anyone within 60 feet of the warded area can hear it clearly. Reduce the distance by 10 feet for each interposing closed door and by 20 feet for each substantial interposing wall.

Name: Axiomatic Water
MaterialComponents: 5 pounds of powdered iron and silver worth 25 gp
Description: This transmutation imbues a flask (1 pint) of water with the energy of law, turning it into axiomatic water.

Name: Bless
Description: Bless fills your allies with courage. Each ally gains a +1 morale bonus on attack rolls and on saving throws against fear effects.

Name: Bless Water
MaterialComponents: 5 pounds of powdered iron and silver worth 25 gp
Description: This transmutation imbues a flask (1 pint) of water with positive energy, turning it into holy water.

Name: Blessed Fist
Description: You imbue your body with a subtle blessing, lending divine guidance to your attacks. You are considered to be armed even when unarmed, so you don’t provoke attacks of opportunity when you attack foes with unarmed strikes. Your unarmed strikes can deal lethal or nonlethal damage (your choice). If you already has this ability (such as from the monk unarmed strike ability or the Improved Unarmed Strike feat), your unarmed strikes gain a +1 enhancement bonus on attack rolls and damage rolls, and they count as good-aligned weapons for the purposes of overcoming damage reduction.

Name: Blessing of the Watch
Description: Blessing of the Watch fills your allies with courage. When cast in the caster’s home city, and in areas under the jurisdiction of the city watch, each ally affected gains a +1 morale bonus on attack rolls and on saving throws against fear effects. For example, if the watch patrols a shantytown outside the city walls but not the ruined subterranean tunnels that lie beneath the city, the spell works in the former area but not the latter.

Name: Crusader's Strike
Description: Your next successful melee attack against an enemy surges with positive energy. You may choose to have the energy heal you or your enemy for 1d4 points of damage plus 1 per caster level (maximum +5). If you or your enemy is undead, they instead take that much damage. An undead creature can apply Spell Resistance, and can attempt a Will save to take half damage.

Name: Emblazon Crest
Focus: An example of the crest or coat of arms
Description: This spell ensures the subject touched is always able to display her proper crest and coat of arms.

Name: Erase
Description: Erase removes writings of either magical or mundane nature from a scroll or from one or two pages of paper, parchment, or similar surfaces. With this spell, you can remove explosive runes, a glyph of warding, a sepia snake sigil, or an arcane mark, but not illusory script or a symbol spell. Nonmagical writing is automatically erased if you touch it and no one else is holding it. Otherwise, the chance of erasing nonmagical writing is 90%.

Name: Faerie Fire
Focus: A miniature bullseye lantern made with mellochrysos
Description: A pale white glow surrounds and outlines the subjects. Outlined subjects shed light as candles. Creatures outlined by faerie fire take a -20 penalty on all Stealth checks. Outlined creatures do not benefit from the concealment normally provided by darkness (though a 2nd-level or higher magical darkness effect functions normally), blur, displacement, invisibility, or similar effects. The light is too dim to have any special effect on undead or dark-dwelling creatures vulnerable to light.

Name: Flare Burst
Description: All creatures in a 10-foot-radius burst from the target point are dazzled for 1 minute unless they make a successful Fortitude save. Sightless creatures, as well as creatures already dazzled, are not affected by flare.

Name: Hero's Defiance
Description: The instant before you are reduced to 0 or fewer hit points, you can expend a use of your lay on hands ability to heal yourself as if you had used lay on hands, plus an additional 1d6 hit points.

Name: Hold Portal
Target: One portal, up to 20 sq. ft./level
Description: This spell magically holds shut a door, gate, window, or shutter of wood, metal, or stone. The magic affects the portal just as if it were securely closed and normally locked. A knock spell or a successful dispel magic spell can negate a hold portal spell.

Name: Invest Light Protection
Description: You invest the target with a small infusion of positive energy. Their wounds knit shut, while the power you grant to them helps ward off future injuries. You heal a living creature you touch of 1d4 points of damage+1 per two caster levels (maximum +3). In addition, the creature touched gains damage reduction 1/evil for 1 minute.

Name: Liberating Command
Description: If the target is bound, grappled, or otherwise restrained, he may make an Escape Artist check to escape as an immediate action. He gains a competence bonus on this check equal to twice your caster level (maximum +20). This spell has no effect if the target could not get free by using the Escape Artist skill (for example, if he were under the effects of a hold person spell or paralyzed by Strength damage).

Name: Light of Lunia
Target: And Effect: You and up to two rays; see text
Duration: 10 minutes/level (D) or until discharged; see text
Description: The silvery radiance created by this spell emanates normal light from you in a 30-foot radius, and dim light extends for an additional 30 feet beyond that. Beginning after you cast this spell, you can choose to expend some or all of the Light of Lunia as a ray of light. You must succeed on a ranged touch attack with the ray to strike a target as an attack action. You can make a single ranged touch attack that deals 1d6 points of light damage, or 2d6 points of light damage against undead or evil outsiders, with a range of 30 feet. Spell resistance applies to this attack. This dims your silvery radiance to half (15-foot light, with dim light for an additional 15 feet). You can choose to fire one additional ray with the same characteristics either on the same round or on a subsequent round. Firing the second ray quenches your radiance and ends the spell.

Name: Magesquire's Robes
MaterialComponents: A small piece of chain cut from a chain shirt
Description: As the chain evaporates from your hand, your robe expands and tightens around you. The transmuted robe now bears subtle design elements not dissimilar to a chain shirt.

Name: Peacebond
Description: You lock a weapon in place on its owner’s body, or within the weapon’s sheath or holster. Anyone who then tries to draw the weapon must spend a standard action and succeed at a Strength check (DC equal to the saving throw DC) to do so, provoking attacks of opportunity whether the attempt succeeds or fails.

Name: Protection from Chaos
Description: This spell functions like Protection from Evil, except that the deflection and resistance bonuses apply to attacks made by chaotic creatures. The target receives a new saving throw against control by chaotic creatures and chaotic summoned creatures cannot touch the target.

Name: Protection from Evil
Description: This spell wards a creature from attacks by evil creatures, from mental control, and from summoned creatures. It creates a magical barrier around the subject at a distance of 1 foot. The barrier moves with the subject and has three major effects.

Name: Protective Interposition
Target: One willing creature of your same size or smaller
Description: With a sudden surge of energy, you swing your ally around, taking their place. When you cast this spell, you and one willing ally you’re physically touching trade positions. You may only cast this on a creature who is your same size category or smaller. If you occupy different spaces, the smaller of you must occupy at least one square previously occupied by the larger, the larger creature’s new space must completely cover the space previously occupied by the smaller, and you must start and end adjacent to each other. This spell fails if cast on an ally who cannot move due to physical restrictions, such as if they’re stuck to the ground by a Tanglefoot Bag or are being grappled.

Name: Rally Point
MaterialComponents: A small piece of a military banner
Description: You create a spot that has the power to briefly hearten any good creature who comes into contact with it. A good creature who enters this square (even if simply as part of its normal move) gains a +2 morale bonus on attacks, saving throws, and 2 temporary inspired hit points per caster level for 1 round. Nongood creatures gain no benefit from this spell.

Name: Remove Fear
Target: One creature plus one additional creature per four levels, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: You instill courage in the subject, granting it a +4 morale bonus against fear effects for 10 minutes. If the subject is under the influence of a fear effect when receiving the spell, that effect is suppressed for the duration of the spell.

Name: Remove Pain
Target: S: One creature plus one additional creature per four levels, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: You calm the subject’s pain, granting it a +4 morale bonus against pain effects for 10 minutes. If the subject is under the influence of a pain effect when receiving the spell, that effect is suppressed for the duration of the spell.

Name: Resistance
MaterialComponents: A miniature cloak
Description: You imbue the subject with magical energy that protects it from harm. The spell grants the subject a +2 resistance bonus on saves, with an additional +1 to the bonus for every six levels you have (maximum +5 resistance bonus at 18th level).

Name: Righteous Blow
Duration: Till the end of your next turn
Description: When you cast this spell, holy light surrounds around your weapons, ready to strike out.

Name: Sanctify Corpse
MaterialComponents: A pinch of silver dust
Description: This spell blesses a corpse with positive energy, preventing it from being turned into an undead creature. Attempts to raise the corpse as an undead automatically fail. If the corpse is of a person slain by a creature that creates undead out of its slain foes (such as a shadow, vampire, or wraith), that effect is delayed until the end of this spell. It is possible to protect a corpse for an extended time by casting this spell each day.

Name: Sanctuary
Focus: A small figurine of a knight
Description: Any opponent attempting to directly attack the warded creature, even with a targeted spell, must attempt a Will save. If the save succeeds, the opponent can attack normally and is unaffected by that casting of the spell. If the save fails, the opponent can’t follow through with the attack, that part of its action is lost, and it can’t directly attack the warded creature for the duration of the spell. Those not attempting to attack the subject remain unaffected. This spell does not prevent the warded creature from being attacked or affected by area of effect spells. The subject cannot attack without breaking the spell but may use non-attack spells or otherwise act.

Name: Saving Finale
Description: You must have a bardic performance in effect to cast this spell. With a flourish, you can immediately end your bardic performance when a creature within range affected by your bardic performance fails a Saving Throw, allowing the subject to immediately reroll the failed Saving Throw.

Name: Shield of Faith
MaterialComponents: Parchment with a holy text written on it
Description: This spell creates a shimmering, magical field around the target that averts and deflects attacks. The spell grants the subject a +2 deflection bonus to AC, with an additional +1 to the bonus for every six levels you have (maximum +5 deflection bonus at 18th level).

Name: Shield the Banner
Focus: A symbol on the banner to be protected
Description: This spell is used to protect one of a tribe’s most valuable possessions: its tribal banner. Any creature (other than a member of the tribe which the standard represents) attempting to directly attack or touch the standard must make a Will save. If the save succeeds, the creature can attack normally and is unaffected by that casting of the spell. If the save fails, the creature can’t follow through with the attack, that part of its action is lost, and it can’t directly attack the warded standard for the duration of the spell. Those not attempting to attack the standard remain unaffected. This spell does not prevent the warded standard from being attacked or affected by area of effect spells. The subject cannot attack without breaking the spell but may use non-attack spells or otherwise act. In addition, the spell grants a +2 bonus to the standard’s hardness, and +10 to the standard’s hit points for the duration of the spell.

Name: Sudden Shield
Description: You quickly create a rough shield of pale white force. The shield protects you from one physical attack or effect, granting you DR 5/—plus 1 per caster level (maximum DR 10/—) against that damage. Once the spell has reduced the damage of one attack or effect against you, it is discharged. This DR stacks with other sources of DR/—. Any attack capable of automatically destroying or ignoring a force effect bypasses the DR granted by Sudden Shield and ends the spell.

Name: Swift Girding
Target: One willing creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: With a sweep of your hand, you select a number of targets and the same number of suits of armor, all of which must be within 30 feet of each other.

Name: Sword of Law
Duration: Till the end of your next turn.
Description: When you cast this spell, a well-defined line of energy outlines your weapons, ready to strike out.

Name: Theft Ward
Description: You ward a single object in your possession against theft. You gain a +10 bonus on Perception checks to notice someone trying to take the object from you.

Name: True Guard
Focus: Small wooden replica of a tower shield
Description: You gain temporary, intuitive insight into the immediate future as you guard yourself. You gain a +20 insight bonus to your armor class and the benefits of  Light Fortification against the next attack roll made against you (if it is made before the end of the next round).

Name: Aid
Focus: An inspiring short story, poem, or religious passage
Description: Aid grants the target a +1 morale bonus on attack rolls and saves against fear effects, plus temporary inspired hit points equal to 1d8+1 per caster level (to a maximum of 1d8+10 temporary hit points at caster level 10th). These temporary hit points go away when the spell ends.

Name: Angelic Wrath
Focus: A silver statuette of an angel worth 5 gp
Description: Punish those who oppose the holy path.

Name: Anti-Summoning Shield
Description: Within the area of effect, this spell impedes the use of spells of the summoning subschool and other effects that summon creatures. Any such spells, spell-like abilities, or similar summoning effects used within the area have a percent chance of failure equals 5% × your caster level, to a maximum 75% chance of failure at 15th level. If the summoning effect already has a percent chance of failure (as is often the case with the summon spell-like ability of outsiders), these percentages stack. Creatures and items in the area must make a Will saving throw before casting such spells, spell-like abilities, or similar summoning effects, if they succeed they ignore the failure chance imposed by this spell for that casting (though must make additional saves for future conjurations). Attended items use their owners saving throw (or their own, if better).

Name: Arcane Lock
MaterialComponents: Gold dust worth 25 gp
Target: Door, chest, or portal touched, up to 30 sq. ft./level in size
Description: An arcane lock spell cast upon a door, chest, or portal magically locks it. You can freely pass your own arcane lock without affecting it. If the locked object has a lock, the DC to open that lock increases by 10 while it remains attached to the object. If the object does not have a lock, this spell creates one that can only be opened with a DC 20 Disable Device skill check. A door or object secured with this spell can be opened only by breaking in or with a successful dispel magic or knock spell. Add 10 to the normal DC to break open a door or portal affected by this spell. A knock spell does not remove an arcane lock; it only suppresses the effect for 10 minutes.

Name: Arrow of Law
Focus: A miniature arrow inscribed with a law
Description: You throw a shimmering arrow of pure order at any one target in range as a ranged touch attack. A chaotic creature struck by an arrow of law takes 1d8 points of damage per two caster levels (maximum 5d8). A chaotic outsider instead takes 1d6 points of damage per caster level (maximum 10d6) and is dazed for 1 round. A successful Will save reduces the damage to half and negates the daze effect. This spell deals only half damage to creatures that are neither chaotic nor lawful, and they are not dazed. The arrow has no effect on lawful creatures.

Name: Bigby's Warding Hand
Description: A spectral human hand springs into existence. It pushes into the target, forcing him back as he attempts to move.

Name: Blade Brothers
Description: You reach out and touch two creatures, and a sparkling tether of pale light briefly forms between them.

Name: Blessing of Courage and Life
Focus: A fragment of a Paladin’s weapon, shield or armor
Description: With this prayer you provide long-lasting succor to a wounded creature. For as long as the effect lasts, the target receives a +2 morale bonus on saving throws against fear and death effects. At any time while the spell is in effect, the target can choose to end the spell as a swift action for a burst of healing energy. The target loses the saving throw bonus, but is healed of 1d8 points of damage +1 point per caster level (maximum +10).

Name: Blinding Ray
Focus: A miniature figurine in the shape of the sun
Description: You blast your enemies with blinding rays of sunlight. You may fire one ray, plus one additional ray for every four levels beyond 3rd (to a maximum of three rays at 11th level). Each ray requires a ranged touch attack to hit. If a ray hits, it explodes into powerful motes of light, and the target must save or be blinded for 1 round. If the target has light blindness, light sensitivity, or is otherwise vulnerable to bright light, it instead must save or be blinded for 1d4 rounds and take 1d4 points of light damage per two caster levels (maximum 5d4). Any creature blinded by a ray sheds light as a sunrod for the duration of its blindness. The rays may be fired at the same or different targets, but all rays must be aimed at targets within 30 feet of each other and fired simultaneously.

Name: Brilliant Strike
Description: Light surges around the next ranged or melee attack you make (if made before the end of your next round). If it hits, you deal an extra 1d6 points of light damage, and your opponent must make a successful Reflex save or suffer a 20% miss chance on all melee and ranged attacks for 1 round (otherwise treated as per, and not stacking with, concealment). A successful Reflex save negates the miss chance, but not the extra damage. Spell resistance applies to this effect.

Name: Burst of Radiance
MaterialComponents: A piece of flint and a pinch of silver dust
Description: This spell fills the area with a brilliant flash of shimmering light. Creatures in the area are blinded for 1d4 rounds, or dazzled for 1d4 rounds if they succeed at a Reflex save. Evil creatures in the area of the burst take 1d4 points of light damage per caster level (max 5d4). A successful Will save halves this damage.

Name: Close Wounds
Description: Your ally falls from a crushing blow, but you don’t have time to reach him. You quickly speak words of power, and the worst of his injuries glow golden and begin to heal.

Name: Communal Protection from Chaos
Description: This spell functions like Protection from Chaos, except you divide the duration among the creatures in 1-minute intervals among the creatures touched.

Name: Communal Protection from Evil
Description: This spell functions like Protection from Evil, except you divide the duration among the creatures in 1-minute intervals among the creatures touched.

Name: Consecrate
MaterialComponents: A vial of holy water and 25 gp worth of silver dust
Description: This spell blesses an area with positive energy. The DC to resist positive channeled energy within this area gains a +3 sacred bonus. Every undead creature entering a consecrated area suffers minor disruption, suffering a -1 penalty on attack rolls, damage rolls, and saves. Undead cannot be created within or summoned into a consecrated area. If the consecrated area contains an altar, shrine, or other permanent fixture dedicated to your deity, pantheon, or aligned higher power, the modifiers given above are doubled (+6 sacred bonus to positive channeled energy DCs, -2 penalties for undead in the area).

Name: Continual Flame
MaterialComponents: A sunstone worth 50 gp
Description: A pale light, equivalent in brightness to a torch, springs forth from an object that you touch. The effect looks firelight, but it emites no flame, creates no heat, and doesn’t use oxygen. A continual flame can be covered and hidden but not smothered or quenched.

Name: Countermoon
MaterialComponents: A hair, scale, or other cast-off item from the type of creature.
Description: Translucent pale chains fly from your outstretched hand to wrap around the target before fading away.

Name: Death from Below
Description: You grant the target a dodge bonus to its Armor Class against attacks from larger creatures. The bonus is equal to +1 for every size category the attacker is larger than the target of the spell, to a maximum of +1 per 3 caster levels. If the spell’s target is a kithkin, the maximum bonus is equal to +1 per 2 caster levels.

Name: Effortless Armor
Description: Armor you wear no longer reduces your speed. You also reduce the armor’s armor check penalty by 1 + 1 per five caster levels (maximum 5).

Name: Empower Holy Water
Target: One or more vials of holy water
Description: You empower a vial of holy water to deal additional damage to undead creatures. You can empower one vial of holy water at 4th level, two at 8th level, and three at 12th level. When thrown at an undead creature, the affected vial of holy water deals an amount of bonus damage equal to your caster level (maximum +10) on a direct hit, and half that amount of bonus damage (maximum +5) to creatures caught in the splash area. This additional damage is positive energy damage, and has no effect on living creatures.

Name: Escaping Ward
Description: This ward grants you extra maneuverability when you avoid attacks against larger foes. While affected by this spell, when you are attacked and missed by a creature that is at least one size category larger than you, you can, as an immediate action, move up to 5 feet away from the attacking creature. You can increase this movement by 5 feet for every 5 caster levels. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

Name: Gird Ally
Target: One summoned creature you control/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: You create a magical field around summoned creatures you control that deflects attacks made against them. The targets gain a deflection bonus to their AC equal to 1 + 1 for every 6 caster levels you possess (maximum +4 deflection bonus at 18th level). An artificer can target their effigy with this spell.

Name: Grace
Description: Until the end of your turn, your movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

Name: Greater Discern Health
Target: S: One living creature touched per two levels
Description: When you need to keep track of comrades who may get wounded, greater discern health allows you to mentally monitor their general condition. You are aware any conditions affecting the creatures: unharmed, wounded, disabled, staggered, unconscious, dying, nauseated, panicked, stunned, poisoned, diseased, confused, or the like. Once the spell has been cast upon the subjects, the distance between them and the caster does not affect the spell as long as they are on the same plane of existence. If a subject leaves the plane, or if it dies, the spell ceases to function for it.

Name: Lesser Spell Immunity
Description: Silvery motes of light begin to snow down as you complete the spell, shifting to its recipient upon your successful touch. The motes coalesce into a nimbus that contracts and holds to the subject as a silvery sheen.

Name: Light of Mercuria
Target: And Effect: You and up to two rays; see text
Duration: 10 minutes/level (D) or until discharged; see text
Description: This spell functions as Light of Lunia, except the rays deal 2d6 points of damage, or 4d6 points of damage versus undead or evil outsiders.

Name: Light Prison
Description: Rays of light burst forth from your outstretched hand, encircling each target’s space with a cage of light. If a target fails its Reflex save, it becomes enclosed in the light prison. A creature enclosed in a light prison can attack, cast spells, and otherwise act normally as long as it stays within the light prison. However, if a creature passes through the walls of a light prison enclosing it, it takes 1d6 points of light damage and is blinded for 1 round. Creatures do not receive saves to negate these effects. Once a creature passes through the walls of a light prison surrounding it, the effect ends for that creature.

Name: Luminous Confession
Target: Or Area: Object touched or up to 1 sq. ft.
Description: You ward an object or an area with your personal rune or mark. You can choose for the writing to be visible or invisible, and it doesn’t harm the material upon which it is placed. A detect magic spell causes an invisible mark to glow and be visible. If any creature other than you touches the warded object or area and fails a Reflex save, its skin appears coated with a thick silver paint for 1 hour per level and it glows as-per the light spell for 10 minutes. This coloring cannot be washed away, but it can be dispelled.

Name: Obscure Object
Target: One object touched of up to 100 lbs./level
Description: This spell protects an object from location by divination (scrying) effects, such as the scrying spell or a crystal ball. If a divination (scrying) effect is attempted against the warded item, the caster of the divination must succeed on a caster level check (1d20+caster level) against a DC of 15+the caster level of the spellcaster who cast obscure object. If they fail, their divination (scrying) effect fails (if the divination is targeted on the object) or fails to perceive the object (if the divination is targeted on a nearby location, object, or person).

Name: Opportune Dodge
Description: Uttering a rapid series of words and reaching out your hand, you surround your comrade with a thin, blurry haze.

Name: Portal Alarm
MaterialComponents: A tiny bell
Target: One mundane or magical doorway, portal, or gate
Description: You cast a tiny bell at the gateway, and it rings as you finish the last gesture of the spell. With the completion of the spell, the bell vanishes in midair, but it continues to ring for a few moments more.

Name: Protection from Arrows
Focus: A piece of tortoiseshell or turtle shell
Description: The warded creature gains resistance to ranged weapons. The subject gains damage reduction 10/magic against ranged weapons. This spell doesn’t grant you the ability to damage creatures with similar damage reduction. Once the spell has prevented a total of 10 points of damage per caster level (maximum 100 points), it is discharged.

Name: Shield Block
Description: Protective magics thrust your shield between your defenseless ally and your enemy.

Name: Shield Other
Focus: A pair of platinum rings worth 50 gp worn by both you and the target
Description: This spell wards the subject and creates a mystic connection between you and the subject so that some of its wounds are transferred to you. The subject gains a +1 deflection bonus to AC and a +1 resistance bonus on saves. Additionally, the subject takes only half damage from all wounds and attacks (including those dealt by special abilities) that deal hit point damage. The amount of damage not taken by the warded creature is taken by you. Forms of harm that do not involve hit points, such as charm effects, temporary ability damage, level draining, and death effects, are not affected. If the subject suffers a reduction of hit points from a lowered Constitution score, the reduction is not split with you because it is not hit point damage. When the spell ends, subsequent damage is no longer divided between the subject and you, but damage already split is not reassigned to the subject.

Name: Spear of Purity
Focus: A miniature spear enscribed with an angel
Description: You hurl a pure white or golden spear of light from your holy symbol, affecting any one target within range as a ranged touch attack.

Name: Stabilize, Mass
Description: Filled with compassion and concern, you draw upon your deity’s power. A burst of golden energy springs forth, spreading from you. Those still alive around you seem less bloody and in less pain.

Name: Suppress Charms and Compulsions
Target: S: One creature plus one additional creature per 4 levels, no two of which can be further than 30 ft. apart
Description: The target is granted a +4 morale bonus on saves against charm and compulsion effects, and charms and compulsions in effect on the targets are suppressed for the duration of the spell.

Name: Thief Ward
Description: Thief ward creates an area where sounds are magnified, shadows lessened, and details brightened. All Sleight of Hand and Stealth checks made within the area suffer a -10 penalty.

Name: Touch of Mercy
Description: The target creature deals only nonlethal damage with all of its weapon attacks. Damage taken by creatures or objects that are not subject to nonlethal damage is not converted to nonlethal and remains lethal damage. The weapon retains all of its other normal properties.

Name: Undetectable Alignment
Description: An undetectable alignment spell conceals the alignment of an object or a creature from all forms of divination. If a divination would discern the alignment of the warded creature or item, the caster of the divination must succeed on a caster level check (1d20+caster level) against a DC of 20+the caster level of the spellcaster who cast undetectable alignment. If they fail, they cannot detect the target’s alignment for the duration of this spell, even across multiple divinations.

Name: Warding Weapon
Focus: One melee weapon you are proficient in and you are holding
Description: The focus of this spell flies upward above your head and takes a defensive position within your space. It lunges at opponents, as if guided by a martially trained hand, parrying and turning back melee attacks aimed at you, but does not strike back at any opponent nor does it damage them. The weapon serves only as a defense. While it protects you, you can cast spells without provoking attacks of opportunity, without the need to cast them defensively. A creature with the Disruptive feat can easily bypass this spell’s defenses. You provoke attacks of opportunity for casting spells against these creatures even when subject to this spell, though you can still choose to cast defensively.

Name: Word of Resolve
Description: You focus your aura on one ally that just failed a saving throw against a charm or fear effect, allowing them to reroll their saving throw against the effect with a +4 sacred bonus. If you do not have the aura of courage class ability, this spell has no effect on the target’s fear. If you do not have the aura of resolve class ability, this spell has no effect on any charm effects on the target.

Name: Ablative Sphere
MaterialComponents: A crystalline sphere worth 10 gp
Description: An immobile, crystalline, web-like globe surrounds you. When the ablative sphere winks into existence, it provides you with improved cover (see below). The barrier does not impede a spell’s line of sight or effect.

Name: Archon's Aura
Description: You gain a powerful aura, similar to an archon’s aura of menace. Any hostile creature within a 20-foot radius of you must make a Will save to resist the effects of this aura. If the creature fails, it takes a –2 penalty on attack rolls and saving throws and to Armor Class for the duration of this spell, or until it successfully hits you with an attack. A creature that has resisted or broken the effect cannot be affected again by this particular casting of archon’s aura.

Name: Awaken Sin
Focus: The toy of a murdered child
Description: A command for repentance issues from your mouth, carrying with it the power of the spell. The crushing feeling of guilt that grew within you while you cast the spell lifts as you project the feeling at your target.

Name: Axiomatic Storm
MaterialComponents: A flask of axiomatic water worth 25 gp
Description: You call upon the forces of law and a heavy rain of golden energy begins to fall around you, its raindrops harsh and metallic. Above you, a ray of golden light lances down from the heavens.

Name: Axiomatic Blood
Description: Your innate order infuses your body with lawful energy. While this energy does not directly empower you, it can harm embodiments of chaos. Any creature that damages you with a slashing or piercing melee weapon is sprayed by your lawful blood. If the attacker is a creature with the chaotic subtype, it takes 1d6 points of axiomatic damage each time it successfully hits you. If you have the lawful subtype or an ability that grants you an aura of law (like heiromancers or some clerics), its blood instead deals 2d6 points of axiomatic damage. Creatures that don’t have the chaotic subtype or that are using reach weapons are not subject to this damage.

Name: Blade Snare
Description: This spell creates an invisible magic field that does not stop weapons (whether manufactured or natural) from moving toward you, but impedes their motion when they are retracted. When you are hit with a melee attack, attempt a caster level check against your opponent’s CMD. If your check succeeds, your opponent’s attacking weapon or body part becomes caught in the field, as if magically affixed to your body. If your check fails, your opponent may retract its weapon.

Name: Blessed Strike
Duration: Until end or turn or until discharged
Description: You imbue your weapon with the power of your lay on hands ability – costing you one of your daily uses of the ability. Your next successful melee attack made before the end of the turn discharges this energy. If the target would be harmed by your lay on hands ability, you add the effect of your lay on hands to the normal effects of the strike. Should you hit someone who would be healed by your lay on hands ability, the attack deals no damage to them and they benefit as if you had used your lay on hands ability on them.

Name: Blessed Weapon
Description: This transmutation makes a weapon strike true against evil foes. The weapon is treated as having a +1 enhancement bonus for the purpose of bypassing the DR of evil creatures or striking evil incorporeal creatures (though the spell doesn’t grant an actual enhancement bonus). The weapon also becomes good-aligned, which means it can bypass the DR of certain creatures. (This effect overrides and suppresses any other alignment the weapon might have.) Individual arrows or bolts can be transmuted, but affected projectile weapons (such as bows) don’t confer the benefit to the projectiles they shoot.

Name: Chain Wall
Description: Hundreds of golden chains erupt from the wall, holding fast your enemies.

Name: Champion's Bout
Description: You allow two chosen champions to fight without interference. The two creatures must be willing in order for the spell to work.

Name: Channel Glyph
MaterialComponents: Powdered garnet worth 100 gp
Target: Or Area: Object touched or up to 5 sq. ft./level
Description: When triggered, this glyph unleashes a burst of your channeled energy. When you cast this spell, it uses one of your channel energy attempts for the day. If you do not have the channel energy ability or do not have any uses of channel energy left for the day, this spell fails. If you have multiple channel energy options available to you, you must choose one of them.

Name: Communal Protection from Arrows
Focus: A piece of tortoiseshell or turtle shell
Description: This spell functions like Protection from Arrows, except you divide the duration among the creatures in 1-hour intervals among the creatures touched.

Name: Consecrated Ward
Description: The warded creature gains some protection against negative energy. This spell absorbs 10 points of negative energy damage (such as from Inflict Light Wounds) that adversely affects it. This spell absorbs a maximum of 10 points of damage per caster level (up to a maximum of 150 points at 15th level), at which point the spell ends.

Name: Crusader's Blessing
Description: Restorative energy swells around your allies. The first successful attack each target makes against an enemy while subject to this spell surges with positive energy. They may choose to have the energy heal them or their enemy for 1d4 points of damage plus 1 per caster level (maximum +10). If they or their enemy is undead, they instead take that much damage. An undead creature can apply Spell Resistance, and can attempt a Will save to take half damage.

Name: Dampen Magic
Description: This spell surrounds your target with a mystical field that dampens the effects of magic. While it is in effect, the enhancement bonus of any magic weapon used against your target is lowered by 1. For instance, a +4 longsword would have only a +3 enhancement bonus on attack rolls and damage rolls when wielded against your target. However, even if a weapon’s enhancement bonus is reduced below +1, its masterwork bonus still applies. Similarly, every spell or spell-like ability that affects your target – whether it is specifically targeted at them or merely includes them in its area – takes a -1 penalty to caster level, but only against your target.

Name: Daybreak Arrow
Target: Up to 50 pieces of ammunition, all of which must be together at the time of casting
Description: You cause ammunition, including shuriken, to exude radiant energy. Creatures that take penalties in bright light take these penalties for 1 round after being struck by such ammunition. Undead and creatures harmed by sunlight take an additional 1d6 points of Light damage from such projectiles. Such a projectile sheds light as if it were a sunrod for 1 round after it is fired or thrown.

Name: Daylight
Description: You touch an object when you cast this spell, causing the object to shed bright light in a 60-foot radius. This illumination increases the light level for an additional 60 feet by one step (darkness becomes dim light, dim light becomes normal light, and normal light becomes bright light). Creatures that take penalties in bright light take them while within the 60-foot radius of this magical light. Despite its name, this spell is not the equivalent of daylight for the purposes of creatures that are damaged or destroyed by such light.

Name: Glowing Orb
Description: This spell places a magical light source inside the glass sphere focus, roughly the size of a human fist (hardness 0, 2 hit points). You can control the light level generated by a glowing orb by mental command (a standard action), provided that the orb is within 30 feet of you. Alternately, any other creature with a Wisdom of at least 13 can control of an orb simply by touching it and willing it to change, which is similarly a standard action mental command. The light level ranges from no light at all to illumination within a 60-foot radius. There is no limit to the number of glowing orbs you can possess, and you can control their light levels independently or in concert.

Name: Glyph of Warding
MaterialComponents: Powdered sunstone worth 200 gp
Target: Or Area: Object touched or up to 5 sq. ft./level
Description: When casting this spell, you select a version of it to use, which alters the spell in a variety of ways.

Name: Greater Arcane Lock
MaterialComponents: Gold dust worth 25 gp, plus 5 gp per individual attuned
Target: Door, chest, or portal touched, up to 30 sq. ft./level in size
Description: This spell works identically to Arcane Lock, except that at the time of casting you may attune up to 1 individual per caster level to the object targeted by the spell. These individuals (who must be present during casting) can freely pass the improved arcane lock as if they had cast the spell.

Name: Holy Storm
MaterialComponents: A flask of holy water worth 25 gp
Description: You call upon the forces of good, and a heavy rain of pale energy begins to fall around you, its raindrops soft and warm. Above you, a pale white light flashes.

Name: Invest Moderate Protection
Description: You invest the target with an infusion of positive energy. Their wounds knit shut, while the power you grant to them helps ward off future injuries. You heal a living creature you touch of 3d4 points of damage+1 per two caster levels (maximum +6). In addition, the creature touched gains damage reduction 3/evil for 1 minute.

Name: Invisibility Purge
Description: You surround yourself with a sphere of power with a radius of 5 feet per caster level that negates all forms of invisibility.

Name: Lawful Weapon
Description: This transmutation makes a weapon strike true against chaotic foes. The weapon is treated as having a +1 enhancement bonus for the purpose of bypassing the DR of chaotic creatures or striking chaotic incorporeal creatures (though the spell doesn’t grant an actual enhancement bonus). The weapon also becomes lawful-aligned, which means it can bypass the DR of certain creatures. (This effect overrides and suppresses any other alignment the weapon might have.) Individual arrows or bolts can be transmuted, but affected projectile weapons (such as bows) don’t confer the benefit to the projectiles they shoot.

Name: Lesser Fortify
Description: Fortifying magics reinforce the target. The touched creature gains 2 temporary bolstered hit points per level of the caster, to a maximum of 20 points at 10th level. These temporary hit points go away when the spell ends. This spell ends after these temporary hit points are lost.

Name: Light of Venya
Target: And Effect: You and up to two rays; see text
Duration: 10 minutes/level (D) or until discharged; see text
Description: This spell functions as Light of Lunia, except the rays deal 3d6 points of damage, or 6d6 points of damage versus undead or evil outsiders.

Name: Luminous Wall
MaterialComponents: A pinch of powdered sunstone
Description: A blinding flash accompanies the completion of this spell as a wall of pure light springs into being.

Name: Mageknight's Robes
MaterialComponents: A small piece of plate cut from a breastplate
Description: As the steel evaporates from your hand, your robe expands and tightens around you. The transmuted robe now bears subtle design elements not dissimilar to a breastplate.

Name: Magic Circle against Chaos
Description: This spell functions like Magic Circle against Evil, except that it is similar to Protection from Chaos instead of Protection from Evil, and it can imprison a non-lawful called creature.

Name: Magic Circle against Evil
Description: All creatures within the area gain the effects of a  Protection from Evil spell, and evil summoned creatures cannot enter the area either. Creatures in the area, or who later enter the area, receive only one attempt to suppress effects that are controlling them. If successful, such effects are suppressed as long as they remain in the area. Creatures that leave the area and come back are not protected. You must overcome a creature’s Spell Resistance in order to keep it at bay (as in the third function of protection from evil), but the deflection and resistance bonuses and the protection from mental control apply regardless of enemies’ Spell Resistance.

Name: Magic Vestment
Description: You imbue a suit of armor or a shield with an enhancement bonus of +1 per four caster levels (maximum +5 at 20th level).

Name: Mantle of Calm
Focus: A miniature statue of a person meditating
Description: You surround yourself with a mantle of calm serenity. You take a –2 penalty on attack rolls, and opponents gain a +2 bonus on saving throws against spells you cast. Any creature affected by a rage effect that strikes you with a melee attack must attempt a Will saving throw, without anyrage effect’s bonus to Will saves; failure means the rage effect ends (as if it were dispelled or the creature voluntarily ended it, as appropriate).

Name: Mantle of Good
Description: You invoke the powers of good, and a shimmering white field of holy energy swaddles you.

Name: Mantle of Law
Description: You invoke the powers of law, and a golden field of axiomatic energy surrounds you.

Name: Martyr's Last Blessing
Target: S: You and up to one ally/level, all of which must be within 15 feet of you
Description: You fall unconscious but also unleash a luminous wave of positive energy that heals your allies. You can cast this spell as either a standard action on your turn, or as an immediate action when brought to below 0 hit points. If cast as a standard action, you are immediately reduced to -1 hit points, but stable, as part of casting the spell.

Name: Noble Sacrifice
Description: You open up a brief but powerful divine conduit between you and another creature, taking on the damage and any other effects that creature suffers. When a creature in range is hit by an attack or fails a saving throw, you can cast this spell and the wounds and/or effects are magically transmitted to you instead of the target. You are affected as if you were hit by the attack or failed the saving throw, taking all the damage and suffering all of the adverse effects. Any resistances or immunities you have are applied normally, but you cannot otherwise reduce or negate the damage or effects in any way.

Name: Nondetection
MaterialComponents: Jargoon dust worth 50 gp
Description: The warded creature or object becomes difficult to detect by divination spells such as clairaudience/clairvoyance, locate object, and detect spells. Nondetection also prevents location by such magic items as crystal balls. If such a divination is attempted against the warded creature or item, the caster of the divination must succeed on a caster level check (1d20+caster level) against a DC of 11+the caster level of the spellcaster who cast nondetection. If you cast nondetection on yourself or on an item currently in your possession, the DC is 15+your caster level.

Name: Perfect Placement
MaterialComponents: A chess piece
Target: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: Affected creatures gain tactical knowledge and maximize their efficiency on the field of battle. Each gains a +1 insight bonus to AC and Reflex saves. Against attacks of opportunity, the insight bonus to AC increases to +3.

Name: Quell Energy
Description: You reduce the target creature’s ability to tap into a single energy type (acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic) of your choice. This reduces damage of the selected type the creature deals with spells, spell-like abilities, and supernatural abilities by 10 points.

Name: Repelling Shield
Description: You imbue a shield with small bits of mystical force that can push attackers away from it. Whenever a creature makes a melee attack against a person holding and wielding the shield, that creature is pushed 5 feet away from the wielder after the attack is resolved. A successful Reflex save negates this effect, and spell resistance applies. Any given creature may only be moved by this effect once per round.

Name: Reviving Finale
Target: S: Up to 1 ally/level, all of which must be within a 20-ft.-radius burst centered on you
Description: You must have a bardic performance in effect to cast this spell.

Name: Righteous Blood
Description: Your innate goodness infuses your body with holy energy. While this energy does not directly empower you, it can harm embodiments of evil. Any creature that damages you with a slashing or piercing melee weapon is sprayed by your holy blood. If the attacker is a creature with the evil subtype, it takes 1d6 points of holy damage each time it successfully hits the target. If you have the good subtype or an ability that grants you an aura of good (like paladins or some clerics), its blood instead deals 2d6 points of holy damage. Creatures that don’t have the evil subtype or that are using reach weapons are not subject to this damage.

Name: Searing Light
Description: Focusing power like a ray of the sun, you project a blast of light from your open palm. You must succeed on a ranged touch attack to strike your target.

Name: Shield Counter
Description: You slam your shield into an attacking enemy, disrupting their attack. As an immediate action, can you can attempt a shield bash against an opponent you threaten that is attacking you. This attack is made with a –2 penalty. If your shield bash hits, your opponent takes a penalty on their attack equal to the amount of damage they took from your shield bash. You keep your shield bonus to AC against that attack, but lose it for the rest of your round as normal after making the shield bash, unless you have Improved Shield Bash or some other effect that prevents this. This spell doesn’t allow you to shield bash with a shield you can’t normally do so with (such as a tower shield). You can cast this spell after an opponent makes his attack roll, but you must do so before you know whether the attack was a success or a failure. You can only cast this spell if you’re actively holding a shield, and doesn’t work for strapped shields (such as a buckler) or if you’re not actively wielding the shield.

Name: Sign of Sealing
MaterialComponents: 100 gp worth of crushed sunstone
Target: One door, chest, or other opening of up to 5 sq. ft./level
Description: While pointing at the target, you trace the lines of a complicated sigil that visually appears where it is to seal. The sigil glows with latent magical energy.

Name: Silverlight
MaterialComponents: 1 silver piece
Description: As  Daylight, except the object touched sheds bright silvery light in a 20-foot radius. In addition to providing illumination, the area of bright light is painful to creatures that are susceptible to alchemical silver. A creature with DR/silver that begins its turn within the light of this spell is automatically dazzled and becomes sickened unless it succeeds on a Fortitude save. These effects disappear 1 round after the target leaves the silverlight. A creature that leaves the area and then returns must make a new saving throw. This spell provides dim light up to 40 feet away, but only creatures within 20 feet are subject to the above effects.

Name: Swift Blessed Weapon
Description: This transmutation makes a weapon strike true against evil foes. The weapon is treated as having a +1 enhancement bonus for the purpose of bypassing the DR of evil creatures or striking evil incorporeal creatures (though the spell doesn’t grant an actual enhancement bonus). The weapon also becomes good-aligned, which means it can bypass the DR of certain creatures. (This effect overrides and suppresses any other alignment the weapon might have.) Individual arrows or bolts can be transmuted, but affected projectile weapons (such as bows) don’t confer the benefit to the projectiles they shoot.

Name: Swift Lawful Weapon
Description: This transmutation makes a weapon strike true against chaotic foes. The weapon is treated as having a +1 enhancement bonus for the purpose of bypassing the DR of chaotic creatures or striking chaotic incorporeal creatures (though the spell doesn’t grant an actual enhancement bonus). The weapon also becomes lawful-aligned, which means it can bypass the DR of certain creatures. (This effect overrides and suppresses any other alignment the weapon might have.) Individual arrows or bolts can be transmuted, but affected projectile weapons (such as bows) don’t confer the benefit to the projectiles they shoot.

Name: Veil of Positive Energy
Target: You or all undead creatures within 5 ft.; see text
Description: You surround yourself with a veil of positive energy, making it harder for undead creatures to harm you. When under the effect of this spell, you gain a +2 sacred bonus to AC and a +2 sacred bonus on saves. Both of these bonuses apply only against attacks or effects created by undead creatures. You can dismiss this spell before its normal duration as a swift action on your turn to deal a number of points of positive energy damage equal to your level to all undead creatures within 5 feet of you.

Name: Aura of Greater Courage
Description: When you cast this spell you strengthen your paladin’s Aura of Courage. Until the end of its duration, the radius of the aura is increased to 20 ft and all allies within that aura gain a +8 morale bonus on saves against fear effects. If you do not have the aura of courage class feature, aura of greater courage has no effect.

Name: Aura of Perfect Order
Description: A perfect outline of golden energy surrounds you as you cast this spell. Order reigns supreme, driving away the whims of chaos.

Name: Aura of Triumph
Description: You channel the power of good through your body and soul, infusing the area around you with a soft, golden radiance. With each blow you strike against evil, you feel invigorated and driven onward.

Name: Cast Out
MaterialComponents: A palmful of salt
Description: With a melee touch attack you blast a single creature with energies disruptive to any magic controlling or manipulating it. If the target is currently affected by any possession effect (such as a magic jar spell or a ghost’s malevolence ability) or enchantment (compulsion) spells, the target takes 2d8 points of divine damage + 1 point per caster level (maximum +15). In addition, you make a dispel check against any of those effects on the target creature, starting with the highest level spells and proceeding to lower level spells (a supernatural effect counts as a spell of one-half the creature’s hit dice, with a caster level equal to their hit dice). Treat this as a targeted Demystify spell, except Cast Out can dispel one such spell for every four caster levels you possess. A successful Will save halves the damage and limits the dispelling to a single spell or effect. A creature not under any of the listed effects takes no damage from this spell.

Name: Celestial Brilliance
Description: The object touched sheds light as a Daylight spell. In addition, every evil-aligned creature within the area of bright light (a 60-foot radius) takes 2d6 points of Holy damage per turn. If the creature has spell resistance, the spell must overcome it to deal damage.

Name: Crusader's Edge
MaterialComponents: Dried blood from an evil outsider, sprinkled on the weapon
Description: When you cast this spell on a melee weapon you imbue it with a powerful holy energy, granting the weapon the bane weapon quality against evil outsiders. Furthermore, whenever you score a successful critical hit against an outsider with the evil subtype, you not only deal normal critical damage with the weapon but also nauseate the outsider for 1d3 rounds—the outsider can reduce this nauseated condition to sickened for 1 round with a successful Fortitude save.

Name: Dimensional Anchor
Description: A white ray springs from your hand. You must make a ranged touch attack to hit the target. Any creature or object struck by the ray is covered with a shimmering white glow that completely blocks extradimensional travel. Forms of movement barred by a dimensional anchor include astral projection, blink, dimension door, ethereal jaunt, etherealness, gate, maze, plane shift, shadow walk, teleport, and similar spell-like abilities. The spell also prevents the use of a gate or teleportation circle for the duration of the spell.

Name: Divine Arrow
Focus: The arrow or bolt to be fired
Duration: Until end or turn or until discharged
Description: You imbue a single arrow or bolt with the power of your lay on hands ability – costing you one of your daily uses of the ability. When this imbued projectile hits a target it discharges this energy. If the target would be harmed by your lay on hands ability, you add the effect of your lay on hands to the normal effects of the projectile. Should you hit someone who would be healed by your lay on hands ability, the projectile deals no damage to them and they benefit as if you had used your lay on hands ability on them. The arrow or bolt must be fired during the same round the spell is cast, or the magic dissipates and is lost. The projectile is destroyed even if it misses its target.

Name: Dramatic Rescue
Target: One willing creature of your same size or smaller
Description: With a sudden surge of energy you grab your ally and move them to safety. When you cast this spell, you move one ally you’re physically touching into any empty square adjacent to you. You may only cast this on a creature who is your same size category or smaller. You may alternately choose to swap spaces with them, as per Protective Interposition.

Name: Force Ward
Description: You shield a creature against force effects. This spell absorbs 10 points of force damage or damage from spells with the force descriptor (such as from Forcewave). This spell absorbs maximum of 10 points of damage per caster level (up to a maximum of 150 points at 15th level), at which point the spell ends.

Name: Freedom of Movement
Description: This spell has a 75% chance to enable you or a creature you touch to move and attack normally, even under the influence of magic that usually impedes movement, such as solid fog, slow, web, and magical forms of paralysis. Whenever exposed to such an effect, they have a 75% chance to negate an instantaneous effect (such a grapple or a tanglefoot bag) or ignore the effect until the beginning of their next round (such as being in a web or black tentacles spell). At the beginning of each round the target checks once against all effects that would hinder them, removing ongoing hindering conditions if successful.

Name: Holy Shield
Description: You gain the ability to magically project the defense of your held shield to protect another creature at a distance, your own shield appearing misty and somewhat insubstantial while a golden reflection of your shield appears by your target. When you cast this spell, you designate one target within 30 feet. The target gains your shield’s shield bonus and enhancement bonus to Armor Class; you gain no benefit from the shield’s shield bonus or enhancement bonus while using this spell, but you can still use any of the shield’s other properties or abilities (such as magical abilities, making a shield bash, or providing cover with a tower shield).

Name: Holy Smite
Description: You draw down holy power to smite your enemies. Only evil and neutral creatures are harmed by the spell; good creatures are unaffected.

Name: Holy Ward
Description: The warded creature gains partial protection against unholy powers. This spell absorbs 10 points of unholy damage (such as from Unholy Weapon) or damage from evil-aligned spells (such as Unholy Blight). This spell absorbs a maximum of 10 points of damage per caster level (up to a maximum of 150 points at 15th level), at which point the spell ends.

Name: Invigoration
Description: You point your finger and fire a white ray of positive energy that suppresses the life force of any creature healed by negative energy it strikes. You must make a ranged touch attack to hit. If you hit, the subject gains 1d4 temporary positive levels (see Positive and Negative Levels). Positive levels stack.

Name: Irian's Light
Description: You channel the light of Irian, the Eternal Day, into two or more brilliant rays of positive energy that heal the living and harm the undead. You may fire two rays, plus one additional ray for every four levels beyond 7th (so three rays at 11th level and a maximum four rays at 15th level). Each ray requires a ranged touch attack to hit. Any living creature struck by a ray heals 2d6 points of damage. Any undead or other creature powered by negative struck by a ray takes 2d6 points of damage, though may make a Will save to take half damage. The rays may be fired at the same or different targets, but all rays must be aimed at targets within 30 feet of each other and fired simultaneously.

Name: Judge's Blade
MaterialComponents: Dried blood from a chaotic outsider, sprinkled on the weapon
Description: When you cast this spell on a melee weapon you imbue it with a powerful lawful energy, granting the weapon the Bane weapon quality against chaotic outsiders. Furthermore, whenever you score a successful critical hit against an outsider with the chaotic subtype, you not only deal normal critical damage with the weapon but also nauseate the outsider for 1d3 rounds—the outsider can reduce this nauseated condition to sickened for 1 round with a successful Fortitude save.

Name: Leashed Shackles
Description: You create shackles of golden force that attach to the target’s limbs. You designate an object or location within 30 feet of the target for the shackles to anchor themselves to; this must be the ground, a wall, or a sturdy structure for the anchoring to occur. The target is entangled, and cannot move more than 30 feet from the anchor point of the spell. The shackle itself cannot be attacked (though it can be dispelled), but if the object or area it is attached to is broken, the target is free to move away (though it is still entangled).

Name: Lesser Globe of Invulnerability
MaterialComponents: A glass or crystal bead
Description: An immobile, faintly shimmering magical sphere surrounds you and excludes all spell effects of 3rd level or lower. The area or effect of any such spells does not include the area of the lesser globe of invulnerability. Such spells fail to affect any target located within the globe. Excluded effects include spell-like abilities and spells or spell-like effects from items. Any type of spell, however, can be cast through or out of the magical globe. Spells of 4th level and higher are not affected by the globe, nor are spells already in effect when the globe is cast. The globe can be brought down by a dispel magic spell. You can leave and return to the globe without penalty.

Name: Light Lance
Description: You create a glorious beam of brilliant radiance that acts as a +1 holy lance suitable for your size. You must have a free hand when casting the spell and, once you call the lance into being, you cannot switch it to another hand or put it down without prematurely ending the spell. As a standard action while holding a light lance, you can choose not to make an attack and instead hold the lance aloft as a beacon of light and truth, creating an area of bright light with a radius of 90 feet. If you choose to do this for one or more additional rounds the lance also casts a spear of brilliant light up into the sky that grows progressively more visible as it continues to climb toward the heavens. Under cover of night or other darkness, if nothing obstructs the beam, it becomes visible for an additional 2 miles during each round in which you continue to aim your lance skyward (2 miles in the second round, 4 miles in the third round, and so on).

Name: Light of Purity
Duration: Until end of turn or until discharged
Description: Your holy symbol gleams with a bright, white light that seems to cleanse the air around you of the foul stench emanating from your undead enemies.

Name: Light Ward
Description: The warded creature gains some protection against dark powers. This spell absorbs 10 points of shadow damage or damage from spells with the darkness descriptor (such as from Obscuring Shadow Veil). This spell absorbs a maximum of 10 points of damage per caster level (up to a maximum of 150 points at 15th level), at which point the spell ends.

Name: Order's Wrath
Description: You channel lawful power to smite enemies. The power takes the form of a three-dimensional grid of energy. Only chaotic and neutral (not lawful) creatures are harmed by the spell.

Name: Order's Ward
Description: The warded creature gains some protection against chaotic powers. This spell absorbs 10 points of anarchic damage (such as from Anarchic Weapon) or damage from chaotic-aligned spells (such as Chaos Hammer). This spell absorbs a maximum of 10 points of damage per caster level (up to a maximum of 150 points at 15th level), at which point the spell ends.

Name: Remove Curse
Description: Remove curse can remove all curses on an object or a creature. If the target is a creature, you must make a caster level check (1d20 + caster level) against the DC of each curse affecting the target. Success means that the curse is removed. Remove curse does not remove the curse from a cursed shield, weapon, or suit of armor, although a successful caster level check enables the creature afflicted with any such cursed item to remove and get rid of it.

Name: Revelation
MaterialComponents: A clump of dandelion fluff and herbs worth 50 gp
Description: A burst of pale light reveals all that is hidden.

Name: Spell Immunity
Description: The warded creature is immune to the effects of one specified spell for every four levels you have. The spells must be of 4th level or lower. The warded creature effectively has unbeatable spell resistance regarding the specified spell or spells. Naturally, that immunity doesn’t protect a creature from spells for which spell resistance doesn’t apply. Spell immunity protects against spells, spell-like effects of magic items, and innate spell-like abilities of creatures. It does not protect against supernatural or extraordinary abilities, such as breath weapons or gaze attacks.

Name: Symbol of Revelation
MaterialComponents: Mercury and phosphorous, plus powdered pearl and opal worth a total of 1,000 gp
