Description: When triggered, a symbol of revelation reveals any of the following creature within 60 feet: invisible creatures, creatures affected by an illusion (glamer) effect, creatures with the shapechanger subtype, or creatures that have magically changed their shape. These creatures are outlined by a pale light that functions like Faerie Fire, except it lasts for 10 minutes per caster level; the symbol does not otherwise reveal their true form. Once triggered, the symbol becomes active and glows, lasting for 10 minutes per caster level. A creature that enters the area while the symbol is active is subject to its effect, whether or not that creature was in the area when it was triggered.

Name: Trap Ward
MaterialComponents: Masterwork thieves’ tools worth 100 gp
Description: The protection provided by this spell comes into play whenever the caster is subjected to the effects of a magical trap.

Name: True Form
Target: S: Up to one creature/3 levels, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: True form removes any polymorph effect from a target creature, returning it to its true form, even against its will. Against creatures affected by polymorph spell effects (such as baleful polymorph or giant form), you must make a caster level check (1d20+caster level, maximum +15) against a DC of 11+caster level of the effect. Success means that the polymorph immediately ends.

Name: Unbearable Brightness
Description: Your body glows with a terrible light, casting bright light out to 30 feet and dim light out the 30 feet beyond that. Creatures within 30 feet of you that can see you are dazzled (no saving throw). Creatures with light sensitivity must succeed at a Reflex saving throw or be blinded. Dazzled and blinded conditions from your light end when the spell ends or when the creature is out of line of sight.

Name: Wake of Light
Duration: Until end of turn plus 1 round/level
Description: You and your mount lay down a trail of glowing, heavenly mist behind you as you move that makes passage easier for good creatures but more difficult for evil creatures. If you are not mounted when you cast wake of light, this spell fails. This glowing trail of mist appears behind your mount in a path starting where you cast the spell and ending where your mount ends its movement for the turn. The mist takes the form of a path 10 feet wide and up to 120 feet long. Thereafter, the mist persists for 1 round per level.

Name: Ward the Faithful
Description: All creatures within the area who worship the same god as you gain a +2 deflection bonus to AC and a +2 resistance bonus on all saves. At 12th level, these bonuses increase to +3. At 18th level, the bonuses increase to +4.

Name: Wings of Cover
Description: Immense, partially translucent wings unfurl from behind you and shield you from your enemy for a single heartbeat.

Name: Banish Seeming
MaterialComponents: A cold iron nail
Description: With a melee touch attack you can dispel an illusion or return a creature to its natural form. This functions as dispel magic directed at the effect in question, except you receive a +2 enhancement bonus on your dispel check and you can only dispel illusions or changes in form created by supernatural effects or spells. If multiple effects are changing the creature’s appearance, you can dispel one such effect for every four caster levels you possess, starting with the highest caster level spells and proceeding to spells with lower caster levels. The caster level for supernatural abilities such as change shape is equal to the target creature’s Hit Dice. A creature returned to its natural form by banish seeming is prevented from changing its form again for a number of rounds equal to your caster level.

Name: Blade of Bright Victory
Description: You strengthen the bond between your divine bond weapon and its celestial spirit. The weapon gains the ghost touch property. You may change your weapon’s damage type (bludgeoning, piercing, slashing) as a swift action. You gain a sacred bonus to your CMD against disarm and sunder attacks directed at your bonded weapon; this bonus is equal to half your caster level.

Name: Break Enchantment
Target: Up to one creature per level, all within 30 ft. of each other, or one object
Description: This spell frees victims from enchantments, transmutations, and curses. Break enchantment can reverse even an instantaneous effect. For each such effect, you make a caster level check (1d20 plus caster level, maximum +15) against a DC of 11 plus caster level of the effect. Success means that the creature is free of the spell, curse, or effect. For a cursed magic item, the DC is equal to the DC of the curse.

Name: Breath of Life
Description: This spell cures 4d4 points of damage +1 point per caster level (maximum +20). If you cast this spell immediately after the subject takes damage, it effectively prevents the damage. It would keep alive someone who had just dropped to –10 hit points, for example, leaving the character at negative hit points but stable.

Name: Circlet of Invigoration
Description: You form a small ring of positive energy around your wrist, which harms neither you nor your equipment. The circlet launches from your arm, and you must succeed on a ranged touch attack to strike your target. A struck creature heals 3d6 points of damage and gains 5 temporary invigorated hit points. The temporary hit points disappear when this spell ends for that creature, typically 1 hour after being struck. If the temporary hit points are lost, this spell ends for that creature.

Name: Communal Spell Immunity
Description: This spell functions like Spell Immunity, except you divide the duration among the creatures in 10-minute intervals among the creatures touched.

Name: Commune with City
Description: You become one with a community that you are in, attaining knowledge of the surrounding community. You instantly gain knowledge of as many as three facts from among the following subjects: the population of the community, the dominant race within the community and the percentage of the population it encompasses, any given race’s percentage of the total population, a significant economic factor affecting trade within the city, a major news item within the city (see Gather Information, chosen randomly if more than one), or the name of one of the community’s central figures (usually a community leader; if the community has more than one, as most do, roll randomly) and their well-known association (such as the city hall for a mayor, their guild for a guildmaster, or their religion for a spiritual leader).

Name: Dawn Shroud
Description: You cause the target to glow with the rosy light of the dawn. In addition to casting light as a Daylight spell, the light is harmful to oozes and undead. When the spell is cast, and at the beginning of each of your turns thereafter, such creatures take 1d6 points of light damage if within the bright light of the spell (out to 60 feet) or 1 point of damage per round if within the shadowy illumination of the spell (more than 60 feet, out to 120 feet). If the subject is touched by such a creature using a touch attack, or if it hits the subject with a natural weapon or unarmed strike, that creature takes 1d6 points of light damage+1 point per caster level (maximum 1d6+15), with a Will saving throw negating the damage.

Name: Demon Snare
MaterialComponents: A pouch of silvered powder worth 25 gp
Description: Your touch creates an invisible circle on a flat surface.

Name: Dispel Chaos
Focus: A vial of mixed pearl and silver dust
Target: Or s: You and a touched chaotic creature from another plane, or you and an enchantment or chaotic spell on a touched creature or object
Duration: 1 round/level or until discharged, whichever comes first
Description: Shimmering, golden lawful energy surrounds you. This energy has three effects.

Name: Dispel Evil
Focus: A vial of mixed pearl and silver dust
Target: Or s: You and a touched evil creature from another plane, or you and an enchantment or evil spell on a touched creature or object
Duration: 1 round/level or until discharged, whichever comes first
Description: Shimmering, white holy energy surrounds you. This energy has three effects.

Name: Fortify
Description: Fortifying magics surge across the target’s body. The touched creature gains 5 temporary bolstered hit points per level of the caster, to a maximum of 75 points at 15th level. These temporary hit points go away when the spell ends. This spell ends after these temporary hit points are lost.

Name: Greater Aid
Focus: An inspiring short story, poem, or religious passage
Description: You impart hope onto your ally. Greater Aid grants the target a +3 morale bonus on attack rolls, ability checks, and on saves against fear or charm effects, plus temporary inspired hit points equal to 2d10 plus caster level (to a maximum of 2d10 plus 15 temporary hit points at caster level 15th). These temporary hit points go away when the spell ends.

Name: Hallow
MaterialComponents: Herbs, oils, and incense worth at least 1,000 gp, plus 1,000 gp per level of the spell to be included in the hallowed area
Description: Hallow makes a particular site, building, or structure a holy site. This has four major effects.

Name: Hymn of Mercy
Description: The creatures within the area deal only nonlethal damage with all weapon attacks. Damage taken by creatures or objects that are not subject to nonlethal damage is not converted to nonlethal and remains lethal damage. Weapons so affected retain all other normal properties.

Name: Invest Heavy Protection
Description: This spell functions as Invest Light Protection, except it provides 5d4 plus 1 per two caster levels of healing (maximum +12) and gives the target DR 5/evil, and causes undead and creatures fueled by negative energy to take an additional 5 points of damage.

Name: Invigorating Solar Strike
Duration: Instantaneous and 10 minutes or 1 hour (see text)
Description: Your weapon becomes cloaked in an brilliant white nimbus. As you strike your undead opponent, that energy snaps out and drains away his necromantic life force.

Name: Ivory Ward
Description: The creature you designate is surrounded by a glowing white aura of restraining energies. Once per round when the target makes an attack or casts a spell that deals damage, it must succeed at a Will saving throw (DC equal to the saving throw of this spell). If the target fails the saving throw, it deals half damage with the attack or spell. On a successful saving throw it takes a -4 penalty on damage rolls for that attack or spell. You can dismiss this spell as an immediate action when the target confirms a critical hit; doing so negates the critical hit. The attack that you negated still hits, but only deals half damage.

Name: Lucent Lance
Focus: A clear glass or crystal rod
Description: The eternal energies of light and darkness you call upon to cast this spell cause the ambient light near you to coalesce around the crystal rod in your hand. The light erupts in a coruscating beam of radiance shaped like a needle-sharp lance.

Name: Marks of Forbiddance
Target: S: One enemy and one ally
Description: Marks of Forbiddance magically brand two creatures – one enemy and one ally – preventing them from committing violence against one another. When you cast this spell choose one enemy and one ally within range. Both targets become branded with the sigil of forbiddance. Until the end of the spell’s duration, each time one of the targets attempts to take a violent action against the other, they must attempt a Will save. If the save succeeds, that target can attack the other normally (though must still make additional saves for future actions).

Name: Martyr's Warding
Focus: A set of platinum rings worth 50 gp worn by both you and each target
Target: S: Up to one creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: This spell functions as per Shield Other, except as listed above and that it affects multiple subjects.

Name: Mass Shield of Faith
Target: One creature/level, no two of which are more than 30 ft. apart
Description: This spell creates a shimmering, magical field around each target creature that averts and deflects attacks. The spell grants each subject a +2 deflection bonus to AC, with an additional +1 to the bonus for every six levels you have (maximum +5 deflection bonus at 18th level).

Name: Pillar of Life
Description: You conjure a pillar of positive energy in a single 5-foot square within range that radiates light as if it were a sunrod. Living creatures adjacent to the pillar can spend a standard action to touch the pillar and heal 2d8 points of damage + 1 point per caster level (maximum +20). Creatures can move into the square containing the pillar, but if an undead creature moves into the pillar it takes 1d6 points of damage per caster level (maximum 10d6). Undead creatures vulnerable to bright light take 1d8 points if damage per caster level (maximum 10d8). A creature cannot benefit or suffer more than once from a single casting of this spell.

Name: Protective Spirit
Description: A protective spirit is an invisible, mindless, shapeless force that hovers about you, defending you against unexpected attacks. When a creature makes an attack of opportunity against you, the protective spirit makes an immediate attack using your base attack bonus plus your Dexterity modifier. On a successful hit, the spirit does no damage, but it causes the attack of opportunity to automatically miss. A protective spirit can defend against a number of attacks of opportunity equal to your Dexterity bonus (minimum 1) per round.

Name: Safe Clearing
Description: You press your hand against the ground and intone the ancient words. A pale radiance spreads from your hand, forming a faint ring of light. “We’re safe,” you tell your allies, “for the moment.”

Name: Slaadi Snare
MaterialComponents: A pouch of silvered powder worth 25 gp
Description: Your touch creates an invisible circle on a flat surface.

Name: Soothe Construct
Description: You soothe the elemental spirit of a targeted construct, reducing its chance of going berserk by 1d4% per four caster levels (maximum 5d4%). If cast on a construct that has already gone berserk and you are its master, you may immediately roll the now reduced d% to end the construct’s berserk state, it returns to normal functioning, and its berserk chance returns to 0%. This spell can alternately be used to end the effect of any one spell or effect that would disorient, enrage, or confuse a construct you are the master of, such as Disorient Construct.

Name: Sphere of Warding
MaterialComponents: A 3-ft.-diameter circle of salt
Description: You create a luminescent sphere of orbiting energy that harms incorporeal creatures and dispossesses them of any stolen bodies. An incorporeal creature must succeed at a Will save to enter a space overlapping with the sphere; failure means the creature cannot pass through the sphere. If the incorporeal creature succeeds, it may pass through the sphere at will, though if it ends its turn within the sphere, it takes a number of points of light damage equal to 1d6 + 1 per caster level (maximum +10).

Name: Stalwart Pact
MaterialComponents: Incense and anointing oil worth 250 gp
Focus: A pair of platinum rings worth 50 gp worn by both you and the target
Description: You touch your ally and empower him with a spell that will later take effect in dire need.

Name: Sun Strike
Description: Brilliant light surges around the next ranged or melee attack you make (if made before the end of your next round). If it hits, you deal an extra 1d4 points of light damage per 2 caster levels (maximum 10d4), and your opponent must make a successful Reflex save or suffer a 50% miss chance on all melee and ranged attacks for 1 round (otherwise treated as per, and not stacking with, total concealment). A successful Reflex save negates the miss chance, but not the extra damage. Spell resistance applies to this effect.

Name: Telepathy Block
SavingThrow: Will negates; see text or none (object)
Description: This spell hinders all telepathic communication within the affected area, making telepathic conversation very difficult. Any telepathic creature, item, or spell must succeed on a caster level check (DC 15 plus this spell’s caster level) to send a telepathic message in the area. Any creature, item, or spell attempting to send telepathic messages into the area must make the same check. For telepathic creatures, they use their hit dice in place of their caster level.

Name: Undeath Ward
Description: Mindless undead and intelligent undead with fewer Hit Dice than your caster level cannot enter the area or penetrate the barrier. Undead of Hit Dice equal to or greater than your caster level can pass through this barrier by making a successful Will save against the spell, but as they do so, they take 3d6 points of damage. Once an undead creature makes its save against this spell and takes this damage, it can come and go without further penalty. This spell may only be used defensively, not aggressively. Forcing an undeath ward against creatures that the spell keeps at bay collapses the barrier.

Name: Wall of Light
MaterialComponents: A chip of mica
Description: An immobile, blinding curtain of white light that blocks line of sight springs into existence.

Name: Zone of Revelation
Description: After making a dramatic gesture and uttering a few words of power, you close your eyes and open them again, revealing all that is hidden.

Name: Angel's Strike
Description: Sacred energies surge across your weapon. Your next melee attack this round is Good aligned. If your attack hits and your opponent has an Evil alignment, a blast of pale holy energy erupts from them. The struck opponent takes an extra 1d10 points of holy damage per 3 CL (max 6d10 at 18th level) and must succeed on a Fortitude save or take a -2 luck penalty on attack rolls for 1 minute. All other Evil creatures within a 30 foot radius burst of the target creature must also succeed on a Fortitude save. Those who fail take the same amount of holy damage dealt to the primary target and take a -2 luck penalty on attack rolls for 1 minute. A successful Fortitude save reduces to half damage and negates the attack penalty. Spell resistance applies to this effect, and prevents the burst if failed against the primary target.

Name: Anger of the Noonday Sun
Description: Your body explodes with radiance that bathes the area around you in sunlight.

Name: Antilife Shell
Description: You bring into being a mobile, spherical energy field that moves with you and prevents the entrance of most types of living creatures.

Name: Archon's Strike
Description: Ordered energies surge across your weapon. Your next melee attack this round is Lawful aligned. If your attack hits and your opponent has a Chaotic alignment, a blast of golden lawful energy erupts from them. The struck opponent takes an extra 1d10 points of axiomatic damage per 3 CL (max 6d10 at 18th level) and must succeed on a Fortitude save or take a -2 luck penalty on attack rolls for 1 minute. All other Chaotic creatures within a 30 foot radius burst of the target creature must also succeed on a Fortitude save. Those who fail take the same amount of axiomatic damage dealt to the primary target and take a -2 luck penalty on attack rolls for 1 minute. A successful Fortitude save reduces to half damage and negates the attack penalty. Spell resistance applies to this effect, and prevents the burst if failed against the primary target.

Name: Crown of Brilliance
MaterialComponents: A sunstone worth 5 gp
Description: A blazing crown of golden light surrounds your head, creating bright light out to 20 feet and dim light 20 feet beyond that. Creatures within the aura of brilliant light that make a melee attack against you must make successful Fortitude saving throws or be blinded for 1d4 rounds. A creature only needs to save once against the blinding effect of this spell. Creatures that successfully save, and creatures that have recovered from blindness, are still dazzled for as long as they remain within the bright light.

Name: Divine Strength
Description: Drawing on the essence of light, your hands are reinforced with a celestial radiance, giving you two slam attacks per round (1d6 each if you are Medium creature, or 1d4 if you are Small) though the slam attacks may instead be wielded as manufactured weapons. Each hit with one of these slam attacks inflicts 1 positive level on your target if they’re fueled by negative energy. The DC to overcome these positive levels is equal to the DC of this spell. For every positive level you inflict in this fashion, you gain 5 temporary bolstered hit points (up to a maximum of 50 temporary bolstered hit points). These temporary hit points go away when the spell ends.

Name: Forbiddance
MaterialComponents: Holy water and incense worth 1,500 gp, plus 1,500 gp per 60-foot cube
Focus: A miniature silver door, inscribed with a lock
Description: Forbiddance seals an area against all planar travel into or within it. This includes all teleportation spells (such as dimension door and teleport), plane shifting, astral travel, ethereal travel, and all summoning spells. Such effects simply fail automatically.

Name: Globe of Invulnerability
MaterialComponents: A glass or crystal bead
Description: An immobile, faintly shimmering magical sphere surrounds you and excludes all spell effects of 4th level or lower. The area or effect of any such spells does not include the area of the lesser globe of invulnerability. Such spells fail to affect any target located within the globe. Excluded effects include spell-like abilities and spells or spell-like effects from items. Any type of spell, however, can be cast through or out of the magical globe. Spells of 5th level and higher are not affected by the globe, nor are spells already in effect when the globe is cast. The globe can be brought down by a dispel magic spell. You can leave and return to the globe without penalty.

Name: Greater Glyph of Warding
MaterialComponents: Powdered sunstone worth 400 gp
Target: Or Area: Object touched or up to 5 sq. ft./level
Description: This spell functions as Glyph of Warding, with the following changes:

Name: Greater Light of Purity
Duration: Until end of turn or until discharged
Description: Your holy symbol is wreathed in a wrathful, iridescent glow that causes undead creatures to wither before its celestial light.

Name: Greater Sign of Sealing
MaterialComponents: 500 gp worth of crushed sunstone
Target: One door, chest, or other opening of up to 10 sq. ft./level
Description: This spell functions like Sign of Sealing, except doors and objects protected by a greater sign of sealing are strengthened, increasing their hardness by 10 and granting them an extra 5 hit points per caster level. Any object protected by a greater sign of sealing is treated as a magic item for the purpose of making saving throws and gains a +4 resistance bonus on saving throws.

Name: Incorporeal Chains
Target: One incorporeal creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: You summon ghostly chains of light to bind incorporeal creatures. The chains’ CMB is equal to your caster level plus your Wisdom modifier. Roll only once for the entire spell effect and apply the result to all targeted incorporeal creatures.

Name: Mass Aid
Target: One living creature/level, no two of which are more than 30 ft. apart
Description: You hold your symbol aloft and cast the spell. A pale gold radiance dances from your hands, leaping over all the nearby party members and strengthening them.

Name: Seal Portal
MaterialComponents: A silver rod worth 50 gp
Description: You cast a silver rod in the direction of the portal and it vanishes, becoming a semi-translucent net of silver magic that briefly encases the portal before disappearing.

Name: Angelic Shield
Focus: A miniature shield made of platinum and mother of pearl, worth 250 gp
Description: A large shield of shimmering alabaster force forms beside you, interposing itself between you and an incoming magical ray.

Name: Anti-Death Shield
Description: You imbue the area with positive energy so powerful it sparks against any negative energy used to heal a creature in the area. Anyone in the area who attempts to use negative energy to heal a creature must succeed on a caster level check DC 11+your caster level (for supernatural abilities, creatures use their HD as their caster level when making this check). If the check fails, the healing is prevented and instead deals arcane damage to each of the effect’s targets equal to the effect’s caster level (or HD if a supernatural ability) instead of its normal effect.

Name: Blaze of Glory
Description: You fall unconscious but also unleash a spectacular wave of holy energy that heartens and heals your allies while leaving your opponents daunted and damaged. You can cast this spell as either a standard action on your turn, or as an immediate action when brought to below 0 hit points. If cast as a standard action, you are immediately reduced to -1 hit points, but stable, as part of casting the spell.

Name: Blessing of the Devout
Target: One weapon/level, no two of which are more than 30 ft. apart
Description: This spell makes all targeted weapons good-aligned and deal an additional 1d6 points of holy damage on hit. A weapon that is aligned can bypass the damage reduction of certain creatures. This spell has no effect on a weapon that already has an alignment other than good. Every group of up to 50 projectiles (which must be together at the time of casting) counts as one weapon for the purpose of benefiting from this spell. This spell can be cast on both natural and manufactured weapons.

Name: Blessing of the Righteous
Target: One weapon/level, no two of which are more than 30 ft. apart
Description: This spell makes all targeted weapons lawful-aligned and deal an additional 1d6 points of axiomatic damage on hit. A weapon that is aligned can bypass the damage reduction of certain creatures. This spell has no effect on a weapon that already has an alignment other than lawful. Every group of up to 50 projectiles (which must be together at the time of casting) counts as one weapon for the purpose of benefiting from this spell. This spell can be cast on both natural and manufactured weapons.

Name: Circle of Clarity
Description: You create a magical emanation that interferes with all figments and glamers within it, giving creatures a +4 bonus on saving throws to recognize them as illusions. The emanation negates concealment less than total concealment within the area. Perception checks to notice creatures or objects within the area gain a bonus equal to half your caster level (maximum +10). The spell is stationary if cast on a point in space. It is mobile if centered on a creature or object, though creatures or attended objects can negate the spell with a saving throw or spell resistance.

Name: Dictum
Description: Any non-lawful creature within the area of a dictum spell suffers the following ill effects, depending on their HD, whether the creature can hear the spell or not.

Name: Holy Star
MaterialComponents: A tiny piece of sacred incense, worth 25 gp
Description: By calling upon the power of your deity, you bring into existence a glowing mote of energy near your shoulder. While no brighter than a candle, the mote of light fills your body with an inner warmth and feeling of reassuring protection.

Name: Holy Sword
Description: This spell allows you to channel holy power into your sword, or any other melee weapon you choose. The weapon acts as a +5 holy weapon (+5 enhancement bonus on attack and damage rolls, extra 2d6 damage against evil opponents). It also emits a magic circle against evil effect (as the spell). If the magic circle ends, the sword creates a new one on your turn as a free action. The spell is automatically canceled 1 round after the weapon leaves your hand. You cannot have more than one holy sword at a time.

Name: Holy Word
Description: Any non-good creature within the area of a holy word spell suffers the following ill effects, depending on their HD, whether the creature can hear the spell or not.

Name: Hymn of Peace
Description: Each time a subject of this spell attempts to attack another creature or object, or otherwise perform an aggressive or damaging action toward a creature or object, it must attempt a Will save. If the save succeeds, the subject can attack normally. If the save fails, the subject cannot follow through with the attack and loses that part of its action. Creatures not taking violent actions are unaffected by this spell.

Name: Lawful Sword
Description: This spell allows you to channel the powers of law into your sword, or any other melee weapon you choose. The weapon acts as a +5 axiomatic weapon (+5 enhancement bonus on attack and damage rolls, extra 2d6 damage against chaotic opponents). It also emits a magic circle against chaos effect (as the spell). If the magic circle ends, the sword creates a new one on your turn as a free action. The spell is automatically canceled 1 round after the weapon leaves your hand. You cannot have more than one lawful sword at a time.

Name: Lifelink Weapon
Description: This spell allows you to channel restorative power into a melee weapon, turning it into a shining blade that channels life-sustaining energies as you fight. The weapon acts as a +5 Lifelink weapon. The spell is automatically canceled 1 round after the weapon leaves your hand. You cannot have more than one lifelink weapon at a time.

Name: Magic Guards
Target: One suit of armor or shield/level, no two of which are more than 30 ft. apart
Description: You imbue a number of shields or suits of armor within range with magic, granting each a +1 enhancement bonus bonus per 5 caster levels (maximum +4). An outfit of regular clothing counts as armor that grants no AC bonus for the purpose of this spell.

Name: Rejuvenating Light
Focus: A golden rod inlaid with jade and sunstone worth 500 gp
SavingThrow: None or Fortitude negates; see text
Description: A soft, comforting glow emanates from the object you’ve touched, filling the entire area with light and warmth. Though seemingly gentle, the light pierces the shadows like the rays of the sun.

Name: Sacrificial Oath
Description: You create a powerful bond between yourself and a single creature. Until the end of the spell’s duration, each time the target is takes damage or fails a Saving Throw, you can take the full damage of that attack and any other effects that creature suffers. If you choose not to take on the damage and effects, you instead take a number of points of damage equal to your Constitution score as backlash. The target’s resistances and immunities apply before calculating before what damage and effects are transferred (for instance, a creature immune to poison will never transfer a poison), but you cannot otherwise reduce or negate the damage or effects of either the transfer or the backlash. If you are entirely immune to a type of effect that would be transferred, you do not suffer for that effect (for instance, if a creature transferred a fear effect to you but you’re immune to fear, you don’t suffer from the fear effect). If you or the subject of the spell move out of line of sight, the spell ends.

Name: Sunbeam
Duration: 1 round/level or until all beams are exhausted
SavingThrow: Reflex negates and Reflex half; see text
Description: For the duration of this spell, you can use a standard action to evoke a dazzling beam of intense light each round. You can call forth one beam per three caster levels (maximum six beams at 18th level). The spell ends when its duration runs out or your allotment of beams is exhausted.

Name: Urban Shield
MaterialComponents: A chip of stone or brick
Description: The city itself shields you from harm, leaning in to protect you with its walls, lampposts, and other structures.

Name: Celestial Sphere
Description: You create a small weightless sphere of pure positive energy. As a move action, you can move it up to 30 feet per round in any direction. If it enters a space with a creature fueled by negative energy, it stops moving for the round and that creature gains one positive level (Fortitude negates). Any such creature passing through or ending its turn in the space occupied by the sphere gains one positive level (Fortitude negates). Twenty-four hours after gaining a positive level from the sphere, the subject must make a Fortitude saving throw (the DC of this save is equal to the DC of this spell) for each positive level. If the save succeeds, that positive level is removed. If it fails, that negative level becomes permanent.

Name: Dimensional Lock
MaterialComponents: 100 gp worth of powdered pearls
Description: You create a shimmering pale barrier (quickly fading to being nearly imperceptible) that completely blocks extradimensional travel. Forms of movement barred include astral projection, blink, dimension door, ethereal jaunt, etherealness, gate, maze, plane shift, shadow walk, teleport, and similar spells and spell-like abilities. Once dimensional lock is in place, extradimensional travel into or out of the area is not possible.

Name: Greater Spell Immunity
Description: This spell functions as Spell Immunity, except the target can be protected from spells of 8th level or lower.

Name: Heroic Aid
Focus: An inspiring short story, poem, or religious passage
Description: You impart the will of a hero onto your ally. Heroic Aid grants the target a +5 morale bonus on attack rolls, ability checks, and on Will saves, plus temporary inspired hit points equal to 3d12 plus caster level (to a maximum of 3d12 plus 20 temporary hit points at caster level 20th). These temporary hit points go away when the spell ends.

Name: Holy Aura
Target: S: One creature/level in a 20-ft.-radius burst centered on you
Description:
A brilliant divine radiance surrounds the subjects, protecting them from attacks, granting them resistance to spells cast by evil creatures, and causing evil creatures to become blinded when they strike the subjects. This abjuration has four effects.


	
	First, each warded creature gains a +4 deflection bonus to AC and a +4 resistance bonus on saves. Unlike protection from evil, this benefit applies against all attacks, not just against attacks by evil creatures.
		Second, each warded creature gains spell resistance 25 against evil spells and spells cast by evil creatures.
		Third, the abjuration protects the recipient from possession and mental influence, just as protection from evil does.
		Finally, if an evil creature succeeds on a melee attack against a creature warded by a holy aura, the offending attacker is blinded (Fortitude save negates, as blindness/deafness, but against holy aura’s save DC).

Name: Protection from Spells
MaterialComponents: Pearl worth 500 gp
Focus: One 1,000 gp pearl per target. Each subject must carry the gem for the duration of the spell. If a subject loses the gem, the spell ceases to affect him.
Target: S: Up to one creature touched per four levels.
Description: The subject gains a +8 resistance bonus on saving throws against spells and spell-like abilities (but not against supernatural and extraordinary abilities).

Name: Radiant's Judgement
Description: A wave of light suffused with positive energy explodes outward, dealing 1d6 points of light damage per caster level (maximum 20d6) and one positive level to creatures in the area. A successful fortitude save halves the damage and the individual does not take the positive level.

Name: Shield of Law
Description:
A dim, golden glow surrounds the subjects, protecting them from attacks, granting them resistance to spells cast by chaotic creatures, and slowing chaotic creatures when they strike the subjects. This abjuration has four effects.


	
	First, each warded creature gains a +4 deflection bonus to AC and a +4 resistance bonus on saves. Unlike protection from chaos, this benefit applies against all attacks, not just against attacks by chaotic creatures.
		Second, a warded creature gains Spell Resistance 25 against chaotic spells and spells cast by chaotic creatures.
		Third, the abjuration protects you from possession and mental influence, just as protection from chaos does.
		Finally, if a chaotic creature succeeds on a melee attack against a warded creature, the attacker is slowed (Will save negates, as the slow spell, but against shield of law‘s save DC).

Name: Sunburst
Description: Sunburst causes a globe of searing radiance to explode silently from a point you select. Sunburst first attempts to dispel any darkness spells of 8th level or lower within its area, as per the area option for Purify. Then, all creatures subject to the searing light are blinded and take 6d6 points of light damage. A creature to which sunlight is harmful or unnatural takes double damage. A successful Reflex save negates the blindness and reduces the damage by half.

Name: Communal Greater Spell Immunity
Description: This spell functions like Greater Spell Immunity, except you divide the duration among the creatures in 10-minute intervals among the creatures touched.

Name: Elder Glyph of Warding
MaterialComponents: Powdered sunstone worth 1,000 gp
Target: Or Area: Object touched or up to 5 sq. ft./level
Description: This functions as Glyph of Warding, with the exceptions noted here.

Name: Energy Infusion
Description: You let losoe a coruscating white ray of positive energy that powerfully suppresses the life force of any creature healed by negative energy that it strikes. You must make a ranged touch attack to hit. If you hit, the subject gains 2d4 temporary positive levels (see Positive and Negative Levels). Positive levels stack.

Name: Freedom
Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels) or see text
Description: The subject is freed from spells and effects that restrict movement, including binding, entangle, grappling, imprisonment, maze, paralysis, petrification, pinning, sleep, slow, stunning, temporal stasis, and web. To free a creature from imprisonment or maze, you must know its name and background, and you must cast this spell at the spot where it was entombed or banished into the maze.

Name: Heavenly Host
Description:
This spell is in progress, the angels it summons have yet to be made.


Heavenly Host
	
	Conjuration (Summoning) [Good] 
		Level: White 9
		Components: V, S
		Casting Time: 10 minutes
		Range: Medium (100 ft. + 10 ft./level)
		Effect: Two or more summoned creatures, no two of which are more than 30 ft. apart
		Duration: 10 minutes/level (D)
		Saving Throw: None
		Spell Resistance: No

Name: Holy Exile
Description: With a word, your body gives off an explosion of holy energy, scorching the flesh of those creatures despised by good beings. All evil creatures in the area take 20d6 points of holy damage. A successful Will save reduces this damage by half, creatures with an evil subtype take a -4 penalty on their save against this spell.

Name: Mass Fortify
Target: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: A wave of fortifying magics washes out from you, warding your allies. This spell functions like Fortify, except as noted above. The maximum number of temporary bolstered hit points granted to each creature is 100 at 20th level.

Name: Rain of Gold Lilies
MaterialComponents: A fresh golden lily
Description: Golden lilies fall from the sky. The lilies explode with lawful energy upon striking chaotic creatures, each of which takes 5d6 points of axiomatic damage whenever they begin their turn or pass through Rain of Gold Lilies. In addition, creatures that take damage from Rain of Gold Lilies must make a Fortitude save. Those that fail the Fortitude save are nauseated (unable to attack, cast spells, concentrate on spells, perform any task requiring concentration, or take anything other than a single move action per turn) as long as the creature is in the area and for 1d4+1 rounds after it leaves. A creature that exits the spell’s area and enters again must begin making Fortitude saves against the nausea effect again.

Name: Rain of White Roses
MaterialComponents: A fresh white rose
Description: White roses fall from the sky. The roses explode with holy energy upon striking evil creatures, each of which takes 5d6 points of holy damage whenever they begin their turn or pass through Rain of White Roses. In addition, creatures that take damage from Rain of White Roses must make a Fortitude save. Those that fail the Fortitude save are nauseated (unable to attack, cast spells, concentrate on spells, perform any task requiring concentration, or take anything other than a single move action per turn)  as long as the creature is in the area and for 1d4+1 rounds after it leaves. A creature that exits the spell’s area and enters again must begin making Fortitude saves against the nausea effect again.

Name: Righteous Exile
Description: With a word, your body gives off an explosion of axiomatic energy, scorching the flesh of those creatures despised by lawful beings. All chaotic creatures in the area take 20d6 points of axiomatic damage. A successful Will save reduces this damage by half, creatures with a chaotic subtype take a -4 penalty on their save against this spell.

Name: Breeze
MaterialComponents: A miniature fan
Description: You create a light wind that blows against the target, from a direction of your choice. The breeze grants the subject a +2 resistance bonus on saves against very hot conditions, severe heat, and saves against cloud vapors and gases (such as cloudkill, stinking cloud, and inhaled poisons). This spell does not function without air or underwater.

Name: Create Water
Description: This spell generates wholesome, drinkable water, just like clean rain water. Water can be created in an area as small as will actually contain the liquid, or in an area three times as large — possibly creating a downpour or filling many small receptacles. This water disappears after 1 day if not consumed.

Name: Drench
Target: One creature or object of size Large or smaller
Description: A sudden downpour soaks the target creature or object. The rain follows the subject up to the range of the spell, soaking the target with water. If the target is on fire, non-magical flames are automatically extinguished and it grants the target an immediate saving throw against any magical flames (as the normal saving throw of those flames). Non-magical smaller than campfires (such as lanterns and torches) are automatically extinguished by this spell.

Name: Minor Disguise
Description: Your fingertips glow blue, and you add a few details to enhance your disguise.

Name: Ray of Frost
Description: A ray of freezing air and ice projects from your pointing finger. You must succeed on a ranged touch attack with the ray to deal damage to a target. The ray deals 1d3 points of cold damage.

Name: Read Magic
Focus: A clear crystal or mineral prism
Description: You can decipher magical inscriptions on objects – books, scrolls, weapons, and the like – that would otherwise be unintelligible. This deciphering does not normally invoke the magic contained in the writing, although it may do so in the case of a cursed or trapped scroll. Furthermore, once the spell is cast and you have read the magical inscription, you are thereafter able to read that particular writing without recourse to the use of read magic. You can read at the rate of one page (250 words) per minute. The spell allows you to recognize a glyph of warding with a DC 13 Spellcraft check, a greater glyph of warding with a DC 16 Spellcraft check, or any symbol spell with a Spellcraft check (DC 10 + spell level).

Name: Alter Winds
Description:
You subtly enhance or diminish the effects of natural winds within the spell’s area, which is an immobile emanation around a point touched by you as the spell is cast. Within the area, natural (but not magical) wind effects are either increased or decreased by one step in intensity. The maximum wind force you can affect with this spell is based on your caster level, as shown on the table below. Alter winds has no effect on magical wind effects.


	
		
			Caster Level
			Wind Force
		
		
			1st-3rd
			Light
		
		
			4th-9th
			Moderate
		
		
			10th-15th
			Strong
		
		
			16th or higher
			Severe

Name: Aqua Lung
Description: You let out a quick cry and instantly feel your chest swell with water, as if you had taken a deep breath while underwater. Strangely, you feel no need to exhale.

Name: Arcane Sensitivity
Description: With a touch, you instantly determine if a creature has any spellcasting or spell-like abilities and the strength of the most powerful spell or spell-like ability the creature currently has available for use.

Name: Beguiling Gift
Description: You offer an object to an adjacent creature, and entice it into using or consuming the proffered item. If the target fails its Will save, it immediately takes the offered object, dropping an already held object if necessary. On its next turn, it consumes or dons the object, as appropriate for the item in question. For example, an apple would be eaten, a potion consumed, a ring put on a finger, and a sword wielded in a free hand. If the target is physically unable to accept the object, the spell fails. The subject is under no obligation to continue consuming or using the item once the spell’s duration has expired, although it may find a cursed item difficult to be rid of.

Name: Benign Transposition
Target: S: Two willing creatures of up to Large size
Description: Two target creatures, of which you can be one, instantly swap positions. Both subjects must be within range. Objects carried by the creatures (up to the creature’s maximum loads) go with them, but other creatures do not, even if they are carried. The movement is instantaneous and does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

Name: Blend with Surroundings
MaterialComponents: A chess piece
SavingThrow: Fort negates (harmless) or Will disbelieves (if interacted with)
Description: This spell changes the appearance of the affected creature so that it better blends in with its surroundings. As chosen by you, the affected creature takes on the appearance of a statue, furniture, a tree, a bush, a rock, or another object of similar size.

Name: Blurred Steps
Description: This spell functions as  blur, except that the blurring occurs only when you move at least 10 feet on your turn and ceases at the end of your movement. It is therefore mainly used to protect against attacks on your turn, such as attacks of opportunity. If you move at least twice your speed on your turn, the blurring lasts until the start of your next turn.

Name: Buoyant Lifting
Target: One Medium or smaller object or creature/level, no two of which can be more than 20 ft. apart
Description: With a sharp jab of your finger, the water around your indicated subjects begins to push them toward the surface.

Name: Charm Person
Description: This charm makes a humanoid creature regard you as its trusted friend and ally (treat the target’s attitude as friendly). If the creature is currently being threatened or attacked by you or your allies, however, it receives a +5 bonus on its saving throw.

Name: Command
Description:
You give the subject a single command, which it obeys to the best of its ability at its earliest opportunity. You may select from the following options.


	
	Approach: On its turn, the subject moves toward you as quickly and directly as possible for 1 round. The creature may do nothing but move during its turn, and it provokes attacks of opportunity for this movement as normal.
	


	
	Drop: On its turn, the subject drops whatever it is holding. It can’t pick up any dropped item until its next turn.
	


	
	Fall: On its turn, the subject falls to the ground and remains prone for 1 round. It may act normally while prone but takes any appropriate penalties.
	


	
	Flee: On its turn, the subject moves away from you as quickly as possible for 1 round. It may do nothing but move during its turn, and it provokes attacks of opportunity for this movement as normal.
	


	
	Halt: The subject stands in place for 1 round. It may not take any actions but is not considered helpless.

Name: Dancing Lantern
Description: You can animate a lantern and order it to follow you. The lantern floats at shoulder height and remains within 5 feet of you, no matter how fast you move, although you can command it to set down (acting like a normal lantern until you command it to dance again). The lantern cannot support any additional weight beyond holding a the normal candle or oil reservoir it would contain. The lantern illuminates its normal area so long as it is lit, though many casters make use of the Light or Candlelight spells if they do not wish to use oil. For the purposes of spells or effects targeting it, the lantern always acts as if in your possession even when not directly on your person so long as it is dancing.

Name: Decrepit Disguise
Target: One touched object of no more than 1 cu. ft./level
SavingThrow: None (object) or Will disbelief (if interacted with)
Description: You make an object seem like a worthless version of itself. A masterwork or magic sword could seem to be a useless, rusting, discarded blade, and a luxurious throne could appear to be a decrepit wooden chair. If used against an attended object, the wielder can immediately attempt a Will save to disbelieve the effect. Decrepit disguise counters and dispels quintessence.

Name: Deep Breath
Description: You let out a quick cry and instantly feel your chest swell with air, as if you had taken a deep breath. Strangely, you feel no need to exhale.

Name: Detect Cold
Focus: A lense of frost agate worth 10 gp
Description: You can sense the presence of ice and chill. The amount of information revealed depends on how long you study a particular area or subject.

Name: Disguise Self
Description: You make yourself – including clothing, armor, weapons, and equipment – look different. You can seem 1 foot shorter or taller, thin, fat, or in between. You cannot change your creature type (although you can appear as another subtype). Otherwise, the extent of the apparent change is up to you. You could add or obscure a minor feature or look like an entirely different person or gender.

Name: Disguise Weapon
Description: You make one manufactured weapon look like a different manufactured weapon of the same size and relative encumbrance (light, one-handed, or two-handed). For example, you could make a Small greatsword look like a Small quarterstaff, a Medium club, or a Large dagger. Even the appearance of an improvised weapon is possible. The extent of the apparent change is up to you. You could add or obscure a minor feature or make the item look like it is composed of different materials (stone, wood, adamantine, and so on). The spell does not provide any of the abilities of the chosen form, nor does it alter the perceived tactile or audible properties of the item or how it is wielded. A creature that interacts with the glamer may attempt a Will save to recognize it as an illusion.

Name: Endure Cold
Description: A creature protected by endure cold suffers no harm from being in a cold environment. The target is treated as if it had Cold Resistance 10 for the purposes of determining its level of protection against cold environments. This means that the creature can typically exist comfortably in conditions as cold as 11 degrees Fahrenheit without having to make Fortitude saves.

Name: Familiar Pocket
MaterialComponents: A tiny golden needle and a strip of fine cloth given a half twist and fastened at the ends.
Target: One container or garment with a pocket touched
Description: You move your hand along the mouth of a pocket intended for your familiar, and a line of glowing white energy follows in its wake. The glow fades, and the space seems strangely larger inside than a normal pocket.

Name: Feather Fall
Target: S: One Medium or smaller free-falling object or creature/level, no two of which may be more than 20 ft. apart
Description: The affected creatures or objects fall slowly. Feather fall instantly changes the rate at which the targets fall to a mere 60 feet per round (equivalent to the end of a fall from a few feet), and the subjects take no damage upon landing while the spell is in effect. When the spell duration expires, a normal rate of falling resumes.

Name: Floating Disk
MaterialComponents: A drop of mercury
Description: You create a slightly concave, circular plane of force that follows you about and carries loads for you. The disk is 3 feet in diameter and 1 inch deep at its center. It can hold 100 pounds of weight per caster level. If used to transport a liquid, its capacity is 2 gallons. The disk floats approximately 3 feet above the ground at all times and remains level. It floats along horizontally within spell range and will accompany you at a rate of no more than your normal speed each round. If not otherwise directed, it maintains a constant interval of 5 feet between itself and you. The disk winks out of existence when the spell duration expires. The disk also winks out if you move beyond its range or try to take the disk more than 3 feet away from the surface beneath it. When the disk winks out, whatever it was supporting falls to the surface beneath it.

Name: Forbid Action
Description:
You forbid the target a single course of action, which it avoids to the best of its ability. You may demand the target not take actions that fall into one of the following options.


	
	Attack: The target cannot take any action that involves an attack roll, or uses a spell or ability that targets a foe or an area that includes a foe.
	


	
	Cast: Target cannot cast spells or use spell-like abilities.
	


	
	Communicate: The target cannot take any actions that allow it to communicate with anyone. This includes such acts as speaking, Bluff checks to pass secret messages, writing, and using telepathy. It does not prevent verbalizations made for purposes other than communication, such as command words or the verbal component of spellcasting.
	


	
	Draw: Target cannot ready or prepare any item, weapon, component, or equipment.
	


	
	Move: The target can take no act that would cause it to end up in a different location. The target does not resist being moved by others (and thus can be picked up or dragged, or can float along on a raft), but does not consciously attempt to move (including not directing a mount to move).

Name: Freezing Disarm
Target: Held metal item of one creature or 15 lbs. of unattended metal
Description: This spell causes a metal object to instantly become freezing cold. A creature holding the item may attempt a Reflex save to drop it and take no damage (even if it is not their turn), otherwise the freezing metal deals 1d4 points of cold damage per caster level (maximum 5d4) to them. Circumstances that prevent the creature from dropping the item (such as a locked gauntlet) mean the creature gets no saving throw. The cold does not harm the item, and it does not get cold enough or last long enough to freeze objects. The item warms to its previous temperature almost instantly. If cast underwater, freezing disarm deals half damage and chills the surrounding water.

Name: Freezing Hands
Description: Any creature in the area of the ice shards takes 1d4 points of cold damage per caster level (maximum 5d4).

Name: Frigid Grasp
Description: Your successful melee touch attack deals 1d6 points of cold damage per caster level (maximum 5d6).

Name: Frostbite
Description: Your melee touch attack deals 1d6 points of nonlethal cold damage plus 1 point per level (maximum +5), and the target is fatigued. The fatigued condition ends when the target recovers from the nonlethal damage. This spell cannot make a creature exhausted even if it is already fatigued. You can deliver this melee touch attack up to one time per level, at which point this spell ends.

Name: Fumbletongue
Description: This enchantment causes a creature to be unable to speak intelligibly. Any effort the target makes to talk, in any language, comes out as a useless mix of unconnected words and noises. Even magic words are affected to some extent; the target has a 20% spell failure chance for any spell it attempts to cast with verbal components, and a 20% chance to incorrectly use a command word to activate a magic item. This spell has no effect on telepathic communication, or the vocalizations of creatures that lack a spoken language.

Name: Hydraulic Push
Description: You call forth a quick blast of water that knocks back and soaks one creature or square. You can use this blast of water to make a bull rush against any one creature or object. Your CMB for this bull rush is equal to your caster level plus your Intelligence modifier. This bull rush does not provoke an attack of opportunity. Hydraulic push extinguishes any normal fires on a creature, object, or in a single 5-foot square which it is targeted against. Magical fires are unaffected.

Name: Hydraulic Slam
Description: You surround your hand with a torrent of water that knocks over and soaks one creature or object. Your successful touch attack deals 1d6 points of bludgeoning damage  per 2 caster levels (minimum 1d6, maximum 3d6) and initiates a bull rush against the struck creature or object. Your CMB for this bull rush is equal to your caster level plus your Intelligence. This bull rush does not provoke an attack of opportunity.

Name: Hypnotism
Description: Your gestures and droning incantation fascinate nearby creatures, causing them to stop and stare blankly at you. In addition, you can use their rapt attention to make your suggestions and requests seem more plausible. Roll 2d4 to see how many total HD of creatures you affect. Creatures with fewer HD are affected before creatures with more HD. Only creatures that can see or hear you are affected, but they do not need to understand you to be fascinated.

Name: Ice Armor
MaterialComponents: 5 gallons of water
Description: You create a breastplate made of ice. While cold to the touch, it does not harm the wearer, especially if worn over normal clothing (though it can hasten the effects of exposure in cold environments). It offers the same protection as a breastplate (and in all ways counts as a breastplate), except it has hardness 0 and 30 hit points. If the intended wearer is immersed in water when you cast this spell, you may form the armor around the wearer (who may be you); otherwise the wearer must don the armor normally. Attacks against the wearer that create heat or fire degrade the armor, reducing its armor bonus by 1 for every 5 points of fire damage the wearer takes; when the armor’s bonus to AC reaches 0, the armor is destroyed and the spell ends. Because the ice is slightly buoyant, the wearer gains a +2 circumstance bonus on Swim checks, except when swimming downward.

Name: Ice Gauntlet
Description: Bristling rock-hard ice spikes surround your fist, a cold mist enshrouding your forearm.

Name: Ice Slick
Focus: A tiny cube of frost agate
Description: An ice slick spell covers a solid surface with a layer of slippery ice. Any creature in the area when the spell is cast must make a successful Reflex save or fall. A creature can walk within or through the area of ice at half normal speed with a DC 10 Acrobatics check. Failure means it can’t move that round (and must then make a Reflex save or fall), while failure by 5 or more means it falls (see the Acrobatics skill for details). Creatures that do not move on their turn do not need to make this check and are not considered flat-footed.

Name: Icespike
Duration: Until the end of your next turn.
Description: When you cast this spell, frigid air ripples around your weapons, ready to strike out.

Name: Icicle Dagger
Description: You create a masterwork dagger out of ice. The dagger deals 1 point of cold damage in addition to normal dagger damage, but cannot bear its wielders weapon enchantment bonuses. If the dagger leaves your hand for more than 1 round, it melts and the spell ends. At 6th level, the dagger functions as a +1 frost dagger. At 11th level, it gains the returning property when thrown, melting away and reforming in your hand just before your next turn.

Name: Identify
MaterialComponents: Wine stirred with an owl’s feather
Description: This spell functions as detect magic, except that it gives you a +10 enhancement bonus on Spellcraft checks made to identify the properties and command words of magic items in your possession. This spell does not allow you to identify artifacts.

Name: Instant Diversion
Description: As you spin around, you produce residual images of yourself, each of which splits off from your body and moves away.

Name: Instant Locksmith
Description: You can make one Disable Device check or one Open Lock check in this round as a free action and you gain a +2 insight bonus on the check. If the check takes more than 1 round, this spell merely replaces the round’s actions with the action to cast this spell and you do not gain the insight bonus on the check.

Name: Instant Search
Description: You can make one Perception check to Search check in this round as a free action. You gain a +2 insight bonus on the check.

Name: Kreighton's Perusal
Description: You gain a brief understanding of one book’s topics. This insight is not sufficient to translate unknown languages, decipher codes, or memorize text, it merely allow the caster to learn what topics the book discusses –  invaluable to a magus performing research or to a task mage deciding whether or not to abscond with a volume. If deciphering the topics of a tome would be particularly difficult for some reason (such as a particularly dense volume), Kreighton’s Perusal grants you knowledge of it’s topics equivalent to having skimmed its pages for 1 hour.

Name: Lesser Orb of Cold
Description: Your hand takes on a blue tint and your fingers turn numb and unresponsive as you complete the spell. From your chilled palm flies an orb composed of blue ice.

Name: Locksight
MaterialComponents: A small key
Description: You can observe for 1 full round a lock that you are aware of (or object that includes a lock, such as a chest or door) that is within 60 feet to automatically determine whether it is open, closed, or jammed.

Name: Lullaby
Target: S: Living creatures within a 10-ft.-radius emanation
Description: Any creature within the area that fails a Will save becomes drowsy and inattentive, taking a -5 penalty on Perception checks and a -2 penalty on Will saves against sleep effects while the lullaby is in effect. Lullaby lasts for as long as the caster concentrates, plus up to 1 round per caster level thereafter. A creature that saves against lullaby is immune to that casting.

Name: Magic Aura
Focus: A small square of silk that must be passed over the object that receives the aura
Target: One touched object weighing up to 5 lbs./level
Description: You alter an item’s aura so that it registers to detect spells (and spells with similar capabilities) as though it were non-magical, or a magic item of a kind you specify, or the subject of a spell you specify. If the object bearing magic aura has identify cast on it or is similarly examined, the examiner recognizes that the aura is false and detects the object’s actual qualities if he succeeds on a Will save. Otherwise, he believes the aura and no amount of testing reveals what the true magic is.

Name: Mask Dweomer
MaterialComponents: A piece of gauze
Description: You mask and manipulate a spell’s magic aura to make it harder to detect. Select one spell effect on the target creature or object. You must have either cast this spell yourself or have perceived it by means of  detect magic or  arcane sight.

Name: Quickswim
MaterialComponents: A scale from any fish
Description: This spell increases your swim speed by 10 feet; this adjustment counts as an enhancement bonus. It has no effect on other modes of movement, such as land speed, burrow, climb, or fly. If you do not have a swim speed, you gain no benefit from this spell.

Name: Quintessence
Target: One touched object of no more than 1 cu. ft./level
SavingThrow: None (object) or Will disbelief (if interacted with)
Description: You make an object seem like an idealized version of itself. A useless, rusting sword could seem to be a masterwork or magic blade, and a decrepit wooden chair could appear to be a luxurious throne. If used against an attended object, the wielder can immediately attempt a Will save to disbelieve the effect. Quintessence counters and dispels decrepit disguise.

Name: Secret Signs
Target: One creature with an intelligence of 10 or higher
Description: Using nonverbal means, you can communicate a simple message to one other intelligent creature within range. By simply waving a hand, placing a scroll on a table, raising an eyebrow, or making any other sign, the spell allows the target to understand any complete thought of twenty-five words or less, so long as you and the target could normally communicate. You can’t send a verbal message if you don’t speak the target’s language, but can transmit a simple emotional appeal (such as “help” or “danger”) that the recipient knows is from you. You can use this spell even if you are bound and gagged, so long as the focus is on your person (even if not in hand).

Name: Silent Image
Description: This spell creates the visual illusion of an object, creature, or force, as visualized by you. The illusion does not create sound, smell, texture, or temperature. You can move the image within the limits of the size of the effect.

Name: Sleep
MaterialComponents: Fine Sand, Rose Petals, or a Live Cricket
Description: A sleep spell causes a magical slumber to come upon 4 HD of creatures. Creatures with the fewest HD are affected first. Among creatures with equal HD, those who are closest to the spell’s point of origin are affected first. HD that are not sufficient to affect a creature are wasted. Sleeping creatures are helpless. Slapping or wounding awakens an affected creature, but normal noise does not. Awakening a creature is a standard action (an application of the aid another action). Sleep does not target unconscious creatures, constructs, or undead creatures.

Name: Snowshoes
Description: A chill grips you as you complete the spell and touch your intended subject. The feet of the spell’s subject glow with an ice-blue radiance that fades but lingers. The creature rises slightly out of the snow, as if it weighed much less.

Name: Stand
Description: With a swift upward gesture of your arms and a single clarion command (“Stand!”), you safely teleport the prone creature to their feet. The subject creature is immediately standing, without provoking attacks of opportunity.

Name: Touch of the Sea
MaterialComponents: A fish scale
Description: You cause webs to grow between the target’s fingers and its feet to transform into flippers, granting a swim speed of 30 feet along with the standard +8 bonus on Swim checks and the ability to take 10 even if distracted or endangered. You can also use the run action while swimming, provided you swim in a straight line. This transformation causes any boots or gloves the target is wearing to meld into its form (although magic items with a continuous effect continue to function). This spell does not grant the target any ability to breathe water.

Name: Unseen Servant
MaterialComponents: A piece of string and a bit of wood
Description: An unseen servant is an invisible, mindless, shapeless force that performs simple tasks at your command. It can run and fetch things, open unstuck doors, and hold chairs, as well as clean and mend. The servant can perform only one activity at a time, but it repeats the same activity over and over again if told to do so as long as you remain within range. It can open only normal doors, drawers, lids, and the like. It has an effective Strength score of 2 (so it can lift 20 pounds or drag 100 pounds). It can trigger traps and such, but it can exert only 20 pounds of force, which is not enough to activate certain pressure plates and other devices. It can’t perform any task that requires a skill check with a DC higher than 10 or that requires a check using a skill that can’t be used untrained. This servant cannot fly, climb, or even swim (though it can walk on water). Its base speed is 15 feet.

Name: Updraft
MaterialComponents: A miniature propeller or windmill
Description: Detritus and loose debris on the ground beneath you begins to spin about, caught in a small vortex. The vortex quickly coalesces into a column of air thick enough to hold you aloft.

Name: Vacuous Vessel
Description: This spell makes a single bag, chest, sack, or other container look and feel empty. The container must be no larger than 1 cubic foot per caster level or the spell fails. Anyone holding,  peering into, or reaching into the container must succeed at a Will save or perceive the container as being completely empty. All items within the container when the spell was cast are still present, but they can’t be noticed unless removed from the bag – such as by someone who can perceive them, or who upends the container.

Name: Ventriloquism
Description: You can make your voice (or any sound that you can normally make vocally) seem to issue from someplace else. You can speak in any language you know. With respect to such voices and sounds, anyone who hears the sound and rolls a successful save recognizes it as illusory (but still hears it).

Name: Whelm
Description: You thrust one arm forward toward your foe, palm open and fingers splayed. The creature reels as an invisible surge of power invades its mind.

Name: Windy Escape
Description: You respond to an attack by briefly becoming vaporous and insubstantial, allowing the attack to pass harmlessly through you. You gain DR 10/magic against this attack and are immune to any poison, sneak attacks, or critical hit effect from that attack.

Name: Wings of Bounding
Description: Immense, partially translucent wings unfurl from behind you for an instant just before you jump, helping you achieve incredible distance or height.

Name: Aboleth's Lung
Description: The targets are able to breathe water, freely. However, they can no longer breathe air. Divide the duration evenly among all the creatures you touch. This spell has no effect on creatures that can already breathe water.

Name: Action Before Thought
Description: You analyze the explosion coming towards you, moving just so to perfectly slip past the worst of it..

Name: Augury
MaterialComponents: Incense worth at least 25 gp
Focus: A set of marked sticks or bones worth at least 25 gp
Description: An augury can tell you whether a particular action will bring good or bad results for you in the immediate future.

Name: Baleful Transposition
Target: S: Two creatures of up to Large size
Description: Seeing your friend imperiled, you cast about for a likely target and settle upon a nearby foe. With a word, your ally stands free while your foe faces death.

Name: Belker Claws
MaterialComponents: A small vial of smoke
Description: You uncork the vial and speak the old words. The smoke issues from the bottle and wraps itself around your hand, cutting sharp like glass, then lashes out.

Name: Binding Winds
Description: Calling upon the power of elemental air, you encircle the target in whipping winds.

Name: Bladeweave
Description: With a shout you unleash the power of the spell, causing every movement you make with your weapon to seem beautiful and full of flourish.

Name: Blur
Description: The subject’s outline appears blurred, shifting, and wavering. This distortion grants the subject concealment (20% miss chance).

Name: Chill Metal
Focus: Cold Iron carved with a symbol of a glacier
Target: Metal equipment of one creature per two levels, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart; or 25 lbs. of metal/level, none of which can be more than 30 ft. away from any of the rest
Description: Chill metal makes metal extremely cold.

Name: Communal Mask Dweomer
MaterialComponents: A piece of gauze
Description: This spell functions like  mask dweomer, except you divide the duration in 1-day increments among the creatures or objects touched.

Name: Communal Water Walk
Description: This spell functions like Water Walk, except you divide the duration in 10-minute intervals among the creatures touched.

Name: Detect Thoughts
Description:
You detect surface thoughts. The amount of information revealed depends on how long you study a particular area or subject.


	
	1st Round: Presence or absence of thoughts (from conscious creatures with Intelligence scores of 1 or higher).
	


	
	2nd Round: Number of thinking minds and the Intelligence score of each. If the highest Intelligence is 26 or higher (and at least 10 points higher than your own Intelligence score), you are stunned for 1 round and the spell ends. This spell does not let you determine the location of the thinking minds if you can’t see the creatures whose thoughts you are detecting.
	


	
	3rd Round: Surface thoughts of any mind in the area. A target’s Will save prevents you from reading its thoughts, and you must cast detect thoughts again to have another chance. Creatures of animal intelligence (Int 1 or 2) have simple, instinctual thoughts.

Name: Dimension Hop
Description: Pale motes of blue light dance and swirl about your fingertips.

Name: Dimension Leap
Description: You instantly transfer yourself from your current location to another spot within range. You always arrive at exactly the spot desired, whether by simply visualizing the area or by stating direction and distance. You can bring along any objects you are carrying as the spell is cast, so long as their weight doesn’t exceed your maximum load. You cannot bring along other creatures other than your familiar.

Name: Discern Next of Kin
Description: You can scan the thoughts of one individual and learn the names and locations of the target’s living relatives, as well as the attitude of the target toward those relatives (and vice versa). You learn about one relative per round you concentrate on the target. For example, you might learn the target’s father’s name, that the father lives on a nearby farm, and that the target and his father don’t get along. Since this spell reads the target’s mind, you can learn only what the target knows or believes.

Name: Enthrall
Target: Any number of creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: If you have the attention of a group of creatures, you can use this spell to hold them enthralled. To cast the spell, you must speak or sing without interruption for 1 round. Thereafter, those affected give you their undivided attention, ignoring their surroundings. They are considered to have an attitude of friendly while under the effect of the spell. Any potentially affected creature of a race or religion unfriendly to yours gets a +4 bonus on the saving throw.

Name: Find Traps
Description: You gain intuitive insight into the workings of traps. You gain an insight bonus equal to 1/2 your caster level (maximum +10) on Perception checks made to find traps while the spell is in effect. You receive a check to notice traps within 10 feet of you, even if you are not actively searching for them. Note that find traps grants no ability to disable the traps that you may find.

Name: Freezing Sword
Description: You cause a held weapon to become wreathed in freezing air and ice. This ice does not harm the weapon or its wielder, but for the duration of the spell, it delivers cold damage in addition to its normal damage.

Name: Frigid Touch
Description: This spell causes your hand to glow with a pale blue radiance.

Name: Frigid Wake
Description: Frigid winds trail behind the targeted weapon, potentially damaging foes even when the weapon misses.

Name: Frostburn
MaterialComponents: A bit of water or ice
Description: You freeze moisture within the body of a target creature, dealing it 1d6 points of frostburn damage per two caster levels (maximum 5d6) and it is frostbitten. A successful Fortitude save results in half damage and negates the frostbite.

Name: Glide
Description: You take no damage from falls (as if from  feather fall). In addition, you can move up to 5 feet in any horizontal direction for every 1 foot you fall, at a speed of 60 feet per round. You cannot use this spell to actually gain height, merely coast in other directions as you fall. If subjected to a strong wind or any other effect that causes you to rise you can take advantage of it in order to increase the distance you can glide. If the spell expires while you are still in the air you fall the remaining distance as normal.

Name: Gust of Wind
Description:
This spell creates a severe blast of air (approximately 50 mph) that originates from you, affecting all creatures in its path. All flying creatures in this area take a -4 penalty on Fly skill checks. Tiny or smaller flying creatures must make a DC 25 Fly skill check or be blown back 2d6×10 feet and take 2d6 points of damage. Small or smaller flying creatures must make a DC 20 Fly skill check to move against the force of the wind.


	
	A Tiny or smaller creature on the ground is knocked down and rolled 1d4×10 feet, taking 1d4 points of nonlethal damage per 10 feet.
	


	
	Small creatures are knocked prone by the force of the wind.
	


	
	Medium or smaller creatures are unable to move forward against the force of the wind unless they succeed at a DC 15 Strength check.
	


	
	Large or larger creatures may move normally within a gust of wind effect.

Name: Gusting Sphere
Description: A swirling ball of wind rolls in whichever direction you point, hurling those it strikes with great force. The sphere is treated in all ways as an area of severe wind, applying a –4 penalty on ranged weapon attacks that pass through it. The sphere moves 30 feet per round. As part of this movement, it can ascend or jump up to 30 feet to strike a target. If it enters a space containing a Medium or smaller creature, it stops moving for that round and generates a sharp thrust of wind to bull rush the creature. The sphere’s CMB for bull rush combat maneuvers uses your caster level in place of its base attack bonus, with a +2 bonus for its Strength score (14). Whether or not the bull rush is successful, the creature takes 1d6 points of nonlethal bludgeoning damage from the attack. If the bull rush fails, the creature is still subject to the severe winds from the sphere as long as they remain in the same square as it. A gusting sphere rolls over objects or barriers that are less than 4 feet tall.

Name: Heart of Air
Description: You feel light as a feather, as if the slightest breeze might knock you about. This spell converts part of your body into elemental air, freeing you somewhat from the bonds of gravity.

Name: Icicle
MaterialComponents: A chip of frost agate worth 5 gp
Description: You create icicles on a ceiling, doorway, or similar overhang. The icicles fall when a creature walks beneath them, dealing 2d6 points of piercing damage and 2d6 points of cold damage. Anyone directly under the area takes this damage, or half on a successful Reflex save. Others within 5 feet of the icicles take half damage, or none if they succeed on a Reflex saving throw.

Name: Illusory Maze
Description: This spell creates the illusion of a translucent, ever-changing maze of glass in the target area.
