Description: This spell functions like Magic Circle against Evil, except that it is similar to protection from good instead of protection from evil, and it can imprison a non-evil called creature.

Name: Mantle of Evil
Description: You invoke the powers of evil, and a dark, wavering field of unholy energy wraps around you like a cloak.

Name: Nature's Exile
Focus: A vial of bleach or other sterile cleaning agent
Description: This spell curses the creature touched, making it inimical to the natural world. All animals have an initial attitude of hostile toward the target. Familiars, being magical beasts, are not affected by this spell, but animal companions are. If you have an animal companion, it does not become hostile, but as long as you remain cursed, your animal companion takes a -2 penalty on all attack rolls, skill checks, and saving throws. The target also takes a -10 penalty on Survival skill checks as the weather and environment themselves seem to conspire to cause trouble.

Name: Power Word Maladroit
Target: One living creature with 100 hp or less
Description: You speak a word to make your target ungainly and awkward.

Name: Power Word Weaken
Target: One living creature with 100 hp or less
Description: With a word, you sap strength from your target.

Name: Profane Weapon
Description: This transmutation makes a weapon strike true against good foes. The weapon is treated as having a +1 enhancement bonus for the purpose of bypassing the DR of good creatures or striking good incorporeal creatures (though the spell doesn’t grant an actual enhancement bonus). The weapon also becomes evil-aligned, which means it can bypass the DR of certain creatures. (This effect overrides and suppresses any other alignment the weapon might have.) Individual arrows or bolts can be transmuted, but affected projectile weapons (such as bows) don’t confer the benefit to the projectiles they shoot.

Name: Protective Penumbra
Description: This spell keeps you slightly in shadow. If you have light blindness, light sensitivity, or vulnerability to sunlight (such as if you’re a vampire or wraith) you may ignore penalties from those qualities. The spell gives you a +2 bonus on saving throws against nonmagical hazards related to bright light, such as glare or sunburn.

Name: Puzzle Box
Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels) or touch; see text
Target: One creature or one object up to 5 lbs./level
Description: This spell causes even commonly used objects to become conundrums. When cast on a creature, the target loses all weapon and shield proficiencies. The target also forgets how to use all spell-completion, spell-trigger, and use-activated magic items, as well as any mundane items used as part of a skill check, imposing a –5 penalty on all ability and skill checks attempted with such items. These effects last for 1 round per level and are negated with a successful Will saving throw, though opponents take a -2 penalty on this save. As a move action, the target can attempt a skill check to negate the effects of this spell for one object. Weapons, shields, and mundane objects require a successful Craft skill check of the type required to craft the item in question, with a DC equal to the spell’s save DC. Magic items require a successful Spellcraft or Use Magic Device skill check against the spell’s save DC.

Name: Ray of Exhaustion
MaterialComponents: A drop of sweat
Description: A black ray projects from your pointing finger. You must succeed on a ranged touch attack with the ray to strike a target.

Name: Reaper's Coterie
Description: The target weapon becomes a reservoir of spiritual energy, fueling its destructive power by drawing in a tiny fragment of the essence of each creature it is used to defeat.

Name: Rejuvenative Corpse
Target: One humanoid creature that died within the past week
Duration: 24 hours or until discharged; see text
Description: Hunger gnaws at your innards as you complete the spell. Your hands glow with black crackling energy, which discharges into the corpse you touch. For a moment, the corpse glows with a similar blackness before fading.

Name: Shadow Binding
Focus: A few links of an iron chain
Description: As the links of chain in your hand glows black and you feed the arcane energies of your spell, a multitude of ribbonlike shadows instantaneously explodes outward from an indicated point nearby.

Name: Shadow Step
Description: To use this spell, you must be in an area of dim light or darkness. You enter a shadow or area of darkness, which transports you along a coiling path of shadowstuff to another dim or dark location you know of within range. If the location you choose to move to is not in dim light or darkness, the spell fails.

Name: Speak with Dead
Description: You grant the semblance of life to a corpse, allowing it to answer questions. You may ask one question per two caster levels. The corpse’s knowledge is limited to what it knew during life, including the languages it spoke. Answers are brief, cryptic, or repetitive, especially if the creature would have opposed you in life.

Name: Spell Vulnerability
Description: A purple spray springs from your fingertips and wraps around your opponent. It fades into a dull purple glow, which attracts spell energies as opposed to shrugging them off.

Name: Stage Fright
Target: 1 creature/level, no two of which may be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: You fill your targets with the sudden fear of failure. A creature that fails its saving throw takes a –4 penalty on ability checks, skill checks, and any checks that require concentration (such as casting a spell in difficult circumstances or operating a complex device).

Name: Swift Profane Weapon
Description: This spell functions like Profane Weapon, except as noted above.

Name: Symbol of Wounding
MaterialComponents: Mercury and phosphorous, plus powdered diamond and hematite worth a total of 500 gp
Description: When triggered, all creatures within 60 feet of the symbol of wounding are bathed in negative energy and take 2d8 points of negative energy damage plus 1 point of damage per caster level (maximum +15); a Will save reduces this damage by half. Undead and other creatures healed by negative energy instead heal 2d8 points plus 1 point per caster level (maximum +15) A creature can only be healed or harmed by the symbol once in any 24-hour period. Once triggered, the symbol becomes active and glows, lasting for 10 minutes per caster level. A creature that enters the area while the symbol is active is subject to its effect, whether or not that creature was in the area when it was triggered. A creature need save against the symbol only once as long as it remains within the area, though if it leaves the area and returns while the symbol is still active, it must save again.

Name: Unholy Blood
Description: Your innate evil infuses your body with unholy energy. While this energy does not directly empower you, it can harm embodiments of good. Any creature that damages you with a slashing or piercing melee weapon is sprayed by your unholy blood. If the attacker is a creature with the good subtype, it takes 1d6 points of unholy damage each time it successfully hits you. If you have the evil subtype or an ability that grants you an aura of evil (like blackguards or some clerics), your blood instead deals 2d6 points of unholy damage. Creatures that don’t have the good subtype or that are using reach weapons are not subject to this damage.

Name: Unholy Strike
Duration: Until end or turn or until discharged
Description: You imbue your weapon with the power of your touch of corruption ability – costing you one of your daily uses of the ability. Your next successful melee attack made before the end of the turn discharges this energy. If the target would be harmed by your touch of corruption ability, you add the effect of your touch of corruption to the normal effects of the strike. Should you hit someone who would be healed by your touch of corruption ability, the attack deals no damage to them and they benefit as if you had used your touch of corruption ability on them.

Name: Unholy Storm
MaterialComponents: A flask of unholy water worth 25 gp
Description: You call upon the forces of evil, and a heavy rain of dark energy begins to fall in the area you indicate, its raindrops foul and steaming. Below you, dark shadows swim.

Name: Unliving Rage
Target: S: One willing undead creature per 3 levels, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: This spell functions as rage, except it affects only undead creatures and bolsters them with necromantic energy rather than emotion. Each affected creature gains a +2 profane bonus to Strength and Charisma, a +1 profane bonus on Will saves, and a –2 penalty to AC. The effect is otherwise identical to a barbarian’s rage.

Name: Unluck
MaterialComponents: A piece of a broken mirror
Description: Spewing a curse of bad luck, you fling a piece of broken mirror at your target. The mirror shard dissipates harmlessly as soon as it leaves your hand, and the sound of rolling dice is perceptible for an instant.

Name: Vampiric Touch
Target: S: Living creature touched and you (see text)
Description: You must succeed on a melee touch attack. Your touch deals 1d6 points of arcane damage per two caster levels (maximum 10d6). You gain temporary vampiric hit points equal to the damage you deal. You can’t gain more than the subject’s current hit points plus the subject’s maximum negative hit points (which is enough to kill the subject). The temporary hit points disappear when this spell ends, typically 10 minutes after casting. If the temporary hit points are lost, this spell ends.

Name: Wall of Gloom
MaterialComponents: A bit of fleece from a black sheep
Description: Rubbing the fleece between your fingers, you hold up your hand and shout an arcane word. In an instant, a wall of dark shadow appears in the indicated location. Dark whispers, barely perceptible, constantly issue forth from the far side of the wall, causing a cold chill to run up your spine.

Name: Wood Rot Ray
Target: One wooden object or one wooden creature
Description: You unleash a sickly black ray at a wooden object. The air around you smells of mold.

Name: Agonize
Target: One conjured outsider or elemental (see text)
Description: You afflict a creature you have conjured via planar ally (or a similar spell) with bolts of vicious energy. These foul energies inflict terrible pain upon the conjured creature, torturing it to make it more pliant to your will. The targeted creature must make a Fortitude save or take a -1 penalty for every 2 levels you possess (maximum -10) on all saves and checks made against you for the next hour. In addition, creatures that demand payment for their services reduce the payment by 20% for every 4 levels you possess (maximum 60% reduction). However, beings tortured by this spell quickly come to resent you, making them more likely to try to pervert your orders to malicious ends or try to seek retribution after their release. This spell has no effect on creatures that are immune to nonlethal damage.

Name: Animate Dead
Target: S: One or more corpses touched
Description: This spell turns corpses into undead skeletons or zombies that obey your spoken commands.

Name: Aura of Doom
Description: You emanate an almost palpable aura of horror. All creatures (other than you) within this spell’s area, or that later enter the area, are shaken. This condition lasts as long as the creature is in the area and for 1 round after it leaves. A successful Will save negates the shakened condition. Any creature that succeeds on its save but remains in the area must continue to save each round on your turn. As with all magics, this spell can not push someone beyond shakened.

Name: Aura of Greater Cowardice
Description: When you cast this spell you strengthen your blackguard’s Aura of Cowardice. Until the end of its duration, the radius of the aura is increased to 20 ft and all enemies within that aura take a -8 morale penalty on saves against fear effects. If you do not have the aura of cowardice class feature, aura of greater cowardice has no effect.

Name: Bestow Curse
Description:
You place a curse on the subject. Choose one of the following.


	
	-6 decrease to an ability score (minimum 1).
		-4 penalty on attack rolls, saves, ability checks, and skill checks.
		Each turn, the target has a 50% chance to act normally; otherwise, it takes no action.

Name: Bite the Hand
Target: One creature summoned by a spell or spell-like ability
Description: With a short command and a wave of the hand, you compel the target creature to attack the being who summoned it, to the best of its ability. If the being who summoned it is not present, the creature acts normally according to its last task or instructions. This spell has no effect on called creatures, summoned creatures not brought forth by spells or spell-like abilities (such as a summoner’s eidolon), or bonded creatures not explicitly summoned, such as a paladin’s mount or wizard’s familiar.

Name: Clutch of Orcus
Description: Reaching out a hand twisted by tension into a grasping claw, you squeeze your foe’s heart from afar, anticipating the moment its smoking remains will rest in your palm.

Name: Consumptive Field
Description: Sweeping your arm about and clutching it to your chest, you draw the last breaths of fallen foes from their choking mouths and inhale them to fuel your own power.

Name: Contagion
Description: The subjects contract one of the following diseases: blinding sickness, bubonic plague, cackle fever, filth fever, leprosy, mindfire, red ache, shakes, or slimy doom. The disease is contracted immediately (the onset period does not apply, no save is allowed to prevent this contraction). Use the disease’s listed frequency and save DC to determine further effects, , the disease ending after the cure condition for the particular disease has been met. For more information see Diseases .

Name: Corpse Hammer
MaterialComponents: A leather glove coated in dried embalming herbs
Description: When you cast this spell, you draw the remains of nearby destroyed undead together and fuse them into a mass of flesh and bone you can then hurl at any foes within range.

Name: Corrupter's Edge
MaterialComponents: Dried blood from a good outsider, sprinkled on the weapon
Description: When you cast this spell on a melee weapon you imbue it with a powerful evil energy, granting the weapon the Bane weapon quality against good outsiders. Furthermore, whenever you score a successful critical hit against an outsider with the good subtype, you not only deal normal critical damage with the weapon but also nauseate the outsider for 1d3 rounds—the outsider can reduce this nauseated condition to sickened for 1 round with a successful Fortitude save.

Name: Cruel Feeding
MaterialComponents: A hair and three teeth
Duration: Concentration, to a maximum of 1 round/level
Description: A shadowy tentacle ending in multiple fanged maws springs forth from your hand.

Name: Crushing Despair
Target: S: One living creature/level, no two of which may be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: This spell causes great sadness in the subjects. Each affected creature takes a -2 penalty on attack rolls, saving throws, ability checks, skill checks, and weapon damage rolls.

Name: Curse of Magic Negation
MaterialComponents: Powdered lead and platinum worth 250 gp
Description: You disrupt the target creature’s ability to draw upon magical energies. For the duration of the spell, it gains the negated spellblight. Dispel checks to remove the spellblight take a –5 penalty due to this spell’s interference with magical energies.

Name: Culling Blade
Focus: A miniature black onyx sword worth 100 gp
Description: Swinging a miniature replica of a sword as if it were real, you bring into being a full-sized representation of your replica made entirely of dark necromantic energy.

Name: Damning Darkness
Description: The object touched sheds darkness as a Deeper Darkness spell. In addition, every good-aligned creature within the area of darkness (a 60-foot radius) takes 2d6 points of Unholy damage per turn. If the creature has spell resistance, the spell must overcome it to deal damage.

Name: Ellira's Shadow
Description: You channel the darkness of Ellira the Voracious into two or more black rays of negative energy that heal the undead and harm the living. You may fire two rays, plus one additional ray for every four levels beyond 7th (so three rays at 11th level and a maximum four rays at 15th level). Each ray requires a ranged touch attack to hit. Any undead or other creature fueled by negative energy struck by a ray heals 2d6 points of damage. Any living creature struck by a ray takes 2d6 points of negative energy damage, though may make a Will save to take half damage. The rays may be fired at the same or different targets, but all rays must be aimed at targets within 30 feet of each other and fired simultaneously.

Name: Enervation
Description: You point your finger and fire a black ray of negative energy that suppresses the life force of any creature healed by positive energy that it strikes. You must make a ranged touch attack to hit. If you hit, the subject gains 1d4 temporary negative levels (see Positive and Negative Levels). Negative levels stack.

Name: Eyes of the Void
MaterialComponents: A pinch of dried carrot or an agate
Description: You gain darkvision, the ability to see 60 feet even in total darkness, including that created by Deeper Darkness. Darkvision is black-and-white only, but otherwise like normal sight. While affected, your eyes turn completely black (but appear white to anyone viewing you with darkvision).

Name: Familiar Melding
Duration: 1 hour/level or until you return to your body
Description: You project your soul into your familiar, taking over its body while leaving its consciousness intact. When you transfer your soul upon casting, your body is, as near as anyone can tell, dead.

Name: Fear
MaterialComponents: The heart of a hen or a white feather
Description: An invisible cone of terror causes each living creature in the area to become panicked unless it succeeds on a Will save. If cornered, a panicked creature begins cowering. If the Will save succeeds, the creature is shaken for 1 round.

Name: Fleshworm Infestation
Description: With a touch, you cause an infestation of ravenous worms to manifest in the target’s flesh. The target must make a Fortitude save every round. Failure means it takes 1d6 hit points of damage and 2 points of Dexterity damage, and is staggered for 1 round. If it makes the save, it takes no hit point or Dexterity damage and is only sickened for 1 round rather than staggered. Fleshworm infestation cannot be ended early by Remove Disease or Heal, as the infestation starts anew if the current worms are slain. Protection from Evil negates this spell’s effects for as long as the two durations overlap. Dispel Evil automatically ends a fleshworm infestation.

Name: Gloomblind Bolts
Description: You create one or more bolts of cutting shadow. You can fire one bolt, plus one for every four levels beyond 5th (to a maximum of three bolts at 13th level) at the same or different targets, but all bolts must be aimed at targets within 30 feet of each other and require a ranged touch attack to hit. Each bolt deals 4d6 points of shadow damage. Furthermore, the shadow spreads over the skin of creature, possibly blinding it for a short time. Any creature struck by a bolt must succeed at a Reflex saving throw or become blinded for 1 round.

Name: Grave Restoration
MaterialComponents: Jet dust worth 100 gp or 1,000 gp, see text
Description: This spell functions like Lesser Grave Restoration, except that it also dispels temporary positive levels or one permanent positive level. If this spell is used to dispel a permanent positive level, it requires a material component worth 1,000 gp. This spell cannot be used to dispel more than one permanent positive level possessed by a target in a 1-week period.

Name: Greater Darkvision
MaterialComponents: Either a pinch of dried carrot or an agate
Description: This spell functions as darkvision, except the target’s darkvision has a range of 120 feet.

Name: Greater Infernal Healing
MaterialComponents: 1 dose of unholy water mixed with 1 vial of demon’s blood
Description: You anoint a wounded creature with the mixed demon’s blood and unholy water, giving it fast healing 4. This ability cannot repair damage caused by silver weapons, good-aligned weapons, or spells or effects with the good descriptor. The target detects as an evil cleric (in addition to their normal alignments) for the duration of the spell and can sense the evil of the magic.

Name: Inflict Critical Wounds
Description: This spell functions like Inflict Light Wounds , except that you deal 4d8 points of damage plus 1 point per caster level (maximum +20).

Name: Junglerazer
MaterialComponents: A pinch of ash from a burnt plant
Description: Invisible destructive energy springs silently forth from you, instantly destroying all natural plant life in the area and leaving a path of ash in its wake. Fey, vermin, plants and plant creatures, and animals caught in the area take 1d10 points of negative energy damage per caster level (maximum 10d10).

Name: Lesser Object Possession
Description: This spell functions as Possession, except you possess an object instead of a creature.

Name: Mind Strike
Description: Your next melee attack (if made before the end of the next round) lashes out at your opponent’s mind, dark purple energy sapping away their wits. If the attack is successful, it deals an additional 1d4 points of Wisdom damage. Spell resistance applies to this effect.

Name: Profane Arrow
Focus: The arrow or bolt to be fired
Duration: Until end or turn or until discharged
Description: You imbue a single arrow or bolt with the power of your touch of corruption ability – costing you one of your daily uses of the ability. When this imbued projectile hits a target it discharges this energy. If the target would be harmed by your touch of corruption ability, you add the effect of your touch of corruption to the normal effects of the projectile. Should you hit someone who would be healed by your touch of corruption ability, the projectile deals no damage to them and they benefit as if you had used your touch of corruption ability on them. The arrow or bolt must be fired during the same round the spell is cast, or the magic dissipates and is lost. The projectile is destroyed even if it misses its target.

Name: Retributive Reparations
Duration: 1 day/level or until triggered, and permanent; see text
SavingThrow: Will negates (object) and Will negates; see text
Description: If a creature successfully takes the item targeted by this spell while you are holding, wearing, or wielding it, the creature must attempt a Will save. If the creature fails its save, it becomes fatigued, and it must attempt a new saving throw at the end of its turn every round it does not return the item to you. Failing a second saving throw causes the target to become exhausted. As long as the victim of the curse is actively working to return the object, its exhaustion is reduced to fatigue. The fatigue and exhaustion cannot be removed by effects that normally remove them, though immunity to fatigue and exhaustion protect against the conditions as normal.

Name: Riding Possession
Description: You stealthily project your soul into the host’s body as an observer, with limited ability to influence the target. This functions as possession, except the host is still in full control of its body and is unaware you are possessing it. You can’t communicate with the host directly, but you can cast mind-affecting spells or riding possession on the host as long as you can cast these spells as purely mental actions. Even if the spell you cast would normally affect more than one target or an area, it can affect only the host. If the host succeeds at a saving throw against a spell that you cast in this way, it immediately becomes aware that it is possessed, and if it was already aware, it receives another saving throw against riding possession. Protection from Evil and similar effects don’t expel you from the host, but they do prevent you from casting further spells from within your host until their durations expire.

Name: Seed of Undeath
MaterialComponents: A black onyx gem worth 25 gp per HD of the subject
Description: The subject’s face briefly takes on a gaunt, pale look and a death’s-head rictus before returning to normal.

Name: Shadow of Sin
Duration: Until end of turn or until discharged
Description: Your unholy symbol gleams with a foul, dark light that seems to reach towards your enemies.

Name: Shadow Ward
Description: The warded creature gains some protection against luminous powers. This spell absorbs 10 points of light damage or damage from spells with the light descriptor (such as from Sun Strike). This spell absorbs a maximum of 10 points of damage per caster level (up to a maximum of 150 points at 15th level), at which point the spell ends.

Name: Speak with Haunt
Description: You stir a haunt to a limited sense of awareness and consciousness, allowing it to answer questions. The spell’s range must reach any square within 10 feet of the haunt’s area. You must be aware of the haunt prior to casting the spell, and casting the spell does not trigger the haunt. You can ask one question per 2 caster levels. The haunt’s knowledge is limited to what its original creature knew during life, including the languages it spoke. A haunt often remembers the circumstance that led to its existence (though this recollection might be from the original victim’s perspective and therefore not objective), what triggers it, and how it can be laid to rest (destroyed). Answers are brief, cryptic, or repetitive, especially if the haunt is angry and vindictive.

Name: Spectral Weapon
Description: You summon forth semisolid shadow-stuff and force it to coalesce into a shape only you can wield. The shadow-formed weapon looks real at first glance, though it appears darkened as if perpetually in shadows. Wisps of shadow tendrils constantly follow the weapon as you move it about.

Name: Stiffen
Target: Living creature or creatures touched (up to one per level)
Description: Your touch progressively induces rigor mortis in the  flesh of creatures you touch. Once per round, you may deliver a touch attack that inflicts 1d4 points of Dexterity damage and slows the target (as the spell) for 1 round. A successful Fortitude save negates the slow effect but not the ability damage. A target reduced to 0 Dexterity is permanently paralyzed, their body resembling that of a stiff corpse.

Name: Umbral Infusion
Description: You infuse the target mindless undead creature with foul necromantic power, immediately granting it the advanced creature simple template. It gains a +2 bonus on all rolls, including damage rolls, a +2 bonus to special ability DCs, a +4 bonus to AC and CMD, and 2 additional hit points per Hit Die. The undead creature’s destructive instincts take hold for the duration of this spell, and any attempts to control or command the undead creature have a 50% chance of failing; if uncontrolled, the undead creature attacks any living creatures it sees. This spell has no effect on undead creatures that already have the advanced creature template.

Name: Undine's Curse
Description: The target loses its body’s natural ability to breathe automatically. As long as it remains conscious and is able to take physical actions, it keeps breathing and is able to function normally. If it is ever unconscious (including sleeping) or unable to take physical actions, it stops breathing and begins to suffocate. Creatures that do not have to breathe are immune to this spell.

Name: Unholy Blight
Description: You call up unholy power to smite your enemies. The power takes the form of a cold, cloying miasma of greasy darkness. Only good and neutral (not evil) creatures are harmed by the spell.

Name: Unholy Ward
Description: The warded creature gains partial protection against holy powers. This spell absorbs 10 points of holy damage (such as from Holy Weapon) or damage from good-aligned spells (such as Holy Smite). This spell absorbs a maximum of 10 points of damage per caster level (up to a maximum of 150 points at 15th level), at which point the spell ends.

Name: Vampiric Aura
Description: You channel the power of evil through your body and soul, infusing the area around you with a dark corruption. With each blow you strike against good, you feel invigorated and driven onward.

Name: Vampiric Hunger
Description: The target of this spell grows the fangs of a vampire, as well as a thirst for blood. For the duration of this spell, the target gains the ability to drain an opponent’s blood during a grapple; if the target establishes or maintains a pin, it drains blood, dealing 1d4 points of Constitution drain. Each round it drains blood in this way, the target heals 5 hit points (or gains 5 temporary vampiric hit points, if at full life) per point of Constitution drain dealt. Any temporary hit points gained go away when the spell ends. Multiple instances of temporary hit points gained by this spell stack (maximum 20+caster level temporary morbid hit points), but not with other sources of temporary vampiric hit points.

Name: Wake of Shadow
Duration: Until end of turn plus 1 round/level
Description: You and your mount lay down a trail of glowing, dark mist behind you as you move that makes passage easier for evil creatures but more difficult for good creatures. If you are not mounted when you cast wake of shadow, this spell fails. This glowing trail of mist appears behind your mount in a path starting where you cast the spell and ending where your mount ends its movement for the turn. The mist takes the form of a path 10 feet wide and up to 120 feet long. Thereafter, the mist persists for 1 round per level.

Name: Wood Rot Grasp
Target: One wooden object or one wooden creature
Description: Your hand is engulfed in mold and black energy, and can rot any wood that it touches (though it will not do so accidentally). This spell lasts for 1 round per level, and you can make one melee touch attack per round. You must succeed on a touch attack to strike a target. It can effectively destroy any wooden object. Such objects struck by wood rot grasp take 3d6 points of arcane damage +1 per caster level (maximum +15), ignoring hardness. You can also target a weapon being wielded or wooden armor being worn. Wooden armor affected by this takes normal damage from the spell and loses 1d6 points of Armor Class (to the maximum amount of protection the armor offers) through rot. If an item is reduced to 0 hit points, it is destroyed. Wooden creatures struck by the grasp take the same damage as objects.

Name: Angel Snare
MaterialComponents: A pouch of silvered powder worth 25 gp
Description: Your touch creates an invisible circle on a flat surface.

Name: Animate Legion
MaterialComponents: A black onyx gem worth 100 gp
Target: One or more corpses, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: You use negative energy to temporarily animate one or more corpses. You can create undead skeletons or zombies with this spell, but you can’t create more Hit Dice of undead than twice your caster level. The desecrate spell doubles this limit.

Name: Black Spot
Description: The black spot is a specific and feared curse among mariners, particularly pirates. An intangible black spot manifests on the palm of the target’s dominant hand and remains until the target dies or the curse is lifted. The black spot cannot be covered or hidden by any means, including illusions.

Name: Blade of Dark Triumph
Description: You strengthen the bond between your fiendish boon weapon and its unholy spirit. The weapon gains the ghost touch property. You may change your weapon’s damage type (bludgeoning, piercing, slashing) as a swift action. You gain a profane bonus to your CMD against disarm and sunder attacks directed at your boon weapon; this bonus is equal to half your caster level.

Name: Blight
Focus: A specially prepared vial containing a portion of a plant that died of a blight
Description: This spell withers a single plant of any size. An affected plant creature takes 1d6 points of damage per level (maximum 15d6) and may attempt a Fortitude saving throw for half damage. A plant that isn’t a creature doesn’t receive a save and immediately withers and dies.

Name: Bloodletting Strike
Description: Your next melee attack (if made before the end of the next round) lashes out at your opponent’s body, dark shadows ripping their way through their body. If the attack is successful, it deals an additional 1d4 points of Constitution damage. Spell resistance applies to this effect.

Name: Circlet of Enervation
Description: You form a small ring of negative energy around your wrist, which harms neither you nor your equipment. The circlet launches from your arm, and you must succeed on a ranged touch attack to strike your target. A struck creature takes 3d6 points of negative energy damage and gains one negative level (a Fortitude save negates the negative level).

Name: Contaminated Bond
MaterialComponents: Two flies
Target: One summoned creature or an animal companion, familiar, or other bonded creature
Description: You exploit the invisible, mystic connection between the target creature and its master to harm that master. Whenever the targeted creature is the target of a spell that deals hit point or ability damage, or ability drain, the target’s master is also considered to be a target of that spell. Such a master gains his normal defenses against the spell, such as a saving throw and spell resistance, and cannot be affected if he is on another plane of existence.

Name: Corrupt Heavy Protections
Description: You afflict the target with a large infusion of negative energy. The touched creature takes 5d4 points of negative energy damage plus 1 per two caster levels (maximum +12). In addition, on a failed save these creatures take an extra 5 point of damage from any weapon or physical attack capable of overcoming evil damage reduction for 1 minute.

Name: Cryptwarden's Grasp
Description: Your hand shrivels like the limb of a corpse as dark energy flows through your veins.

Name: Curse of Disgust
Description: You place a curse upon a creature, causing it to avoid the sight of a specific trigger, which is a kind of creature, object, or condition designated by you. When the target is within 30 feet of a trigger and is aware of the trigger, it gains the sickened condition and feels an urge to leave. A successful Will save negates the urge to leave, but the sickened condition persists as long as the target is within 30 feet of a trigger and aware of it. Example triggers include beggars, filthy clothing, diseased creatures, the king, blood, spiders, rats, corpses, and sewage.

Name: Dispel Good
Focus: A vial of mixed jet and silver dust
Target: Or s: You and a touched good creature from another plane, or you and an enchantment or good spell on a touched creature or object
Duration: 1 round/level or until discharged, whichever comes first
Description: This spell functions like Dispel Evil, except that you are surrounded by dark, wavering unholy energy, and the spell affects good creatures and spells rather than evil ones.

Name: Doom Scarabs
Description: A swarm of scarabs surges from your outstretched hand. These insects rip and bite at all living creatures in the area, then return to you with life essence stolen from their victims.

Name: Draining Touch
Description: You must succeed on a melee touch attack. Your touch deals 1d6 points of arcane damage per two caster levels (maximum 10d6) plus your Charisma modifier. You gain temporary vampiric hit points equal to the damage you deal. You can’t gain more than the subject’s current hit points plus the subject’s Constitution score (which is enough to kill the subject).  A subject damaged by this spell is exhausted for 1 minute. On a successful Fortitude save, they’re instead fatigued for 1 round. The temporary hit points disappear when this spell ends, typically 10 minutes after casting. If the temporary hit points are lost, this spell ends.

Name: Dreg Infusion
Description:
Negative energy suffuses your body. You take 5 hit points of negative energy damage per level, to a maximum of 75 points at 15th level.  If this damage heals you (such as if you’re an undead), you may reduce the healing this spell would do to add any one of the following to the spells effects:


	
	Reduce by 2 healing: Cure the dazzled condition.
		Reduce by 5 healing: Cure all ability damage to a single ability score.
		Reduce by 5 healing: Cure the exhausted and/or fatigued conditions.
		Reduce by 7 healing: Cure the nauseated and/or sickened conditions.
		Reduce by 9 healing: Attempt to purge yourself of all instances of disease, as per Remove Disease.
		Reduce by 10 healing: Cure the blinded condition as per [[Remove Blindness/Deafness]].
		Reduce by 10 healing: Cure the deafened condition as per [[Remove Blindness/Deafness]].
		Reduce by 12 healing: Attempt to purge yourself of all instances of poison, as per Neutralize Poison.

Name: Enervating Shadow Strike
Duration: Instantaneous and 10 minutes or 1 hour (see text)
Description: Your weapon becomes cloaked in an inky, black nimbus. As you strike your opponent, that energy flows into the wound and leaves him pale, weak, and shaking.

Name: Fangs of the Vampire King
Description: Hissing an evil laugh, you sprout sharp fangs to drain the blood of your foes.

Name: Grave Oath
MaterialComponents: Grave dirt mixed with powdered onyx worth at least 60 gp per HD of the target
Description: Grave oath functions much like Seed of Undeath, except as noted above and the nature of the undead creature is determined by the caster level of this spell, as per Create Undead. Unlike with Seed of Undeath, the created undead is not under your control. However, the creature is bound to carry out some specific service or task once it has risen. What this service or task is must be stated at the time of casting this spell. The creature will carry out that service or task to the best of its ability, never wavering for long without due cause, even if doing so would result in its certain destruction. Once the task or service is complete, the magic animating the subject ends and he returns to death.

Name: Greater Interrogation
Description: You question the target, backed up by the threat of magical pain. You may ask one question per caster level. The target can either answer the question or take 1d8 points of arcane damage plus your Charisma bonus. The target is not compelled to answer truthfully, but the threat of pain gives it a –4 penalty on Bluff checks to convince you when it is lying.

Name: Greater Open Wounds
Description: This spell deals 4d4 points of negative energy damage +1 point per caster level (maximum +20) to the target creature.

Name: Magic Jar
Focus: A gem or crystal worth at least 100 gp
Duration: 1 hour/level or until you return to your body
Description: By casting magic jar, you place your soul in a gem or large crystal (known as the magic jar), leaving your body lifeless. Then you can attempt to take control of a nearby body, forcing its soul into the magic jar. You may move back to the jar (thereby returning the trapped soul to its body) and attempt to possess another body. The spell ends when you send your soul back to your own body, leaving the receptacle empty. To cast the spell, the magic jar must be within spell range and you must know where it is, though you do not need line of sight or line of effect to it. When you transfer your soul upon casting, your body is, as near as anyone can tell, dead.

Name: Mass Ghostbane Dirge
Focus: An old reed from a wind instrument
Target: S: One incorporeal creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: This spell functions as Ghostbane Dirge, except that it affects multiple targets.

Name: Mass Inflict Light Wounds
Target: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: Negative energy spreads out in all directions from the point of origin, dealing 1d8 points of damage + 1 point per caster level (maximum +25) to nearby living enemies.

Name: Object Possession
Target: Unattended Large or smaller object (minimum Tiny)
Description: This spell functions as Lesser Object Possession, except as noted above. The possessed animated object has a number of Construction Points appropriate for its size (up to 3 CP for Large objects).

Name: Obscuring Shadow Veil
Description: Darkness surges around the next ranged or melee attack you make (if made before the end of your next round). If it hits, you deal an extra 1d4 points of shadow damage per 2 caster levels (maximum 10d4), and your opponent must make a successful Reflex save or suffer a 50% miss chance on all melee and ranged attacks for 1 round (otherwise treated as per, and not stacking with, total concealment). A successful Reflex save negates the miss chance, but not the extra damage.

Name: Possession
Description: You attempt to possess a creature by projecting your soul into its body. The target creature must be within spell range and you must know where it is, though you do not need line of sight or line of effect to it. When you transfer your soul upon casting, your body appears to be dead. Failure to take over a host ends the spell.

Name: Power Word Disable
Target: One living creature with 50 hp or less
Description: A word you speak puts your target on the brink of collapse.

Name: Relic Bane
MaterialComponents: A poorly drawn self-portrait on a thin sheet of paper, taking about 1 minute to make
Description: You curse a magic item, such as magical clothing, a suit of armor, or a weapon. The object is reduced to 1/4 its normal hit point total, gains the broken condition, and appears damaged and worn. While cursed, the item cannot be repaired above 1/4 its normal hit point total, and any efforts to remove the broken condition only last for a maximum of 1 day. If the item grants a numeric bonus, such as a +2 deflection bonus to AC, that bonus is reduced by 1 for every 3 caster levels you possess, to a minimum of +0. Other magical qualities fail to work 50% of the time when called upon, so a weapon’s flaming special ability could fail each time the item is used.

Name: Shadow Form
MaterialComponents: A small piece of cloth taken from a funeral shroud
Description: Shadows rise from the ground to envelop you. The shadows easily move with you, guiding your steps and how to hold your body. While this spell is in effect, you gain a number of benefits. The shadows wrapping your form grant you a +4 competence bonus on Escape Artist and Stealth checks. Your shadowy form also provides you with concealment. This shadowy concealment is not negated by a See Invisibility spell, but a True Seeing spell counteracts the effect. Standing within the radius of a Daylight spell or in bright natural sunlight temporarily suppresses the concealment effect.

Name: Shadow of Doubt
Description: You create a shadowy aura of doubt fueled by a foe’s own inner flaws.

Name: Soulswitch
Focus: Two brass collars worth 50 gp each
Description: You may only cast this spell if you currently have a familiar. You place your soul into the body of your familiar, and your familiar’s soul is placed in your body. This functions as if you possessed your familiar using Magic Jar; your familiar simultaneously possesses your body in the same manner. You can’t freely transfer your soul between your body and your familiar’s—if you choose to return to your body as a standard action, the spell ends. If either body is killed, both spirits return to their original bodies, the spell ends, and the original owner of the slain body dies.

Name: Stalker in the Night
Description: You slide through the dark like a bird of prey, emerging only to strike down your foe before sliding back into shadow’s welcoming embrace.

Name: Steal Years
MaterialComponents: A handful of ash
Description: You temporarily drain youth and vitality from the target and channel it into yourself. Your target must have the same creature type as you (but not necessarily the same subtypes). If the target fails its Fortitude save, it physically ages 1d4 years per two caster levels (maximum 5d4), and you decrease your age by the same number of years. If this changes the age category of you or the target, only adjust physical ability scores. This effect cannot bring your age to lower than the minimum age of adulthood for your race . This stolen youth does not actually change your age or prolong your life; you will still die at your allotted time, no matter how youthful you appear. Likewise, the spell does not add to the target’s true age, and cannot make the target die of old age.

Name: Suffocation
MaterialComponents: A vial containing a bit of the caster’s breath
Description: This spell forces the target’s lungs closed, causing swift suffocation.

Name: Symbol of Pain
MaterialComponents: Mercury and phosphorus, plus powdered diamond and opal worth a total of 1,000 gp
Description: When triggered, each creature within the radius of a symbol of pain suffers wracking pains that impose a -4 penalty on attack rolls, skill checks, and ability checks. These effects last for 1 hour after the creature moves farther than 60 feet from the symbol. Once triggered, the symbol becomes active and glows, lasting for 10 minutes per caster level. A creature that enters the area while the symbol is active is subject to its effect, whether or not that creature was in the area when it was triggered. A creature need save against the symbol only once as long as it remains within the area, though if it leaves the area and returns while the symbol is still active, it must save again.

Name: Transplant Visage
MaterialComponents: Parts of one corpse; see text
Description: This spell allows you to add a creature’s stolen face to or remove such a face that you’ve already applied from your own. Before casting this spell, you must remove the face and eyes of a creature that has been dead no longer than 1 minute per caster level and place it over your own. Once you cast transplant visage, the creature’s stolen skin magically melds with your own, making the expressions and eye color on your new face seem perfectly natural. Your new appearance grants you a +20 bonus on Disguise checks. Because the alteration made by transplant visage is instantaneous, there is no residual magical aura, and your new appearance is not recognized by detect spells. Transplant visage may be cast innumerable times, allowing a single caster to wear layers upon layers of stolen faces. However, only the topmost face is visible at any one time.

Name: Umbral Lance
Description: The eternal energies of light and darkness you call upon to cast this spell cause the ambient darkness near you to coalesce within the lantern in your hand. The darkness erupts in a black beam of shadow shaped like a needle-sharp lance.

Name: Unhallow
MaterialComponents: Herbs, oils, and incense worth at least 1,000 gp, plus 1,000 gp per level of the spell to be tied to the unhallowed area
Description:
Unhallow makes a particular site, building, or structure an unholy site. This has three major effects.


	
	First, the site or structure is guarded by a Magic Circle against Good effect.

Name: Vampiric Shadow Shield
Description: This spell wreathes you in shadowy energy and damages those that make melee attacks against you. Any creature that strikes you with its body or a handheld weapon deals normal damage, but at the same time the attacker takes 1d6 points of shadow damage + 1 point per caster level (maximum +15). If the attacker has spell resistance, it applies to this effect. Creatures wielding melee weapons with reach are not subject to this damage. When an attacker takes damage from the spell, you heal a number of hit points equal to 25% of the damage the spell dealt.

Name: Waves of Fatigue
Description: Waves of negative energy render all living creatures in the spell’s area fatigued. This spell has no effect on a creature that is already fatigued.

Name: Aura of Terror
Description: You speak a few curt words and your face is briefly overlaid with the image of a violet-shaded skull. The skull fades, but the nimbus of violet light remains around you.

Name: Circle of Death
MaterialComponents: A crushed black pearl worth 500 gp
Description: Circle of death snuffs out the life force of living creatures, killing them instantly. The spell slays 1d4 HD worth of living creatures per caster level (maximum 20d4). Creatures with the fewest HD are affected first; among creatures with equal HD, those who are closest to the burst’s point of origin are affected first. No creature of 9 or more HD can be affected, and HD that are not sufficient to affect a creature are wasted.

Name: Create Undead
MaterialComponents: A clay pot filled with grave dirt and an onyx gem worth at least 50 gp per HD of the undead to be created
Description:
A much more potent spell than Animate Dead, this evil spell allows you to infuse a dead body with negative energy to create more powerful sorts of undead: ghouls, ghasts, mummies, and mohrgs. The type or types of undead you can create are based on your caster level, as shown on the table below.

Name: Curse of the Outcast
MaterialComponents: A handful of earthworms
Description: Everything about the target seems off-putting and grating, and everyone he meets seems to see the worst in him. Whenever the target attempts a Bluff, Diplomacy, Intimidate, or Perform check (or similar social roll), he must roll twice and take the lower result.

Name: Damnation
Description: Damnation creates a pulse of disruptive necromantic energies, shattering any conjurer’s bond to a summoned creature in the area, destroying those creatures and corrupting the bond between the creatures and their conjurers.

Name: Dark Favor
Description: Drawing on the essence of darkness, your hands elongate and sprout fearsome, translucent claws that radiate a cold phosphorescent light, giving you two claw attacks per round (1d6 each if you are Medium creature, or 1d4 if you are Small) though the claws may instead be wielded as manufactured weapons. Each hit with one of these claw attacks inflicts 1 negative level on your target if they’re fueled by positive energy. The DC to overcome these negative levels is equal to the DC of this spell. For every negative level you inflict in this fashion, you gain 5 temporary vampiric hit points (up to a maximum of 50 temporary vampiric hit points). These temporary hit points go away when the spell ends. The claws do not interfere with your ability to cast spells or perform other actions that require hands.

Name: Decomposing Ray
MaterialComponents: A piece of rotting flesh
Description: You fling a dark ray of shadow suffused with necrotic energy at a creature, cutting through its flesh and causing it to rot away. If you succeed at a ranged touch attack with the ray, the target takes 1d6 points of shadow damage per caster level (maximum 20d6) and the targets damaged flesh begins to rot, sickening them for 1 round per level; a successful Fortitude save stops the creature from being sickened for the spell’s duration, but the rot still remains. All creatures within 5 feet of the creature at the beginning of their turn or that move through the area must also make a Fortitude save or become sickened for as long as they remain within 5 feet of the target and for 1d4 rounds thereafter.

Name: Demon's Strike
Description: Profane energies surge across your weapon. Your next melee attack this round is Evil aligned. If your attack hits and your opponent has a Good alignment, a blast of dark unholy energy erupts from them. The struck opponent takes an extra 1d10 points of unholy damage per 3 CL (max 6d10 at 18th level) and must succeed on a Fortitude save or take a -2 luck penalty on attack rolls for 1 minute. All other Good creatures within a 30 foot radius burst of the target creature must also succeed on a Fortitude save. Those who fail take the same amount of unholy damage dealt to the primary target and take a -2 luck penalty on attack rolls for 1 minute. A successful Fortitude save reduces to half damage and negates the attack penalty. Spell resistance applies to this effect, and prevents the burst if failed against the primary target.

Name: Dusk Shroud
Description: You shroud the target with the creeping darkness of night. In addition to casting darkness as a Deeper Darkness spell, the darkness is harmful to living creatures (other than the creature bearing the spell, should they be living). When the spell is cast, and at the beginning of each of your turns thereafter, such creatures take 1d6 points of shadow damage if within the darkness of the spell (out to 60 feet). If the subject is touched by a living creature using a touch attack, or if it hits the subject with a natural weapon or unarmed strike, it takes 1d6 points of shadow damage+1 point per caster level (maximum 1d6+15), with a Will saving throw negating the damage.

Name: Greater Shadow of Sin
Duration: Until end of turn or until discharged
Description: Your unholy symbol gleams with a corrupting, dark light that stretches towards your enemies.

Name: Grip of Orcus
Description: This spell functions like Clutch of Orcus, except it works against any creature that fails its Fortitude save.

Name: Harm
Description: Harm charges a subject with negative energy that deals 10 points of damage per caster level (to a maximum of 150 points at 15th level). If the creature successfully saves, harm deals half this amount. Harm cannot reduce the target’s hit points to less than 1.

Name: Mass Darkvision
MaterialComponents: Either a pinch of dried carrot or an agate
Target: One creature/level, no two of which are more than 30 ft. apart
Description: Each subject gains the ability to see 60 feet even in total darkness. Darkvision is black and white only but otherwise like normal sight.

Name: Mass Fester
MaterialComponents: Rotted meat
Target: S: One living creature/level, no two of which are more than 30 ft. apart
Description: This spell functions as Fester, except that it affects multiple foes.

Name: Mass Inflict Moderate Wounds
Target: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: This spell functions like Mass Inflict Light Wounds, except that it deals 2d8 points of damage plus 1 point per caster level (maximum +30).

Name: Ray of Entropy
Description: You release a crackling black ray. The smell of decay fills the air.

Name: Shadow Walk
Target: S: Up to one touched creature/level
Description: To use the shadow walk spell, you must be in an area of dim light or darkness. You and any creature you touch are then shifted along a coiling path of shadowstuff to the edge of the Material Plane where it borders the Shadow Lands. The effect is largely illusory, but the path is quasi-real. You can take more than one creature along with you (subject to your level limit), but all must be touching each other.

Name: Shadowy Grappler
MaterialComponents: A dried squid tentacle
Description: You feel a spectral force form near you, as if some intangible shadow being stood nearby. Upon choosing the target of your spell, you sense the shadowy force depart from your side, moving as fast as thought toward the creature you designated as your target. You see the target creature move as if attacked by an unseen foe.

Name: Symbol of Fear
MaterialComponents: Mercury and phosphorus, plus powdered diamond and opal worth a total of 1,000 gp
Description: When triggered, each creature within the radius of a symbol of fear become panicked for 1 round per caster level. Once triggered, the symbol becomes active and glows, lasting for 10 minutes per caster level. A creature that enters the area while the symbol is active is subject to its effect, whether or not that creature was in the area when it was triggered. A creature need save against the symbol only once as long as it remains within the area, though if it leaves the area and returns while the symbol is still active, it must save again.

Name: Anti-Life Shield
Description: You imbue the area with negative energy so powerful it sparks against any positive energy used to heal a creature in the area. Anyone in the area who attempts to use positive energy to heal a creature must succeed on a caster level check DC 11 plus your caster level (for supernatural abilities, creatures use their HD as their caster level when making this check). If the check fails, the healing is prevented and instead deals arcane damage to each of the effects targets equal to the effects caster level (or HD if a supernatural ability) instead of its normal effect.

Name: Awaken Undead
MaterialComponents: 25 gp worth of octel and onyx per Hit Die of the undead
Description: Whispering secret words to the undead before you, you call forth a glimmer of intelligence in its dead eyes.

Name: Blasphemy
Description: Any non-evil creature within the area of a blasphemy spell suffers the following ill effects, depending on their HD, whether the creature can hear the spell or not.

Name: Blessing of the Corrupt
Target: One weapon/level, no two of which are more than 30 ft. apart
Description: This spell makes all targeted weapons evil-aligned and deal an additional 1d6 points of unholy damage on hit. A weapon that is aligned can bypass the damage reduction of certain creatures. This spell has no effect on a weapon that already has an alignment other than evil. Every group of up to 50 projectiles (which must be together at the time of casting) counts as one weapon for the purpose of benefiting from this spell. This spell can be cast on both natural and manufactured weapons.

Name: Control Undead
MaterialComponents: A piece of bone and a piece of raw meat
Target: S: Up to 2 HD/level of undead creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: This spell enables you to control undead creatures for a short period of time. You command them by voice and they understand you, no matter what language you speak. Even if vocal communication is impossible, the controlled undead do not attack you. At the end of the spell, the subjects revert to their normal behavior.

Name: Cursed Blade
Description: Drawing upon dark powers, you whisper a vehement curse and draw your finger down the weapon.

Name: Greater Consumptive Field
Description: Sweeping your arm about and clutching it to your chest, you draw the last breaths of fallen foes from their choking mouths and inhale them to fuel your own power.

Name: Greater Grave Restoration
MaterialComponents: Jet dust worth 5,000 gp
Description: This spell functions like Lesser Grave Restoration, except that it dispels all permanent and temporary positive levels afflicting the healed creature. Greater grave restoration also dispels all magical effects penalizing the creature’s abilities, cures all temporary ability damage, and restores all points permanently drained from all ability scores. It also eliminates fatigue and exhaustion, and removes all forms of insanity, confusion, and similar mental effects.

Name: Greater Seed of Undeath
MaterialComponents: A great quality black onyx worth 5,000 gp
Target: Living or undead humanoid or animal touched
Description: The subject’s face briefly takes on a gaunt, pale look and a death’s-head rictus before returning to normal.

Name: Greater Steal Years
MaterialComponents: A handful of ash
Description: You temporarily drain a great deal of youth and vitality from the target and channel it into yourself. Your target must have the same creature type as you (but not necessarily the same subtypes). If the target fails its Fortitude save, it physically ages 1d6 years per two caster levels (maximum 10d6), and you decrease your age by the same number of years. If this changes the age category of you or the target, only adjust physical ability scores. This effect cannot bring your age to lower than the minimum age of adulthood for your race . This stolen youth does not actually change your age or prolong your life; you will still die at your allotted time, no matter how youthful you appear. Likewise, the spell does not add to the target’s true age, and cannot make the target die of old age.

Name: Heart Ripper
Description: Your hand turns spectral and surges with black, necrotic energies. You plunge your hand into your foe’s chest, ripping out their heart.

Name: Mass Bite the Hand
Target: One creature summoned by a spell or spell-like ability/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: This spell functions like Bite the Hand, except as noted above. The target creatures do not need to have all been summoned by the same being.

Name: Mass Castigate
Target: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: You reprimand the targets for their failures, real or imagined. On a failed save, targets cower with fear. On a successful save, they are instead shaken for 1 round. Each round on its turn, a cowering subject may attempt a new save to end the effect. A creature who worships the same god as you takes a -2 penalty on its Saving Throw.

Name: Mass Inflict Pain
Target: S: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart.
Description: This spell functions like Inflict Pain, except as noted above.

Name: Mass Inflict Serious Wounds
Target: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: This spell functions like Mass Inflict Light Wounds, except that it deals 3d8 points of damage plus 1 point per caster level (maximum +35).

Name: Phase Door
Duration: 10 minutes/level, or until used up (see text)
Description: Drawing on the power of the Shadow Lands, this spell creates an shadowy passage through wooden, plaster, or stone walls, but not other materials. The phase door is invisible and inaccessible to all creatures except you, and only you can use the passage. The door has a limited number of uses, one usage per two levels, after which the spell ends. You disappear when you enter the phase door and appear when you exit. If you desire, you can take one other creature (Medium or smaller) through the door. This counts as two uses of the door. A large creature can squeeze through with you, but it counts as 5 uses. The door does not allow light, sound, or spell effects through it, nor can you see through it without using it. Thus, the spell can provide an escape route, though certain creatures, such as phase spiders, can follow with ease. True Seeing or similar magic reveals the presence of a phase door but does not allow its use.

Name: Plague Bearer
Description: You make the target an asymptomatic carrier for a host of virulent diseases. Creatures that end their turn adjacent to the target must succeed at a Fortitude save or be affected as if by the spell Contagion. The target itself does not become diseased, and suffers no ill effects from this spell. Once plague bearer ends, the target is no longer contagious, though any creature it infected remains diseased.

Name: Power Word Blind
Target: One creature with 200 hp or less
Description:
You utter a single word of power that causes a creature to become blinded, whether the creature can hear the word or not. The duration of the spell depends on the target’s current hit point total. Any creature that currently has 201 or more hit points is unaffected.

Name: Ravenous Darkness
Focus: A black iron rod inlaid with black onyx and ravenar worth 500 gp
SavingThrow: None or Fortitude negates; see text
Description: Tendrils of shadow leap from the object you’ve touched, then swiftly form into an all-encompassing wave. The spreading night seems to blot out both light and life.

Name: Shadow Arrow
Focus: The arrow or bolt to be fired
Description: This spell is cast upon an arrow or bolt, transforming it into pure black shadow. In addition to its normal damage, a shadow arrow deals an additional 2d6 shadow damage, 1d6 points of Strength damage and 1d6 points of Wisdom damage. The arrow or bolt must be fired during the same round the spell is cast, or the magic dissipates and is lost. The projectile is destroyed even if it misses its target.

Name: Shadow Trap
MaterialComponents: A sheet of black cloth large enough to drape over the warded object, plus a black onyx worth 25 gp
Target: One object that casts a shadow
Description: With this spell, you place a magic ward on any object that casts a shadow. If the object is disturbed in any way that causes its shadow to shift (for instance, if it or a nearby light source is moved), a conjured Greater Shadow (Greater Shadow) emerges from the object’s shadow to attack the nearest creature within 100 ft (or attacking the first creature to get within range) and always gets a surprise round in combat. Anyone viewing the object with detect magic sees an aura of conjuration; true seeing reveals the spirit in the objects shadow, appearing as a vague, hazy silhouette, and anyone viewing with it through such means can similarly participate in a surprise round with the creature (possibly negating the surprise round entirely).

Name: Symbol of Weakness
MaterialComponents: Mercury and phosphorus, plus powdered diamond and opal worth a total of 5,000 gp
Description: When triggered, each creature within the radius of a symbol of weakness suffers crippling weakness that deals 3d6 points of Strength damage. Once triggered, the symbol becomes active and glows, lasting for 10 minutes per caster level. A creature that enters the area while the symbol is active is subject to its effect, whether or not that creature was in the area when it was triggered. A creature need save against the symbol only once as long as it remains within the area, though if it leaves the area and returns while the symbol is still active, it must save again.

Name: Unholy Sword
Description: This spell allows you to channel the powers of evil into your sword, or any other melee weapon you choose. The weapon acts as a +5 unholy weapon (+5 enhancement bonus on attack and damage rolls, extra 2d6 damage against good opponents). It also emits a magic circle against good effect (as the spell). If the magic circle ends, the sword creates a new one on your turn as a free action. The spell is automatically canceled 1 round after the weapon leaves your hand. You cannot have more than one unholy sword at a time.

Name: Vampiric Weapon
Description: This spell allows you to channel consumptive power into a melee weapon, turning it into a dark blade that steals vital energy from your foes. The weapon acts as a +4 Greater Vampiric weapon. The spell is automatically canceled 1 round after the weapon leaves your hand. You cannot have more than one vampiric weapon at a time.

Name: Wail of Doom
Duration: Instantaneous + 1 round/level or 1 round; see text
Description: You unleash a terrible cry of malice and anger. The very air darkens with black energy as your cry echoes away from you.

Name: Antipathy
Focus: A lump of alum soaked in vinegar
Target: One location (up to a 10-ft. cube/level) or one object
Description: You cause an object or location to emanate magical vibrations that repel either a specific kind of intelligent creature or creatures of a particular alignment, as defined by you. The kind of creature to be affected must be named specifically. A creature subtype is not specific enough. Likewise, the specific alignment to be repelled must be named.

This spell functions like Create Undead, except that you can create more powerful and intelligent sorts of undead: shadows, wraiths, spectres, and devourers. The type or types of undead created is based on caster level, as shown below.

Name: Greater Bestow Curse
Description: Greater bestow curse functions as Bestow Curse except with the following changes:

Name: Greater Possession
Description: This spell functions as Possession, but when you possess a host, You enter the host’s body and your physical body vanishes. You are ejected to the closest empty square upon expiration of the spell or upon the host’s death.

Name: Heartseeking Strike
Description: Your next melee attack (if made before the end of the next round) cuts deep into your opponent’s body, inky darkness slicing their way towards your opponent’s heart. If the attack is successful, it deals an additional 2d4 points of Constitution damage. Spell resistance applies to this effect.

Name: Horrid Wilting
MaterialComponents: A drop of swamp water
Target: Living creatures, no two of which can be more than 60 ft. apart
Description: This spell corrupts moisture in the body of each subject living creature, turning it to swamp water. This deals 1d6 points of arcane damage per caster level (maximum 20d6). This spell is especially devastating to water elementals and plant creatures, which instead take 1d8 points of arcane damage per caster level (maximum 20d8).

Name: Mass Contagion
Description: Forcing a hacking cough, you complete the spell. In the area you’ve designated, you see swirling black mist rise up, accompanied by the distant sound of your echoing cough.

Name: Mass Inflict Critical Wounds
Target: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: This spell functions like Mass Inflict Light Wounds, except that it deals 4d8 points of damage plus 1 point per caster level (maximum +40).

Name: Mass Umbral Infusion
Target: One mindless undead/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart
Description: This spell functions like Umbral Infusion, except that it affects multiple creatures.

Name: Orb of the Void
Description: You create a small weightless sphere of pure negative energy. As a move action, you can move it up to 30 feet per round in any direction. If it enters a space with a creature fueled by positive energy, it stops moving for the round and that creature gains one negative level (Fortitude negates). Any such creature passing through or ending its turn in the space occupied by the sphere gains one negative level (Fortitude negates). Twenty-four hours after gaining a negative level from the sphere, the subject must make a Fortitude saving throw (the DC of this save is equal to the DC of this spell) for each negative level. If the save succeeds, that negative level is removed. If it fails, that negative level becomes permanent.

Name: Soulreaver
Description: A wave of shadows suffused with necromantic energies explodes outward, dealing 1d6 points of shadow damage per caster level (maximum 20d6) and one negative level to creatures in the area. A successful fortitude save halves the damage and the individual does not take the negative level.

Name: Symbol of Death
MaterialComponents: Mercury and phosphorus, plus powdered diamond and opal worth a total of 5,000 gp
Description: When triggered, a symbol of death kills one or more creatures within 60 feet of the symbol (treat as a burst) whose combined total current hit points do not exceed 150. The symbol of death affects the closest creatures first, skipping creatures with too many hit points to affect. Once triggered, the symbol becomes active and glows, lasting for 10 minutes per caster level or until it has affected 150 hit points’ worth of creatures, whichever comes first. A creature that enters the area while the symbol is active is subject to its effect, whether or not that creature was in the area when it was triggered. A creature need save against the symbol only once as long as it remains within the area, though if it leaves the area and returns while the symbol is still active, it must save again.

Name: Touch of the Graveborn
Description: Your hand grows numb and pulses with a deep and sickly radiance, the chill of the grave emanating from it.

Name: Unholy Aura
Target: S: One creature/level in a 20-ft.-radius burst centered on you
Description:
A malevolent darkness surrounds the subjects, protecting them from attacks, granting them resistance to spells cast by good creatures, and weakening good creatures when they strike the subjects. This abjuration has four effects:


	
	First, each warded creature gains a +4 deflection bonus to AC and a +4 resistance bonus on saves. Unlike the effect of protection from good, this benefit applies against all attacks, not just against attacks by good creatures.
		Second, each warded creature gains spell resistance 25 against good spells and spells cast by good creatures.
		Third, the abjuration protects the recipient from possession and mental influence, just as protection from good does.
		If a good creature succeeds on a melee attack against a warded creature, the offending attacker takes 1d6 points of Strength damage (Fortitude negates).

Name: Trap the Soul
MaterialComponents: Gem worth 1,000 gp per HD of the trapped creature
Description: Trap the soul forces a creature’s life force (and its material body) into a gem. The gem holds the trapped entity indefinitely or until the gem is broken and the life force is released, which allows the material body to reform. If the trapped creature is a powerful creature from another plane, it can be required to perform a service immediately upon being freed. Otherwise, the creature can go free once the gem imprisoning it is broken.

Name: Abyssal Army
Description:

Name: Canopic Conversion
MaterialComponents: Black onyx worth 100 gp per hit die of the target; see text
Focus: Four alabaster canopic jars worth 100 gp each
Description: This spell eviscerates the target, drawing forth his life essence as well as his internal organs. The target takes 1d6 points of arcane damage per caster level (maximum 20d6). If this damage kills the target, the spell pulls his organs into a set of 4 canopic jars and seals them; 1d4 rounds later, the corpse revives as an undead with the Dread Mummy Template. The black onyx required for this spell is only consumed if a creature is killed by this spell.

Name: Energy Drain
Description: You let lose a coruscating black ray of negative energy that powerfully suppresses the life force of any creature healed by positive energy that it strikes. You must make a ranged touch attack to hit. If you hit, the subject gains 2d4 temporary negative levels (see Positive and Negative Levels). Negative levels stack.

Name: Imprisonment
Description: When you cast imprisonment and touch a creature, it is entombed in a state of suspended animation (see the Temporal Stasis spell) in a small sphere far beneath the surface of the ground. The subject remains there unless a Freedom spell is cast at the locale where the imprisonment took place. Magical search by a crystal ball, a Locate Object spell, or some other similar divination does not reveal the fact that a creature is imprisoned, but Discern Location does. A Wish spell will not free the recipient, but will reveal where it is entombed. If you know the target’s name and some facts about its life, the target takes a -4 penalty on its save.

Name: Mass Suffocation
MaterialComponents: A vial containing a bit of the caster’s breath
Target: S: 1 per caster level, no two of which may be more than 30 feet apart
Description: This spell functions as Suffocation except as noted above.

Name: Power Word Kill
Target: One living creature with 100 hp or less
Description: You utter a single word of power that instantly kills one creature of your choice, whether the creature can hear the word or not. Any creature that currently has 101 or more hit points is unaffected by power word kill.

Name: Rain of Black Roses
MaterialComponents: A fresh black rose
Description: Black roses fall from the sky. The roses explode with unholy energy upon striking good creatures, each of which takes 5d6 points of unholy damage whenever they begin their turn or pass through Rain of Black Roses. In addition, creatures that take damage from Rain of Black Roses must make a Fortitude save. Those that fail the Fortitude save are nauseated (unable to attack, cast spells, concentrate on spells, perform any task requiring concentration, or take anything other than a single move action per turn) as long as the creature is in the area and for 1d4+1 rounds after it leaves. A creature that exits the spell’s area and enters again must begin making Fortitude saves against the nausea effect again.

Name: Soul Bind
Description: You draw the soul from a newly dead body and imprison it in a black sapphire gem. The subject must have been dead no more than 1 round per caster level. The soul, once trapped in the gem, cannot be returned through Clone, Raise Dead, Reincarnation, Resurrection, True Resurrection, or even a Wish. Only by destroying the gem or dispelling the spell on the gem can one free the soul (which is then still dead).

Name: Symbol of Vulnerability
MaterialComponents: Mercury and phosphorus, plus powdered diamond and opal worth a total of 15,000 gp
Description: When triggered, each creature within the radius of a symbol of vulnerability  receive a –4 penalty to spell resistance and a –4 penalty on saving throws, and energy resistances and damage reduction (if any) are reduced by 10 each (to a minimum of 0). Once triggered, the symbol remains active for 10 minutes per level. The effects last as long as the creature is within 60 feet of the symbol, and for 1 round per caster level afterward.

Name: Unholy Exile
Description: With a word, your body gives off an explosion of unholy energy, scorching the flesh of those creatures despised by evil beings. All good creatures in the area take 20d6 points of unholy damage. A successful Will save reduces this damage by half, creatures with a good subtype take a -4 penalty on their save against this spell.

Name: Wail of the Banshee
Target: One living creature/level within a 40-ft.-radius spread
Description: When you cast this spell, you emit a terrible, soul-chilling scream laced with deadly necromantic energy that can easily slay any creature it touches. The spell affects up to one creature per caster level, inflicting 10 points of arcane damage per caster level. On a successful Fortitude save, the creature takes 3d6 points of arcane damage plus 1 point per caster level (max +20). Creatures closest to the point of origin are affected first (choose randomly among those equidistant).
